review_body: If you are visiting Honolulu on a budget this hotel is good... although not on Waikiki beach it is within a 10 minute walk. But this is a “budget” hotel. No bells and whistles... pool is not really much of anything... decor is dated (think 1980s Holiday Inn). The staff is friendly but the cleaning staff unfortunately tended to be smokers so after my room was cleaned I would come in to that smell and would have to open the patio doors to air it out so I just started putting the do not disturb on the door so they wouldn’t clean.

Came in late and this hotel was so great! Front desk is so kind, nice and helpful. Room was clean and the beds were so comfy. Wish we could have stayed here for more nights. Central to everything you need or want.

2 nights here. Bed was comfortable shower pressure was good, room was a good size. Hotel and rooms a bit dated but it seems most hotels here are...Fantastic location central to everything can walk everywhere. Included in the resort fee... pink line bus which is handy....Would stay again

We had a large, comfortable room with king size bed, a very quiet room on the 14th floor, although it overlooked Kuhio Avenue. The staff were all very friendly & helpful and those on the front desk gave us a lot of useful advice. We were able to make use of the large swimming pool at Ohana Waikiki East, less than 5 minutes walk, the Malia only having an indoor lap pool. The hotel is located in a very pleasant area & we felt very safe when walking out to restaurants & bars at night.

The property is in a decent location with courteous, friendly employees. Definitely not worth $250+ a night, however- as there are hotels just as nice for about 1/2 this rate all around Honolulu. Tried to sign up for their frequent guest program, was unable to do so due to glitch in system. After a trip to the front desk, calling Outrigger Central in Colorado- they had to call me back to give me my special Discovery membership number. When I inquired if my number was plugged into my current stay's folio, the clerk says "I'm sorry, but we don't participate in that program." What the hell ?? Why did I sign up for your frequent guest program ?? What's my incentive to stay here again ?? What a waste of time. Offering a frequent guest program that only certain Outrigger Hotels utilize, good luck trying to decipher which ones do. Forget this place, will never return- after going through this nonsense today.

I stayed at this hotel with a friend, as we were looking for something well located but still cheap (which is hard to find in waikiki). The hotel was ok. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were of a decent size (we had 1.5 beds and a small balcony facing the street). On the other hand they can't call this bath tub a pool cause it is really not one!! But since the ocean is pretty close by, we didn't really need it. I also get that the hotel is old and would probably need a bit of renovations, but it could be cleaner I have to admit... but beds were clean and comfortable, which is what is important in the end! But the hotel employees were what we loved the most about that place. They were always there help us and answer all of our questions. I would recommand the Ohana waikiki Malia hotel.

Great little hotel in the heart of Waikiki, a short stroll to the beach , with many shopping facilities great restaurants a free transportation system to get around with a hop on hop off wherever you please . A nice drinking hole and restaurant

The staff is wonderful, friendly accommodating and hard-working. The location is so fun. You can walk to the beach or places to eat and it’s awesome waking up and looking out over a bustling island city. My feedback is more for the parent company—outrigger, because I believe that the issues with this hotel need to be addressed by them. This hotel is badly neglected. We had a one bedroom kitchenette in the Luana tower and it was hard to get comfortable because everything in the room appears as if it’s been there since the 70’s. I don’t mind the oldschool beachy style of the rooms but the lamps, wallpaper, drapes and furniture actually look and feel like they’ve been there for decades. Very old and in poor condition. Housekeeping was great about tidying but there are some things the owners need to address—like throwing out old, grimy upholstered chairs and benches, putting fitted sheets on the beds and a vanity in the bathroom. Instead of a regular fitted and flat sheet our beds had a bare mattress with a blanket folded on top of it for extra cushioning and a flat sheet tucked in on top of that, followed by another flat sheet and the flowered bedspreads. They were great about bringing extra pillows and blankets as needed but I thought the lack of fitted sheets and the extra blanket between the mattress and sheet was really odd. There was nothing but a tiny glass shelf directly above the toilet in the bathroom so if your toiletries don’t fit on the little shelf you must place them on the back of the toilet. Either way you risk dropping your belongings in the toilet. The water pressure was great but bathroom fixtures are rusty, the grout is black, there was what appeared to be a blood stain on one of the flower printed bed covers and there were stains (from food?) all over the nasty yellow wall paper. The green carpet is separating from the baseboards and in the space under the counter where the mini fridge was there was a huge gap next to the fridge where the top layer of flooring was missing leaving whatever is under the floor exposed. Like others said there are hardly any outlets and you have to reach behind old furniture to access them. The lamps are so old and dusty-looking that I didn’t want to touch them to turn them on. It is well past time for outrigger to throw out the old, tired, wooden and upholstered furniture. Also, we paid resort and hotel fees upfront so no surprises there but I didn’t like that there was a random unauthorized $50 hold that was placed (and eventually released) on my account the day we checked out. TL;DR Nice staff and fantastic location but I would not recommend this hotel and I would not stay here again unless they replaced the flooring, wallpaper, drapes and furniture at minimum.

Excellent location of the hotel. Rooms were ok, but could've  been nicer. However,  we didn't spend a lot of time in the rooms, we were out every morning.  Beds were uncomfortable,  outdated furniture and no tub. Only showerAlso, the maids don't wash or wipe the kitchen,  coffee carafe, dishes or microwave (I cleaned it myself).  So....it wasn't as clean as I would've liked. Look at pics. Dust n food particles. Grimy finger prints on the kettle.Maids were annoying and constantly knocking on the door. I'll probably stay elsewhere if I go back.

Location is good, 10 minutes from the beach and 15 minutes from the Hawaii Convention Center, with plenty of restaurants nearby. The wardrobe was very dusty and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while. I told the reception but still it wasn't cleaned. Service was ok. I got a good deal compared to other Waikiki hotels.

Walked in and it smelled musty. Charges a resort fee but has no right to call it self a resort. Looks like it’s from the 1970s.. ugliest wallpaper and small bathroom I have ever seen. Did not give us the room that are travel agent booked and we paid for. Maybe update your hotel and then call yourself a resort and maybe don’t put misleading untrue pictures of your hotel on your website. Will stay in a Hilton next time .. a hotel that can be trusted and not lie to people like this hotel does. Save more money folks and stay someone nicer! Shame on this hotel for false advertisement!

The hotel has a great location as it is central to everything and a short walk to the beach. It is also attached to an IHOP. We didn’t know that we had access to the trolley with our room key until the last day so make sure to ask about freebies. The rooms were grimy and the microwave looked like it hadn’t been cleaned in awhile. The staff was friendly and for a budget it was decent but don’t expect to relax in your room as the beds aren’t too comfy.

Even though the hotel rooms and the furniture seemed a little outdated, the central location was very convenient. The rooms had two twins and one queen bed, why can't more hotels provide this? For a family of four, it was so helpful to get enough sleep due to the convenient sleeping situation. All the staff were very friendly, accomodating and very patient in answering our questions and helping with our needs. We had a very comfortable stay here due to the wonderful staff. Thank you.

1. I found a spider in my bed.... no wonder since the room and the furniture are very old. 2. The bathroom is very tight. The closet glass door goes out of rail, I had to fix it myself.2. The concierge staff named Manny is very rude. I booked a two double beds room for me and my hub. He asked me twice how many ppl are there in my room, even after I confirm it’s for 2. It’s none of your business whether or not we sleep in the same bed!!!With the same amount of money, I’d rather live in an Airbnb out of Waikiki and rent a car!

If you're going to Oahu..and you haven't got a fortune to spend.. this is the place for you. Just a 5minute walk from Waikiki beach.. it's at the centre of everything going on in the area. Very friendly and helpful staff ..clean rooms.. couldn't ask for more.

We booked through a travel agent. This hotel is a little older but very clean. The room was great for 3 unrelated guests: a queen, 2 twin beds and kitchenette. It is in the heart of Waikiki. Everything is in walking distance or your room key hives you access to a trolley. The staff are friendly and helpful. Highly suggest you stay here!

Spent a long weekend at this hotel & had an absolutely wonderful time. Staff are friendly, helpful and courteous. Rooms are clean, quiet, comfortable and roomy. Location super convenient. Will be back!

This hotel is very convenient to take trolley buses, so I always select package tour of the hotel. Coffee and tea are prepared in the room with a coffee maker, it is good for breakfast.As same as other hotels, shower is not so good to use. I recommend Japanese one when you renovate next time!!??The staff members are friendly and kind,

This is an email I sent to Napua Ho Senior Sales Manager - I am a travel agent and took 21 guests to the hotel.I must say that you are a part of a super organization. The hotel and amenities were great. Clean and Comfortable. All of your staff, I only got Robert's name, were very efficient, helpful and kind to us. Every member of the group sends their thanks for all you did for us. Thanks again and I will for sure refer your hotel to any client that is seeking accommodation in Honolulu.

My son and I spent a week at this hotel and had a wonderful time. We had a one bedroom unit and it was comfortable and spacious. Located in the Center of Waikiki made everything within easy walking distance. The staff were very helpful, friendly and courteous. A special thank you to our pleasant housekeeper and All the front desk staff, especially Shawn, Victor, Troy and Pam, You guys made us feel so welcome. I would request this hotel in future travels. Thank you for a wonderful visit.

This is the second time I’ve stayed at this hotel & will again.I love that it’s basically in one of the best locations in Waikiki, central to everything.I suggest including the resort fee in the price of the accommodation. Having WiFi & the pink trolley is great, plus I use my drawstring bag all the time.I can’t wait to come back.

Friendly and helpful staff and located in the middle of it all. Walkable to any of Waikiki's destinations. Pam at the front desk was especially pleasant with a friendly smile. For the price I was very satisfied and taken care of during my stay. Would return.

I stayed here with my partner and family before they left and I did some solo travel (my next accommodation was a nightmare and Iwould have come straight back to the Ohana Malia but you were booked out). The hotel was lovely - staff were always so friendly and helpful. Rooms were spacious and clean. I do wish that the rooms had a microwave rather than having to go use a communal one on another level but it’s not a huge deal. It was super handy to have free access to the bus around Waikiki that stopped right out front. We really loved the local bar next door, Rivals Sports Lounge - it became our local. Definitely recommend this hotel.

I stayed here for 6 nights and would definitely stay again. I wasn't satisfied with my first room for a several reason, I think it was located in the old part of the building. But luckily I was able to change the room and the new room was great. It was a newer, spacious room and a huge bed with a great pillow selection. The room was very clean, Wi-Fi worked well in the room. The service in the reception was great, especially Pam was amazing. Location of the hotel is just the best. It's in the center of Waikiki so all of the shopping centers and restaurant are right outside and there is just a few minutes walk to the beach. Bus stops are right next to the hotel so it's easy to explore Oahu and see other places/beaches/towns as well. The hotel offers a free shuttle bus to Ala Moana Center and there's also two great and calm beaches near by, if the Waikiki beach feels too crowded.

our room was clean and nice. the elevator service to the parking garage was a joke. Played elevator tag with 2 other elevators before you could get the right elevator to open. It was also inconvient for ice or use of a microwave as they are located only on the 9th floor. also the refrigerator is on a timer so your items didn't stay cold most of the time. I definitely wouldn't stay there again. You would expect more from a hotel that was $200. plus per night.
user_name:
Glenna H
Aberdeen, Idaho, United States

review_body: What a rip off, we had to pay us$25.30 per day for the use of a small pool aprox 5m x 2m & the use of a small towel. Totally inadequate sized towel. They had the hide to charge us$20.00 if this was not returned. When you are paying us$200.00 per night this is over the top.Our room was clostrophobically small with inadequate lighting.Americans do not know how to make a decent cup of tea. The secret is to use boiling hot water. This hotel & US hotels in general, need to learn that they need to provide an electric jug to enable travellers to produce a decent cup of tea. This has now got me started, why when paying over us$200.00 night, why isn't fresh milk as opposed to powdered milk.We are both seniors & getting into the combination bath shower is now a challenge & potentially dangerous. Ray & Judy Pedley

My family and I stayed here for 6 nights and had a wonderful experience. The location is incredible, central to everything in Waikiki with great food places and shops all within walking distance. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The wi-fi was excellent and very fast. The filtered water station near the pool area was great. Our room on the 7th floor was very clean and loved that we couldn’t hear any of the street noise especially at night-time. The IHOP, rivals sports bar and pizza place attached to the hotel was fantastic. We also absolutely loved that our room key gave us unlimited access to the pink line which takes you to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre but also stops all throughout Waikiki. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be staying here again the next time I visit.

Just starting our 10 day stay in Wailiki at the Ohana Waikiki Malia. Got in late last nite and check-in was a breeze. Hotel is older but clean and everything works A1 (room fridge, A/C, hot water, room safe etc.). Your room key gives you free access to the Pink Line Trolly which is a great way to travel to the Ala Moana Center (shopping mall) or any where along Waikiki Beach. There is an IHOP in the same building and a hole-in-the-wall Pizza spot that is well rated that we are trying tonite for supper. There is an ABC Store right across the intersection and they have everything you need for the room (beer+snacks). Great value Hotel - we paid ~$1300 (CAD) for airfare and the hotel for 10 days from Halifax, Nova Scotia. There is, of course, a resort fee (all the hotels I checked have it here in Waikiki similar to Vegas), it is ~$25 (USD) a nite - even with the fee this is an awesome deal!!!

A large spacious room close to shops, restaurants, public transport, tourist attractions and the beach.The rooms are a little dated but are very clean. Staff are very helpful.My husband was delighted that the Ihop was just downstairs.

Excellent value for the price. Fairly quiet, but air conditioning in room was a bit noisy at night. Firm beds, clean and staff are very accommodating in the hotel and at the IHOP. Wifi was good, good area, and the free bus was a bonus! A huge thank you to all the staff at the Malia for making our trip to Honolulu fantastic...!

The first room was awful in the Malia wing. Then they moved us to the Tower and then it was wonderful. MAKE SURE YOU STAY IN THE TOWER. Robert and Peter was very helpful. We were there for 8 days. IHOP restaurant in the hotel. Also a great bar. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Booked tours from the hotel.

I had a great experience staying at Ohana Malia Waikiki. The staff was friendly and helpful, the hotel was very clean and the view from our room was delightful. The location is also ideal, as there is easy access to bus stops, the pink line trolley and the beach is a short stroll away. It was perfect. Mahalo.

We stayed for a week. Location is awesome for shopping, eating out and close to the beach or just taking in all the night time activities. Staff are very friendly and super helpful. Victor springs to mind but there were others also. If you are a lover of Pancakes-IHOP is right there. Trolley bus stop is just outside and most of our Tour bus drivers picked us up from the Hotel or around the corner. Rooms are nice enough, spacious and cleaned daily. Was not used to night time aircon noise but earplugs solved that problem. Staff at this Hotel is what makes it a great place.

It was an excellent service and hospitalityI could have a great trip with my motherThank you very much especially Mr.Ken san He was very helpful. 先月母とこちらのホテルを利用させて頂きました。日本人のケンさんという方のお陰で最後まで安心して過ごすことができました。 最終日空港までのバスを予約していたのですが天候が悪く1時間以上たっても来ませんでした。その際レセプションにいらっしゃったケンさんという方がバス会社と取り合ってくださりお客様が大勢いるにも関わらず何度も気にかけて下さいました。初めての母との2人旅でしたがケンさんのお陰で素晴らしい旅行になりました。またハワイに行く際はこちらのホテルに泊まろうと思います。ありがとうございました。

I stayed here recently with 3 friends for 2 nights before a cruise and 1 night after the cruise. We booked a one bedroom which had a separate room with a queen bed and balcony. There was a separate kitchen area with sink, microwave and small fridge and then the living room had two twin beds. It was perfect for us. The room seemed older and outdated but it was clean. Staff were wonderful when we checked in late the first night, struggling with jet lag after traveling for almost 24 hours to get there! There is an IHOP restaurant attached to the hotel and a pizza place near the front door. Great location for walking to the beach and shopping. Your room card gives you free access to the trolley that will take you all over the area. Of course, you pay for it when you are charged a resort fee of $25/night. That also covers wi-fi. I recommend this hotel if you aren't looking for high end accommodations.

We stayed here for eight days. Very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff, clean rooms and, most important, quiet at night! Location is perfect, close to Waikiki Beach, Restaurants, Shopping....you name it! Thank you for making our vacation perfect!

My husband and myself stayed here for 8 nights. The location is Fantastic right in the heart of Waikiki. It has a bar next door, IHOP restaurant and a pizza place.The staff were always friendly, There was a gym, pool, spa, and laundry. Yes the pool and spa are small... but you are in Hawaii surrounded by amazing beaches. This will be our new go to place for accommodation. Such a reasonable price..

This hotel is a very comfortable place to stay. The staff at the lobby desk were always pleasant and friendly. Even the parking staff was very friendly and always offered a warm greeting.The room and bathroom were very clean - towels in good shape.Sheets, mattress and pillows were all in good shape. The floor was spotless. For these things I would highly recommend the hotel. It is also reasonably close to Waikiki beach.The hotel seemed to be relatively quiet - we never heard any of the other guests with a few minor exceptions which was not an issue. Now for the not so good stuff. With the balcony door closed, we could still hear the late night action. Some of it was entertaining, but we wanted to sleep. The parking garage was clean and safe, but very tight parking spots and turns. It isn't necessary to have a car since the hotel offers free rides on the Waikiki Trolley pink line, and pick up from the hotel - but we needed a car to move our daughter into the dorm at the university.

We went to a few times this hotel. Every times were great.There are near beach and many shop.I can speak English a little.But this hotel's staff 'Kayo' can speak Japanese.We can speak Japanese.We can check in very easy!

We are Japanese visiter, so we couldn’t have enough communication. But the stuff were very kind and understood our Japanese English. The placement was wonderful.It was convenient to go shopping.There is The Royal Hawaiian Center.We enjoyed our trip there!

I have no words here. We had no choice after we extended having previously stayed at the Beachcomber by Outrigger, I'll start off by saying the urine smell in the hall ways was enough to make you want to walk back.Inside walls have mould on them. The aircon has a dust smell and as soon as you walk in and turn it on. This hotel is very pricey to book and being it was our only option we had no choice to book it and now deeply regret this decision. You also have drunk people outside the hotel and that annoying noise of the aircon machines outside our window is enough to make you want to sleep outside. The only positive here is the friendly staff members who have been so understanding.

We just checked out after five amazing nights at the Ohana Malia. We got a one bedroom with two twins and a queen with a kitchenette for the four of us: my two-year-old, five-year-old, my husband and I. It was so nice to have a door to close and have a little bit of grown up time at the end of a beautiful beach day. The room was clean and comfortable and we felt right at home. We stocked up the fridge with food for breakfast in the room from the many nearby ABC stores and Longs too! Saved us so much money. Also there is a late night pizza window connected to the hotel which we hit up more than once! Having free access to the Pink Line trolley made the visit so easy. We went all over the place on the double decker which thrilled the kids every time. This location is amazing! All of Waikiki is right outside your door and easily walkable. Super safe, super fun neighborhood with lots of great food. The staff is warm and kind and so welcoming. We were able to check in late and they held our bags for us until our red-eye flight after checkout. If you are looking for a great price, amazing service, and an awesome location without all the fussy fake luxury of the big chain resorts, you will be so happy with your stay at the Ohana Malia! Mahalo so much for showing us the spirit of Hawaii!! Can’t wait to come back.

I had low expectations about the hotel, but I was only staying for a short time and the price point was OK. However, even with lowered expectations I was disappointed. Starting with the good - the staff was polite and the room was quiet (hence more than one star). I can't say anything good about the other aspects of my stay. The most egregious problem was that there was garbage left in my hotel room. I think there is some kind of recycling program in place, but a plastic bag full of used shampoo and other plastic bottles had been left on the counter in my room, and I guess housekeeping just decided to let me find there there. Second, the room was billed as "water view". I have attached pictures, and I'll let you judge. Technically, yes, after a bit of searching you can see a sliver of ocean, but this is a description only a lawyer could love.Finally, the hotel charges a mandatory "resort" fee. This hotel is not a resort by any definition of the word, and tacking on this fee is a sleazy business practice. When I raised this with the staff at the front desk, they explained that is was a way of reducing how much tax gets paid on the room rate. Somehow they thought that describing this fee as a tax dodge would make it seem _less_ sleazy. You know who doesn't charge a hidden "resort" fee? AirBnBs. And if I ever have to stay in Honolulu again, that's the route I will choose.

The hotel has good location near shops and restaurants. The room was good and clean, though cleaning was often late in the afternoon. The staff were friendly.The costs are another matter. I was double billed by over a thousand dollars and then told they had no record of it. They also charge a mandatory "resort" fee of $22 plus tax, which covered internet and pool. The pool is a little over two metres wide sandwiched between the hotel and the neighbouring building: you will have to go to the beach if you want a tan. Other "amenities" include a Rivals sports bar (very efficient and friendly staff) and an IHOP (poor service and high prices) - whether these are the cafe and restaurant mentioned in their web page is unclear. There was also a take-out pizza window on the street.

We stayed in this hotel for 11 days. The staff was so friendly and everything was super clean. The pool/hot tub area was amazing. I enjoyed being able to sit in the hot tub while watching our children play in the pool. The pool was small, but the kids really enjoyed it. We loved that it was open until 9pm! They also have a filtered water bottle refill station near the pool area. We used it a lot during our stay! During our 2nd week there 3 of the 4 washing machines were down so there was very much a line of people waiting to use the 1 that was available. The only thing I’d recommend about the self laundry room was more ventilation. It was super hot and stuffy in there. We loved how bright the room was. There was so much natural light!There are 3 elevators... only one goes to the parking garage which can make for some long waits or figuring out a way around it (like going to a higher floor then taking the stairs for the remaining floors.The parking garage (a whopping $35/day) was interesting... VERY tight turns and parking. Pretty sure we scraped the undercarriage of the car daily on a speed bump going down from the 4th floor parking. Overall, this is definitely a place we would want to stay again on another trip! Between the cleanliness and staff, the pool/hot tub, location, and general happy vibes of the hotel, we enjoyed our stay very much!

This is neither a fancy hotel nor did we get the room with best view, but it deserves a 5 star review because the hotel staff really looked after us (notably Amante). We arrived Honululu at 6am, after an overnight flight and dealing with sick kids, we were extremely exhausted, Amante saw our needs, and arranged an early check in for us, all of us recovered by the afternoon and we can therefore enjoy the rest of our trip. Thank you so much.

This hotel is right on busy Kuhio Avenue. Room was spacious and clean. Room was well appointed. Beds were clean and comfy. Staff were super friendly and helpful. The only downside was the $25 resort fee charged each day. I'd rather it be reflected right on the daily rate of the hotel rather than an extra fee charged when you arrive.

Stayed 10 nights and was perfect accommodation for our requirements. Bedroom with 2 single beds and lounge with 2 divan type beds. Small kitchnette perfect to prepare our breakfast. Lounge good size for the 4 of us to sit and have drink at night and plan what places we wanted to visit. Rooms were clean and serviced every day. Anything we required was just a call to housekeeping and was delivered very quickly and with a smile. Easy checkin and storeage of our bags as we arrived in morning and checkin not till later. so we went for a walk and returned earlier than checkin time to find our room ready. Reception were always extremely helpful with any queries we had regarding catching buses etc. Pink Line bus at door - which is at no cost for trip. Pool and spa at hotel were perfect for a cool off dip. Very close to places to eat and a short walk to the beach. Would definately stay here again if I travelled to Hawaii again.

First off false advertisement probably through any website you attempt to purchase let's stay here you get charged a good amount to buy the room and when you get there you find out there's about 100- $300 dollars. In additional fees that are not covered in your original purchase on the website and no fine print that tells you of such things when you get to the room you find it ain't the room that you acquired from the website and in that room you'll find mold in your bathroom virtually no room massive amounts of dust underneath the beds and behind the entertainment centers AC very warm need to be serviced basically everything about the comfort of being on vacation after walking around forever is non-existent at this establishment I find it hard to believe that they're even in code with some of the things they got going on. You're basically getting a $50 a night experience at $150 value very unsatisfied and if I'm allowed to make amendments to this post I will be putting the pictures to show you what I'm talking about here shortly

It was my first time of staying in Hawaii.There were a lot of things that we do not know, and we needed information.Front staffs are very kind and gave us appropriate information for our trip.Especially the main front concierge Ms. Pam and the male staff who arranged me the airport shuttle are very professional, and I was very much impressed how friendly they are!Thank you, Pam :)I will definitely come back to this hotel on my next trip to Hawaii.

Having stayed at the Ohana East on a previous stay, we thought this hotel would be very similar. Not so much. Check in was smooth. Our room was ok at first. Good aircon, comfortable bed. The shower however was one of the worst we have had on our 5 week trip. The pressure was so low that hair shampooing was almost impossible! On the 3rd day the door to our room would not unlock and required a new door lock to be fitted, so after 4 trips up and down to reception getting new keys, we were offered another room to move to, which we did. On arriving at the new room, we met unacceptable cleaning issues, long black hair on the toilet seat and all round the bathtub. Also the dust in the bedside table was thick enough to write in! (The shower was much better pressure although the shower head kept dropping downwards! )The one pleasing aspect of this was the front desk staff who acted immediately to have the room recleaned and offered apologies. Still not what we would expect to experience when paying so much for the room. On reflection, given the amount of hotels in Waikiki to choose from I would probably not stay here again. Again, credit where it is due, the front office staff were most friendly and helpful throughout our stay.

Close to everything in Waikiki, walked whenever we wanted to go somewhere around he area and beach. The customer service is the best!! Their staff makes you feel welcome, they are friendly, professional, and customer oriented. The room was nice and clean. I would stay here again when we come back to visit Waikiki!!

Just read some reviews of other guests of this property and I am wondering if we stayed at the same hotel! Definitely not quiet, I would say very noisy, we could hear the traffic, police car, even the people on the street! I guess we had bad luck and with the cleanliness, there was hair, dust and stains on the bedsheets. It look liked this property has never been renovated and that even the towels weren’t white color... wallpapers in the bathroom... the bottom of the bathtub was moving... only the A/C was working well.The location was ok, next to the Main Street, but not so close from the beach!The parking as well was very weird! And their system of charging the parking was weird and thanks to that we were double charged. Once we paid in the parking and then they put the parking charge on the room as well.I would choose this hotel again even if they offer me to pay me to stay there!

My wife and I were in Waikiki for two days before our cruise.We were booked for two days with the Marriott ,which is across the street from the Ohana.Due to a bad experience at the Marriott we checked out of that hotel and stayed the two nights at Ohana.It was a good decision.It was quiet, comfortable and clean.The people working at the front desk were friendly and made our stay pleasent and pain free.If you are staying in Waikiki,we recommend this hotel

If you are looking for a nice hotel, clean and friendly....look no further! Everyone here was warm & welcoming! Hotel rooms were very clean! Shout out to hardworking Amy who did an excellent job everyday making our room look amazing! Mahalo to the front desk for greeting us so kindly each and every time we came in or left the hotel, truly made us feel special! Loved the fact that each and everyday I could get a beautiful flower for my hair, truly made me feel special! The hotel is in a great location easy walk to the beach and restaurants! having the free Pink Trolley was a nice bonus too! We will definitely being staying here again!

Not on the beach but an easy five minute walk through the shops and restaurants in the heart of Waikiki. If you want to be on the broad expanse of Waikiki Beach you need to be a little farther along the beach. The surf at the beach in this area can be rough.Clean room, cheerful staff and convenient.

We booked the hotel on short notice and were amazed that we were able to book a room with an ocean view. The view included the ocean and other high-rise buildings in Waikiki, but it was still an ocean view. The only drawback was when we opened the lanai door, we could hear the sound from two large fans in a next-door building. Other than that, we couldn't hear the noise when the door was closed. The room was clean, quiet, and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was very nice and accommodating. Our family enjoyed our stay here.

The staff were amazing and so hospitable.The rooms are cosy and warm and does the job well.The top thing about the place was the welcoming and generosity we received by all staff and we will never forget it as soon as we arrived till the end.They assisted us in every way possible to ensure our stay was memorable and comfortable.Cant express how much gratitude we have for them!Definitely recommend!

Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights although checked out early on the second night as had a late night flight out. The hotel is in Kuhio Avenue, and has a good choice of places to eat and shop. They do charge a resort fee and this included wifi and free shuttle to and from Ala Moana Shopping Centre. It is in a very convenient location however I probably would not stay here again as the noise from the air conditioning fans outside was crazy noisy and could not keep the door to the Lanai open at any time. Was convenient for me on my travels this time though.

We decided to book this hotel via Costco Travel because the price is cheap, the rating at Costco travel and the pictures in their website looked very friendly and decent. When we arrived at the place we were very shocked, far from what we imagined. It had a foul smell, hand printed on the walls, and was very dusty.The vacation turned into a nightmare. On Wednesday night we were stuck in elevator for an hour due to hotel's elevator malfunction. It's even worse than you think, the hotel staffs, A. Castro and Kayo handed us a bill for repair their elevator. They said because it's our fault(!) How could that be? They even threatening us that they will send the elevator repair's bill to collection agency with our name in it.It's not the place I would recommended and it's not right to deceive customers just to get bookings with all pictures that they had. And it's not safe for peoples who want to book in this hotel with unsafe, outdated and lack of maintenance elevator.You all could contact me at 510 759 1920 for more info. Thanks

As we were only having a two night stop over items for a standard room . Stayed at this hotel about 25 years ago snd it doesn’t seem to have changed much. The bed was comfortable the room reasonably clean and the view was awful but wasn’t looking for a view. It was not very soundproof and doors banged all night. However based on the price it was overall a reasonable stay. Very disappointed in IHOP which has gone downhill considerably since we last ate there a year ago.

From the moment we stepped into the hotel the front desk staff and all other staff welcomed us with smiles and any information we needed. Shout out to Roy, Peter and Pam you were exceptional!Our room was clean and fresh and cleaned daily. Housekeeping staff do their job well and even changed our pillows(as the others were flat) when we asked if they could give us fluffier ones(shout out to Lelani and her male partner for doing this).Our room had a coffee pot and coffee every day,as well as toiletries in the washroom(the products they leave for you are great). We also had a fridge in our room which was very convenient.The hotel is centrally located to shop,restaurants,transportation (buses/trolleys). With your room key you have free access to the Waikiki Pink line trolley,which goes around Waikiki,beaches and to the Ala Moana shopping center.The IHOP is next door,as well as a sports bar for those who like that sort of thing.Only suggestion I would have would be to replace the carpets as from sand,water,etc. they get run down,even though they are constantly cleaned.I’ve would recommend this hotel for anyone including families.

Room and hotel overall was clean and in a good location.Swimming pool was small but the hot tub was a good size. The bar attached left a little to be desired. Nice having an IHOP so close but they seemed to be understaffed. Overall had a very nice experience staying there. Would stay there again.

We stayed in Oahu for 6 days with the intention of touring and checking out the area. With that, we wanted a hotel that was nice and centrally located and that is exactly what we got. Our room was nice but we didn't really spend much time there other than sleeping, showering & changing. The location was perfect. There was a fabulous restaurant called Appetito just outside the hotel within the block and they had various drink specials.We took a tour to the Mighty Mo, Arizona and Bowfin and the tour bus picked us up at the hotel. On another tour, we just had to go 2 blocks away to the main street to pick up that bus.We got an Uber 2x's and that work perfect!We were close to Waikiki Beach (5-7 minute walk) and the time spent there was so much fun. Try and get there at least one day to watch the surfers and for some R n' R.We didn't need a vehicle here as everything was close.The front desk did provide towels for the beach.There was a strike by hotel workers going on right next door, Marriott (formerly Sheraton?) Hotels. So, I was glad we stayed at a smaller place that apparently treats their help much better than the Marriott. (Side note: Strike lasted 51 days and the workers won!). Lesson for me: Never stay at a Marriott - greedy corporation that doesn't care about their employees.

The balcony doors did not offer any sound insulation. Being at the corner of the street, there were always people waiting to cross the road. Every conversation, leave alone drunk arguments and fights, could be heard clearly and that typically lasted from mid evening to about 4 in the morning.I feel the hotel should be mindful of this HUGE annoyance and could have done something about it but evidently didn't. Stay here if excessive noise is not your concern.

We didn't spend too much time in our hotel room, but OHANA Waikiki Malia by Outrigger was clean, and had everything we needed. Central to everything. Our view was of the street/the hotel across the street, but that was to be expected. No complaints. :)

Paid for a partial ocean view room - well, if you stand on your tip toes on a chair, you could see the ocean which wasn’t happy about this. After a couple of days I asked what floor is partial ocean view rooms only to be told we should have had a room on a higher floor........ effectively we had been ripped off and very unhappy.We were offered to move rooms but with only another 2 nights remaining and totally unpacked we decided not to move..From there they offered not to charge the “resort fee” of $23 per night - I can’t work out why they would have a resort fee as there is very little on offer - a small spa and a pool that is roughly 2m wide and 10 metres long in the smallest space available. How do these places get away with t/his benaviour? Rooms - pretty good actually with beds comfortable although very small bathroom.Location - effectively 1 block and a bit back from the beach but plenty going on around the hotel. After this experience of room rip off, I would not stay here again

Despite some renovations going on, the room was clean and comfortable, the location was convenient, and the staff was friendly. Only downside was the TV had a smaller selection of channels than I am used to.

We showed up at 2am after finding out that our flight to Australia had been cancelled and Robert was more than helpful with getting us an affordable rate. Later, we’d found out that our new flight had been moved earlier into our stay and the hotel gave us a refund for the night, with no hassle or questioning. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable and the staff were pleasant and more than happy to answer any questions we had. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. The best part is that it is walking distant from one of the most beautiful beaches I’ve ever seen and if you get the chance, hike diamond head peak. Thank you again Robert for all of your help!

Compared to other Waikiki hotels, this is relatively inexpensive...but is a few blocks from the beach with no views. If you need a place to stay without frills...this is the hotel for you.The IHOP restaurant conveniently adjacent to lobby. Rivals Sports bar in lobby was good 2 of 3 times. Had one bad experience.

I have never had such great personal service from a hotel staff. The room was immaculate when we arrived and always cleaned well each day. Location is a couple blocks from the beach and the shopping starts right next door. Free access to the Pink Line made access to all of Waikiki and the Ala Moana mall easy. They have only a very small pool for swimming, (which I never saw anyone use) but a great hot tub. I will definitely book here again when I return to Oahu.

This is our second stay at this hotel. It isn't new but it is well maintained, in a good location a couple of blocks from the beach and surrounded by stores and restaurants. The rooms are well appointed with plenty of space. Most noteworthy is how nice all the front desk staff are. We stay in a Waikiki hotel for ten days every year and these people are by far the friendliest and most helpful we have encountered.

We wound up a month long stay with 5 days at this hotel. We began this time at the Stay Hotel just a block away. We decided to end our trip at a somewhat higher end hotel as a treat. It has quite a few amenities which we ended up not using partly because my wife and I caught a cold or flu for our last week. There is a pool and exercise facility. We chose the Ohana because it's a short walk to the beach. Also we had breakfast included in their restaurant. The breakfast was superb with a choice of 4 dishes. It's a set menu and not a buffet. It was disappointing to have to pay for extra toast. You get one slice cut in half. They consider that 2 pieces of toast. Another problem was the long wait for elevators. Apparently they are being renovated. The room was spacious and kept very clean. The balcony was used every day as we caught the morning sun. Excellent value for the money. As a bonus we were allowed to check in 4 hours early.

Our recent visit to Ohana Malia was terrific. Room rates were reasonable for the holiday period - rooms were older style but spacious, clean & serviced well. The front desk staff, especially Manny, were always friendly and helpful during our stay. The location is great & easy to get anywhere around Waikiki. Pink line and bus stop across the road - accommodation comes with free trolley use Pool area wasn’t great but we are beach goers so didn’t worry us - would recommend as a great place to stay for reasonable cost.

This place is nice, The staff are awesome. Rooms are nice but are starting to look old. We would stah here again. It was pretty central to everything we needed. Bathrooms are small and old and you need to step into the shower / bath. So if you have trouble moving around this could be a problem. Our rooms were cleaned everyday and was done very well.

Stayed here 3 nights and was happy with this hotel, room had a very small balcony, coffee machine, fridge. The complex has a great hot tub. Nice and hot with lots of jets. They offer complimentary trolley service which is great to get around and stop is across the road. Staff are lovely and very helpful. There is also a laundry facility avail and you can get coins from reception if needed. Would definately recommend a stay here but think you can get a better price if you shop around.

We have been going to Hawaii for more than 35 years and stayed predominantly with outrigger hotels.We took our children and Grandchildren to Waikiki so they could experience the joys that we have over that time.The hotel was represented as recently referbished?We had to stay one night at the Malia as the Beachcomber was full,I have never been so embarrassed in my life,what a dump,rougher than a stucco bathtub.We had 3 -2 bedroom rooms,the linen was clean but that was a bout all,the bathrooms were disgusting ,paint peeling off,rust stains,dirty,how much would it cost to splash some paint around.Checkin was a nightmare,the staff kept disappearing all the time,took forever.The staff were very indifferent to say the least which I have never struck before,couldn't care less,then upon checkout I was told the amenity fee was ontop of what we had paid expedia which was included in the price,are you kidding me !We struck the same problem with the Beachcomber where we had 7 nights and 3 rooms so it was quite expensive to have to pay another $25 per night per room.Anyone booking through expedia should know that the amenity fee is not included in the price although it clearly states "includes all taxes"this is clearly misleading,will they do anything about it,no way,apparently outrigger has been purchased by a bigger company that want to extort as much as they can from you,luckily there are other choices,sad to see what was onec a great hotel chain go down the toilet.

We stayed in this hotel in October 2018 for 6 nights. The hotel was clean beds were comfortable couldn't really find fault with anything apart from the noise of fans in the back of the hotel. My husband is partially deaf so it didn't bother him but for myself I found it quite disturbing. On going to ask if we could move rooms I was met with nothing but people being as helpful as they could and we moved to the front of the hotel which was better. The hotel want to be proud of their staff who were lovely people so cheerful and helpful can't praise them enough.

Room was decent booked through booking.com said taxes and resort fee were included but hotel still charged the resort fee staff were very unatentive but seemed friendly to other international guests rooms could have done with a toaster and cutlery just to make toast or a sandwich

Its an average hotel in sort of a "seedy area" in Waikiki. People out partying all night were screaming at 2am outside our hotel. The parking lot is from hell. Its treacherous and is in dire need of being redone. Can barely turn a corner its so tight and so steep going up.

The hotel is located centrally in downtown Waikiki, it’s a 10 min walk to the beach, fine dining is also everywhere and it’s also close to Duke Market in the alley where they sell the same souvineers that ABC has but at 50% off. The beds were a bit hard, but that’s personal preference. It was a very safe location that is definetly family friendly. They have a $15.95 usd resort fee, but it’s OPTIONAL. I declined the fee and I still had wifi access through out my stay at no cost. The resort fee gives the guest a free bus ride to the Ala Moana mall but for $15.95 it’s not worth it, it’s a mere and pleasent 30 minute walk. There was barely any hallway noise and the rooms are air conditioned. It’s not a 5 star, but the service was great, and the rooms were clean. For the price I paid it was worth it.

Great place to stay after our 7 day cruise with Norwegian, cruising the 4 islands for seven days. The hotel is central to the shops and beaches nearby. There are a lot of ABC stores around for dining options as well as nearby restaurants for the the "foodies in you". There is a udon noodle place just down the street, Marukame that is cheap and delicious. Our room was on the 11th floor.....no beach view just buildings. The room was large and spacious with a kingsize bed, in room refrigerator and in room safe plus there was the usual hairdryer and iron/ironing board. The room was recently renovated and was comfortable. Staying here was both relaxing and enjoyable. The hotel partners with the Waikik trolley so you can take a trip around Waikiki and down to the Ala Moana shopping center.

Check in isn’t officially until 3pm but they did their best to get us a room earlier which was appreciated as we were quite tired. We had booked a King room but accepted a room with 2 queen sized beds and were in before 12 noon. Apparently there are only about 4-5 king bed rooms per floor with many more of the twin rooms becoming available earlier. The room was very spacious even with the two large beds. We were only missing a lounge which is standard in the King rooms. We had a partial city view, the outlook was quite open and the room extremely comfortable and nicely furnished. Bedding particularly good. Room safe.Bathroom was small and older style. Showerhead was a bit clunky, with water not a consistent stream. Having said that it was adequate for our needs for our two night stopover.The hotel itself was very good, the staff on the front desk extremely pleasant and helpful. Internet was free and worked well. The location is very central and only a short walk to both the beach and the main shopping area.

This hotel is in a great location, bus stops are right out the front and the hotel is one block back from the main Waikiki strip. Everything you could possibly need is in walking distance. The staff were very friendly and accommodating, any requests were quickly accommodated.The rooms were basic and dated but clean. Beds were comfy. We initially had room 701, which is a front corner room with a kitchenette. It was so noisy, from surrounding air conditioners, traffic and street noise, which didn't ease up much overnight. We asked to move after 3 nights and were given room 704, away from the main street. This was somewhat better but still a lot of noise from the street and air conditioner units. Surprisingly, no noise from adjacent rooms but maybe because the outside noise was louder. The small lap pool and spa look fairly new but are wedged in between two high-rise concrete walls with no view, so they are purely functional; not an area you'd relax around. There is a free water-bottle filling station which was a plus. In a travel period where prices were at a premium this was good value but didn't have the ambience of a tropical holiday.

We stayed at the Ohana Waikiki Malia by Outrigger. This is a great Hotel. They clean your room everyday. This place is at the heart of everything. you are within walking distance to alot of Restaurants and shops. They practically got an ABC store at every corner. The staff was friendly. The only thing is there is alot of one way streets and getting to the entrance to the parking garage is pretty tricky. Getting in and out of the garage,is nerve wracking if you have a minivan because the ceiling looks low and the curves going up and down the ramps are narrow. Its better to have a small car. otherwise, this is a wonderful Hotel and would like to stay there again.

We enjoyed our recent stay at Obama Waikiki by Outtigger. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful, too. They answered all of our questions, gave us directions, explained maps, and offered to securely store our luggage after checkout time and before our flight.We recommend this hotel, with the beach and all of your needs nearby.
user_name:
Claudia J
Grand Forks, North Dakota

review_body: When i searching budget hotel, i have read many comment for different hotel and some make me very scare as there is bad bug, other insert...etc.........i don't know what to book and at the end, i see the promotion for this hotel and the comment is not bad, so i take a chance for it. it is out of my expectation. My room is super clean, have a little balcony. Room is big enough, the toilet is tidy and clean. I feel so comfort of staying in the room......the location is very good. Go to shopping, eating, beach is within distant walk, very nice. i love it .

We enjoyed our stay at the Ohana Malia. It was clean and the staff on front desk were so helpful, the location was good, in the centre of Waikiki. Close to Waikiki beach.The Pink bus line takes you to Ala Moana with you Hotel pass it is free of charge.

If you are looking for a peaceful hotel do not stay here. We were 16 flights up and the noise each night - into the early morning was pretty bad. I am pretty sure there are nightclubs and/or bars below so people spilling out onto road all night. The beds were seriously hard and uncomfortable and don’t expect soft, fluffy pillows like you usually get in hotels! Air conditioner could not be left on overnight as it was too loud.The hot water broke down so we had cold showers one morning. The balcony is standing room only and the sheets had small holes all through them.I know we did not pay top dollar but I was disappointed.On the flip side, location is central (if you can cope with the noise) and staff were nice but would not stay there ever again!

I just come home back from my honeymoon today and we stayed in ohana maila outrigger we loved the hotel! Nice views, friendly staff ! only down side there’s no microwave in your room you have to ask the staff to warm your food up !! Nice shopping area nearby !! Must try the pizza right outside best pizza ever and the bar is wonderful too !!

If you are looking for power sockets and master switch next to your bed, this hotel is not for you. This is an old hotel, but central. MacD is round the corner, iHop and a pizza stand just next to the hotel. Ross, Nostrom Rack was just a street away and the beach was a 10 min stroll across. I stayed a total of 5 nights here with my parents (in their 70s). 2 nights when we landed and another 3 nights when we came back from Maui. We happened to stay in the same room on all 5 nights; C703. The carpet feels icky(probably vacuumed but not shampooed in a while) , so put your slippers on when u walk around the room. Water pressure and flush is good. The sofa bed and bedroom bed is comfy, pillows are a little flat, but not an issue for us. We had some trouble with the aircon in the bedroom on our last 3 nights, it gave a loud, whiny irritating noise when it was in cool mode. They offered to change our rooms when the technician could not fix it immediately, but we chose not to. We simply switched to fan mode and it was fine. Staff was great. There is a coffee maker, microwave, kitchen sink, cutlery available in the rm. Its a little noisy as you can hear the traffic in the bedroom and your neighbours walking along the corridor. I would stay here again but would ask for the upgraded rooms.

Our spacious room with kitchenette (fits four adults) was in the older part of the hotel. Balcony overlooked Royal Hawaiian Ave on which a 5 minute walk down will take you to Kalakaua Ave, shops, and Waikiki Beach. Staff were friendly and helpful. We never used the free pink trolley though. Price was great, less than half that of the beach access hotels.

Spent a week at Ohana Waikiki Malia and we enjoyed our stay mainly because of the friendly and helpful staff and the convenient location of the hotel. The shops are nearby with Ihop downstairs for breakfast. The free pink trolley bus is just across the street or outside the door of the pool and the beach is just a few blocks away. We stayed at the 9th floor of the Malia tower overlooking Kuhio and the noise was not bad even for a busy street. Would definitely stay here again.

Hotel is dated but spacious. Close to buses and also shopping. 15 minute slow walk to the beach.Staff very helpful and friendly. Would stay here again. Kitchenette is great and convenient. Loved the separate lounge to relax in.

We stayed here, hubby, son, and I in a king bed room. It was always clean. The staff are very friendly. Definatly showed the aloha spirit. Helped us with whatever we needed. They even had a water fountain where you could fill water bottles with cold water. And plumeria flowers to wear every day. We even got a view of the fireworks Friday night in the hallway window.

Found this hotel to be very convenient. Beach is a couple blocks away, the international marketplace also a couple of blocks away. The hop on hop off bus stop across the road. Your room key gives you free access to this bus. The room was large, king bed, with a small table and chairs, a very tiny balcony. Good air conditioning. A small kitchen area with coffee machine and supplies. Staff were very helpful. IHOP next door and McDonald’s around the corner had breakfast covered. Lots of restaurants close by. Would definitely stay here again.

Our Japanese American family of five just returned to Tokyo after a 10-day stay at OHANA Malia by Outrigger and had a terrific time. Front desk manager Mr. Tana and his staff including the lovely Ms. Pam Milligen, Lance, Troy and everyone else were exceptionally friendly and professional. Our room was clean and cozy. In room Wi-Fi speed and stability was excellent. After fun-filled days surfing and sightseeing we loved relaxing in the jacuzzi and meeting other guests that included international visitors and locals. We rode the Pink Trolly gratis to Ala Moana Mall frequently. the location on Kuhio and Royal Hawaiian is super convenient just around the corner from Duty Free Shoppers, Ross, Starbucks, ABC. We recommend Malia to everyone, singles, couples, families and business travelers. Mahalo is Thank You in Hawaiian and well deserved!

Very nice hotel staff. The clerk remembered our room number when we checked out 5 days later.If you are looking for a fancy hotel, this is not it. But if you are looking for a clean place to sleep that is centrally located in walking distance and reasonably priced, this is the place I would recommend. We were fortunate to get a room on the top floor on the ocean side, it was a pretty good view too.We would stay here again

The property is clean and the staff were friendly but our room was small and everything seemed dated. That said, it is less than a 5 minute walk to the beach and the main tourist area. Would absolutely stay here again but we don't spend much time in the room. If you do plan to spend a decent amount of time in the room then understand there's a reason the going rate on the same block is double.

Had a wonderful week staying in the Ohana Waikiki Malia in May 2018 - the staff went above and beyond and were so friendly and helpful. Having the I-Hop Restaurant next door is very handy too. Our room was not ready when we arrived but the staff stored out bags and offered to arrange transport for us to go somewhere if we wanted while they cleaned the room.Great location to everything with the bus right outside the door. Bed extremely comfortable and room a great size. Would definately stay here again if and when we return to Waikiki.

Had a room on the 16th floor with a great Waikiki view. The room is comfortable and clean although the bathroom was a little tired. Check in and out was fast and friendly. Staff always friendly and helpful. Great stay

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights on our first trip to Hawaii. From the moment we walked through the door we were warmly welcomed. The staff could not do enough to help/advise us with any questions we had and any request we had was attended to quickly.Probably the most friendly staff in any hotel we have ever stayed at.Only negative was the rooms were a bit dated but they were clean and comfortable.Highly recommend this hotel!!

This was our once in a lifetime holiday. We booked in for three weeks. The first two weeks we had a family room which was very good. We were then upgraded to two connecting double rooms on the eleventh floor. These rooms were fantastic. The staff in this hotel were absolutely wonderful. There was nothing that was to much trouble for anyone. From house keeping to the front desk everything was great. Before we left Peter from the front desk weighed all our bags to make sure we were not overweight. Will definitely recommend this place and when we visit Hawaii we will gladly stay here again.

This is a clean and comfy hotel, within walking distance of most of Waikiki. I had a beach facing room on level 15 allowing me to see the friday night fireworks from the comfort of my own balcony. The room itself was quite spacious but the bathroom tiny and quite possibly the world smallest balcony, maybe just over a square meter . Staff were mostly friendly, i did arrive to find my room ready and available by 11am. the hotel itself was reasonably quiet but the street noise travelled alot.

We recently had a two week stay at the Ohana Waikiki Maloa in a 1 bedroom with kitchenette. We had a lovely time, staff were friendly and helpful, beds were comfortable and price was good. There were two rooms separated by a kitchenette and bathroom. The bedroom with the queen bed was on the outside edge of the hotel and could be quite noisy ,but Waikiki is noisy in general so I expect many hotels are the same. The lounge room which had two single beds which doubled as seating was facing internally and was quieter so the kids didn't have any trouble sleeping. It worked perfectly. Location was convenient, above Ihop and a pizza place and 5-10 mins walk from most places and the beach. I read some bad reviews about the car park and was a little anxious about this but we had no issues at all. Only the entry way is single lane , two way. But its open and you can see if a car is coming down so we never had to reverse out or down around corners. The rest of the ramps are single lane but are only one way so there was no issues. Though they were narrow (perhaps hire a smaller car) we had no issues getting around. We would stay here again.

We had a nice large room on the 9th floor with nice bathroom and a little balcony as you could see the ocean. Close to the elevations so had a little noise. Staff was very helpful and friendly. No café with the hotel. Next door as a small sport bar with food and drink plus half a block away was IHOP, MCD, and Italian café. Good location and close to bus stops and close to the beach.

While things were clean, our kitchen suite was very dated, old everything. There was a bit of a moldy smell as well. No vent in the bathroom...so, you really steamed everything up...had to open door just to get any air to breathe. The balcony was surrounded in cement. So, there was no breeze to enjoy...only left clothes out to dry since we couldn't stand it. The pool was very small. At 4:15am the garbage trucks were out, beeping and banging (nothing the hotel could do about it....just a location thing). On the good side: the staff was friendly and helpful. But, half way through our stay we moved to a new hotel.

We live on the Island of Oahu and decided to do a family staycation. Had a fabulous experience. First of all the parking lot attended was friendly to the front desk at check in very pleasant. I love our room, very spacious. And the location of this hotel is so excellent! Walking distance to everything. Love staying here from a local girl from the Islands.

The staff was friendly and informative. The room was clean and comfortable. The rates were reasonable for Waikiki. I rented a car for my stay on Oahu. The parking deck for the hotel is convenient, but a bit tight.

Well, we had a pleasant week on this hotel, the staff are nice, our room is well taken cared of and we met two great guys who are very helpful, Peter and Manny. They made our stay memorable.The hotel is near commercial establishments, we bought honolulu cookies on the side, bought basic needs across (ABC Stores), and my son when hungry will just walk a few steps to McDonalds. I think the location is better than the beach front and everything you think of is just a few steps away.

I was very happy with this hotel. Its not 5 star but was very comfortable. It was centrally located, without being on the beach. Handy to the Trolley depot and stops.We had a family suite with a little kitchen and a nice balcony, there was a bit of traffic etc noise, but that cant be helped when you are right in the middle of things. It was very comfortable and clean and quite reasonably priced. the staff were vfiendly and helpful.I would be very happy to stay there again

Located on Lewers St in Waikiki, this location provides a great central location to explore and enjoy Waikiki. There are bus and trolley stops in front of the hotel. Most day trip or Luau buses pick up within a block of the hotel. We arrived early, 9AM and our bags were safely held for us and we began our visit. Our room had a partial view of the ocean and was very quiet. We stayed 5 nights. Checkout was fast and efficient and all the hotel staff seemed genuinely interested in making sure we had a good time. The hotel does have a bar located in the building and also an IHOP. This location is around everything. The hotel is also a favorite of Japanese visitors and we did meet quite a few that did not speak any English. Very polite and many families. This is a great value for staying in Waikiki

Traveled to Hawaii in 05/11/2018 - 05/18/2018The room was average size with the balconies big enough to fit only one person at a time. There is also quite a bit of noise from service vehicles (ambulance, & police) as they pass by.If you are okay with the noise, this hotel is located in the middle of everything and all sorts of shopping, restaurants, and the beach is within close walking distance.They also provide free service of the pink line trolley which will take you all the way up to Ala Moana mall. This is definitely not a five star resort, but I was very impressed with the cleanliness, location, and friendly attentive staff.

Recently I and my wife stayed in the Ohana Waikiki Malia for seven nights. My sister also stayed here in another room. Her view of the ocean was better than ours. The location is in the middle of everything. The staff was Super, they helped us several times. Thanks to Pam and all the staff. We enjoyed our stay and our vacation. Roy A

We stayed here two nights while visiting Oahu. The hotel is average. Good room size and it had a balcony but it was very small, only one person could be out there at a time pretty much. It had a nice view if you were on a high level; we had a view of the mountains which was nice. The price was great and you get what you pay for so we weren't expecting a 5 star resort. The great thing about the hotel though is that it is in perfect walking distance to just about everything! They have a small pool and hot tub which was surprising for being in the center of the city. There is Thai restaurant and a Irish pub right outside the hotel that we recommend if you are into those kinds of things. Also a ihop and sports bar is attached to hotel.

What an unexpected gem the Ohana Waikiki Malia turned out to be. Although this is definitely not a 5 star hotel, the service is what you get at a 5 star hotel.We stayed there for 4 nights. Firstly the location is great. It's a 2 minute walk to the main street (with all the shops and restaurants) and you can use your room key to travel around on the Pink Line bus which actually drops you off opposite the hotel. We arrived before noon - but the gentleman on reception got us checked in right away. The room is nothing special, but the beds and pillows were very comfortable, the water pressure was great and the water was hot. Each day at reception they had a bowl of flowers and bobby-pins so that you could put a fresh flower in your hair. A simple but unexpected touch.Every member of staff that we interacted with at the hotel was incredibly friendly and helpful. We weren't leaving for the airport until 7pm and because the hotel was so busy, we weren't able to get a late check-out. We had a snorkelling trip booked for that morning and Roy offered to store our luggage for the day and explained that he could offer us the use of a complimentary hospitality room later that afternoon so that we could come back and shower and freshen up after our snorkelling adventure before heading to the airport. That was something that we didn't expect but made a huge difference to us before we started out 17 hour journey home.We had mentioned that we'd head down to the beach for a last drink at sunset before coming back to grab our luggage and taxi to the airport. We walked into the hotel lobby and Tony (the bell-hop) already had our luggage out of storage waiting for us - along with a taxi. Now that is service above and beyond expectation.I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again or recommend it to the budget conscious traveller.

Recently stayed for 7 nights in the Ohana Waikiki Malia. We'd previously stayed in the Ohana Waikiki East but as this property wasn't available we chose this hotel. I must say that the location is great. Hotel is central to everything - ie shops and is only one block from Waikiki beach. 3 adults stayed in the one room and room booked had 2 double beds. There is a small fridge and tea and coffee making facilities. There is a hairdryer and iron in the room. The room that we had on 8th floor didn't have a view was but very quiet - no traffic noise. Bed was very comfortable. Hotel has small indoor pool on the ground floor for guests. Hotel is beside iHop ( we didn't get a chance to go there) and right around the corner from T Galleria (duty free shop) and is the starting point for the Wakiki Trolley which is great. There is a Mcdonalds restaurant just across the road to the right (about 3 doors up) if you are like us and want an easy breakfast. There is also a Nordstrom Rack store just past McDonalds which was nice and handy. Overall I would definately recommend this hotel. Staff friendly and helpful.

we stayed in Ohana Waikiki Malia for 7 nights. it was an ‘ok’ experience. staff are not that friendly and not that accomodating. furnitures are old. some elevators are playing up as well. there was this one night that the fire alam was playing up for 2-3hours and this was in the middle of the night so we didn’t get enough sleep that day. the good part is, it has a superb location and accessible to beach and shops and the price is not that bad. if you are looking for affordable hotel with an excellent location i will recommend Ohana Waikiki Malia.

I really wanted this hotel to be great but the truth is you get what you pay for. We stayed here for 5 days at the very end of march. When we first went up to our room I thought it was a great value but then I noticed the ants all over our room. I told the front desk and they put down vinegar which was fine we just opened up the door to rid the smell. When we went to shower we noticed that there was mold everywhere, and a huge bubble in the tub, it was like we were walking on bubble wrap and the drain didn't work so when we would shower our legs were sitting in dirty water. I told the front desk on the first day and on the second day they said they tried their best to fix it but couldn't. I was told that there was nothing they could do to help us. When I was checking towels out on our second to last day there the woman was like oh yea your the room where the shower isn't working and said if we wanted to change rooms we could. Why is it that when I asked, I was told no and that if I wanted to go to the top floor I would have to pay!!!! It had to be by chance that I ran into her at the front desk! When we moved into the next room, we noticed that there was a giant (i mean full wall from ceiling to floor) stain of coffee right behind the door. Meaning that they never even attempt to clean behind the doors. The upside of this hotel is the short walk to the beach and the IHOP breakfast! I will definitely not be recommending this hotel to anyone else. Spend the extra money and stay by the water.

We found the staff to be friendly, courteous, and efficient at check-in, and check-out. The room was very clean and comfortable, and a real value in Waikiki for the price. We had a good nights sleep and woke to heavy rain showers. During a break in the rain showers we rushed to check out so that we could walk to our next designation and stay dry.Unfortunately, in our haste, we forgot to empty the safe of our passports, cash, and credit cards. We were still in Waikiki when we got a call from the staff reporting they had our property. Whew! What a relief to recover all of our property intact.Without a question, we will never forget to empty a safe again. Thanks to Waikiki Malia for the nice stay and wonderful honesty.

It was just a one night stop over, a place to sleep. Very inexpensive hotel and you get what you pay for. They gave us a room on the top floor and i swear it look like an addition to thr roof top, the room was very old and tired. I think this hotel has a new and old building together. Kind of difficult to check in with a car the front of hotel has a small driveway will fit two cars, thr parking is little tricky must go around the streets again.Front desk staff was friendly.Honestly I don’t think I’ll be staying here again.

I really wanted this hotel to turn out to be excellent for us but it was a bit of a damper due to the room we got. The location was excellent. They had an ihop next door which was great for breakfast and it was handy using the keycard to use the pink trolley. The room on the other hand was dark and damp. There was Mold everywhere, the wallpaper was bubbling the smell was bad. I am pregnant and suffering from asthma so it was horrible for me.

Hotel key gives you access to the Pink Trolley rail from Galleria duty free to Ala Moana Mall.Near to Ross Shopping Store. Walking distance to Waikiki beach, Waikiki Aquarium and Zoo.Best place to stay in Waikiki Mahalo

Basic accommodation. Our room was situated in adjunct older, tired building. Convoluted way of getting to it through door from elevator--a turn on concrete floor followed by up and down steps on stained carpet. No lanai. Very industrial feeling. A promo that was disappointing in appointment and final costs. Will not revisit this place.

We have been staying at this hotel for the past 10 years. The staff are very welcoming and will make your stay a very enjoyable one. The hotel is well situated in the center of Waikiki. It is literally 2 blocks from the beach and 2 blocks from the Ala Wai canal and close to shopping of every type imaginable. The property offers different types of accommodations including regular hotel rooms and 1 bedroom suites. There are also ocean views from a number of rooms. This is our go-to hotel whenever we return to Hawaii. I am a native so we try to go home at least once a year! Please note that Waikiki is an active place and can be noisy for newcomers. That will be true of ALL hotels in central Waikiki because of the population density in this area. Don't let that discourage you from visiting. The beach is beautiful and the dining and shopping choices amazing!

I live on Hawaii Is,and, but travel frequently to Oahu, usually opting to stay with family, or a near by hotel that begins with A.Knowing my wife and I would be visiting during Kamehameha Schools Song contest, I found some great pricing deals for this hotel, during the holiday season, so I booked the reservation.The day before arriving, we called the reservations number and asked if we could get early check in. Who,e there was no guarantee, they do put in our request.We arrived 1 hour before normal check in, and was assisted by Armonte, who was not only accommodating, also extremely courteous and helpful in getting us checked in. During checkout, I learned he was the front desk manager, which pleases me to see he leads by example.The hotel was bustling with international travelers, but the property was clean and the staff awesome! We also enjoyed being able to dine at iHop in the lobby as well as eat some pizza outside, and McDonalds across the street. There area also two convenient stores, also across the street, if needed.During checkout, we were helped by Pam, who must have been trained by Armonte, because she was just as helpful and friendly as Armonte. It’s safe to say, we will be happy to return on our next visit.

We have stayed in many different hotels in Waikiki, this one was one of the best. It was a 1 bedroom and 2 twin beds, kitchenette suite. Perfect for our Moms, my Husband and I. Everything was clean, safe and the location was central! What more can you ask for! The noise outside from the live band bar can be loud at times, but it ends at 10pm? So not that bad when you are going to sleep. Everyone was helpful and friendly. We would def stay there again. We love Oahu!

Haven't stayed here in a while, the rooms have been recently renovated and are beautifully done - especially for this price range.Staff was friendly and helpful, arranged for a shuttle to the airport (which was an adventure)don't rent a car if you don't have to -the entry/exit to parking garage is scary steep

Looked like a hotel that hosts tour groups. Small lobby and sitting area. Many stores and restaurants in the area. Room was in the back so it looked out to another hotel or condominium, but there was a partial view of the city. Room décor is so-so, quite outdated, but clean. Bed was comfortable. I didn't hear any noise coming from the hallway but then that is relative. Unsure if I would want to stay at this hotel again.

There was a mixup about the breakfast that was to be included with room on Outrigger's cyber monday sale as got several different answers as where served.
