Robert the on duty Mgr worked it out with I Hopp attached to hotel. He was very helpful working it out and also moved me to a better room. Thanks Bob.

We have been return guests here for over 15 years! The staff always makes us feel like family. So'o and Roy, as well as the other front desk hosts, treat you with the utmost care and attention! Our room was on an upper floor with ocean views and city views.Cleanliness is never an issue throughout the hotel. Other than the sound of traffic from the lower floors, the location is perfect and central to restaurants and activities. Waikiki beach is a short 5 minute stroll away with shops along the way. Looking forward to our next visit...wonderful, relaxing stay!!

The room was a bit small, but nice. Good customer service. Things to know: They do check out beach towels.Location is about 1/4 mile walk to beach.No microwave in the room, but there is a minifridgeParking is $30/dlots of restaurants are within walking distance.There is a laundromat just down the street.Vintage Island Shave Ice is about 1/4 mile away and had the best shave ice out of the 5 places we tried.

We arrived Waikiki on a spare of the moment birthday getaway from the cold weather in Chicago. Pleasantly surprised with the Ohana Waikiki Malia Hotel it was perfect for our family needs. Centrally located to many restaurants & shopping. Short walk to the beach & hotel signs out beach towels is a plus. Room was clean, comfortable & priced right... just what we needed for our short whirlwind weekend. Thank you to Manny at the front desk for his friendly hospitality. We will be back again, Mahalo.

Found this hotel to b a bit tired and old looking. Room was not very modern. Needed some in house maintenance on arrival. Staff were very helpful. our desk was hlepful. Location wa OK wih restuarants approx 1.5 blocks walk away. There was cafe next door but very popular at some hrs with lines waiting to get in

All staff members were friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. Attached iHop made breakfast and late night snacks convenient. Attached club was a nice plus.  Reasonably priced for an off the beach Waikiki hotel. Included free unlimited trolley made it easy to get around Waikiki. Attached extra cost parking garage including direct access to hotel elevator banks was convenient, but like a NYC parking garage, tight turns and one way ramps are not for feint of heart drivers. Older building but nicely updated. Bring an extension cord due to shortage of power receptacles.
user_name:
Richard G
New Brunswick, New Jersey

review_body: For the money, it's a good hotel. Staff were very professional and friendly. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. There's a gym which is clean and reasonably equipped. They clearly work at keeping it clean and comfortable and it was a place we would stay again in that price range.

My husband and I arrived Dec. 25, 2017 and he had a stroke the next night. Mr. So'otaga Tana, the manager, went out of his way to be of assistance to us. I cannot say enough what a relief it was to have someone so sympathetic to our crisis!! The motel is lovely and very clean. I only wish we would have been able to stay our full time.

We were on our first flight ever to Hawaii. The location was great, the veiw was great and the staff was so freindly and kind. The rooms were clean and spacious. We are from North Carolina and plan on returning again. Special Thanks to Shawn for going out of his way to make us feel at home. See you soon!! Aloha. Michael and Christine

Delayed review. But my family of 4 stayed here and the biggest bonus to staying here is how centrally located it is. Minutes walk from Waikiki and surrounded by shops and food restaurants. We would definitely be happy to return here.

The hotel is located in the heart of Waikiki, close to the famous beach and surrounded by designer shops, local stores and restaurants. Although bit dated it is clean and quite nice. Our room was rather big and had safebox, mini-fridge and coffee maker. The accompanying bathroom came with the bathtub. The internet was included in the resort fee (not cheap!) and was of decent speed however you need to make login every single day. The staff was really friendly and helpful, they suggested a hotel shuttle for going to the airport which is less expensive than the regular taxi and equally comfortable. The only downside is the hotel garage. We read the reviews beforehand so we thought we knew what to expect however nothing can prepare you for this garage! It is simply horrific: not easily accessible, very steep especially when going down and out of it, which is almost impossible if someone is not navigating you - and not to mention one-way entrance&exit! Not being in your car but in rental only makes it worse for the fear of scratching it. And above all it doesn't come cheap! Yes it is Waikiki and yes as hotel guests you have privileged price but 30 $ for overnight stay is way too pricey for this horrible experience. A piece of advice: try your luck to find free parking along Ala Wai canal - just be patient, make 2 or 3 circles and make sure you don't leave it there on Mondays and Fridays from 8.30 till 11.30 pm to avoid towing because of street sweeping.

What a great accessible hotel this is. Slight delay on checking in but clean, great views, perfect location and excellent top floor bar staff- will revisit soon. Breakfast could improve but functional

The hotel is easily accessable and located 5 minutes from Waikiki Beach. There is easily 100's of shops and restaurants within minutes of the hotel. The check-in process was a breeze, and the staff was friendly. The room was not bad, it wasn't great, but it was mostly clean and up kept. Everything worked, and the bed was decently comfortable. The free wifi was, in fact, free and working.Really not much bad to say about this place. The WI-FI was a bit slow. The bathroom was clean, but the shower head had significant mineral build up. There is a sort of half balcony type thing, but you have to bring a chair out from the room if you want to sit. Some things were showing signs of wear and probably need an update, but not really a big deal.Bottom line: It was certainly not an upscale place but was very comfortable for the price, and the few small things I noticed are minor. Also, the bar downstairs is pretty decent, I recommend the pizza.
user_name:
Cort S
Virginia Beach, Virginia, United States

review_body: Mixed experience at the Ohana Malia. The Rivals Bar is downstairs which is noisy and smells quite beery, but floors 2-5 are carpark, so there is a buffer with the noise. We were on the 18th floor, which helped even more. The location on Kuhio off Lewers is central and convenient. And the resort fees include free access to the Pink Trolley line, which we used heaps. All good things.However, there was a foreign hair in the bathtub when we arrived. The closet door kept coming off the rails. We requested a king room and got two doubles, which was disappointing. The beds were also fairly old, dipped in the middle and were not very comfortable, especially when sharing with someone else. The room had plastic cups, each themselves wrapped in plastic, which bothered me from an environmental perspective. The shower was loosely attached to the wall and made getting the shower head into a useful position difficult. There was no fan/ventilation in the bathroom, which meant no way to extract steam (or anything else!) from the room. However, service was prompt and friendly. When we arrived there was an issue with the main entry light and it was fixed as soon as we reported it. All in all, this wasn't a bad hotel, just fairly basic and in need of a bit of maintenance.

We stayed at this hotel because we were there for Halloween.It is fun to be right down town for the Halloween festives that go on most of the day and into the next morning with some people.We were in room 903.Nice room, but do not stay on that side of the hotel. They might as well not have a sliding g glass door in the bedroom. It faced a street and the noise from people, police, etc was so loud we slept in the living room. About 4 in the AM someone down on the street was trying to drag a guy out of a van so he could beat him up. Someone finally called the police.Other wise it was quiet until the late night.We would stay there again. As it is close to the action but at 4 am in the morning I want to sleep. We had to laugh as they had a note in the elevator saying that if you were in a certain. Area in the hotel you had to be careful on how much water you used at certain times in the bathtub. We go look at our tub and it is made for a child. Guess certain. Nationally like to take tub baths.Otherwise the staff was helpful and friendly.

We came in from Kauai to catch our flight back to the mainland. We spent one night at the Ohana Malia. The folks at the front desk were helpful and knowledgeable. Our room had a nice view of the beach and was very comfortable. We were just a couple of blocks from the beach where we spent most of the day. Lots of shopping and restaurants within easy walking distance. This will be our go to hotel on our next trip to Honolulu.

This is a 5-star review. Not a 5-star hotel. But for the price, we received an unexpected level of service and accommodation. We arrived after flying all day from the east coast and found the front staff to be pleasant, helpful, and accommodating. They asked if we would like restaurant recommendations. When I mentioned we would be doing several things in Honolulu after checking out the next day, they offered not only to store our luggage but a complimentary hospitality room so we could freshen up before our flight to Kauai in the evening. After hiking Diamond Head, we took them up on the offer! That level of service was totally unexpected at this price point. Rooms were neat and clean. It's noisy because you're in one of the busiest parts of Waikiki. It's not a fancy place. But it's a great place to use as a base for a busy day in Honolulu!

We picked this hotel as it had a decent price through Costco Travel on a one bedroom room that sleeps 4. It is pretty basic and a bit dated but who wants to sit their hotel room Anyways. The one bedroom rooms do not have views and the bathroom is not very large and lacks counter space. It will cost you to park and the pool is very small but you can walk to the sister property and use their pool which is much nicer. You will also have to walk the four or five blocks to use the work out facility at the sister hotel. The staff is very nice and accommodating. The beach is about five blocks away as well as many nice restaurants.
user_name:
Steve C
Rancho Cordova, California, United States

review_body: We are locals who stayed one night to avoid having to drive home to Kailua after holiday partying. Malia had a great Kamaaina rate, plus they gave us half off from the resort fee and half off from the parking rate. You get a neat coupon book so you can save 15% on breakfast from the IHOP that you access right through the lobby. The room was a city view facing Kuhio and got loud at 3 am but that was because they had closed Kalakaua for the Marathon and rerouted to Kuhio. Usually not too bad. Small but usable balcony. Really like the location, close to everything in the heart of Waikiki.

This hotel is dated and the rooms are somewhat shabby, however, the location is excellent. It is approximately a 10-15 minute walk to the beach and there is a wide selection of restaurants, bars, shopping and other conveniences in the area. Using your room key, you can also ride the Pink Line bus for free and the stop is across the street from the hotel; the Pink Line does take you to the Ala Moana shopping mall which is a very popular destination. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful upon check in, I was hosting a large group and they expedited the guests to their rooms very efficiently. In the lobby area, there is an agent from Expedia who sells tours; she is very knowledgeable and I felt safer reserving tours with her than with the individuals on the streets that sell similar tours. We wanted to do a Luau and she recommended the Chief's Luau which was excellent. My only negative about the hotel was that the rooms did not get cleaned until very late in the day, sometimes after 3pm and one day our garbage was not removed at all; it could have been a staffing issue as we were there over Thanksgiving. The hotel has a jacuzzi and a very small swimming pool on site. There is a bar/restaurant too and there is also an IHOP next door as well as a pizza stand (the pizza was quite expensive). The rooms are dated and the views are not great, we were at the back of the hotel and the view was just buildings and rooftops; if you were on the front of the hotel, it may be more noisy since it is a busy street. I would recommend the hotel based on it's very convenient location to services and attractions and the room as spacious and comfortable.

We stayed here in June and enjoyed it so we book it again for our December trip. Maybe expectation was high but this stay is barely average. Our room was facing Kuhio street and it's noisy through the night. People yelling through the night. Daily 6 am wake up call from delivery trucks. We hear everything. Also when the wind blows the window rattles and knocks. Shower drains slowly and there is no fan in the washroom. Staff is still friendly, housekeeping is still doing a good job, but not sure we'll stay here again.

Good clean rooms, but mixed up our booking, single bed was a fold out and very uncomfortable sofa, we had to request another fold away. Views are limited to the streets. Location is fairly central to beach and shops. Staff are friendly and accommodating - it’s cheap for Hawaii so lots of group bookings.

We stayed here for 1 night on our way through to Australia. I mean not just the hotel, but all of hawaii was beautiful, amazing. The hotel was very nice. I had two double beds in my room and a larger balcony so with the extra room my group all came to my room before the night out. The staff were extremely friendly and the hotel is in a great location with lovely views. I didn't have time to try and see everything else in the hotel but from what I did it was top notch.

Hotel is centrally located, within walking distance to most sights, otherwise the complimentary trolley pass will help.We walked most places including up the Diamond Head crater.Reception staff very warm and welcoming. Rooms are spacious and clean. Would stay again if ever I return.

No frills nice clean hotel in the center of Waikiki , tiny pool and spa , IHOP , bar in hotel . Kamaaina discount by booking online with Outrigger . 1 block from beaches and shopping areas very convenient off the main drag .

Clean, nice hotel with excellent customer service and very well situated. We were greeted warmly by Peter as soon as we entered the lobby and he offered to put our luggages in storage since we arrived early. Tomoko who was so pleasant and friendly checked as in and even went outside on the last day of our stay, to see us off, to thank us for staying at Ohana Malia and make sure that I was ok since I sprained my left foot. So'O, Amante and Troy were extra helpful as well and very pleasant to deal with. We will certainly stay at the Ohana Malia on our next Honolulu trip for sure.

I am a government traveler and if rooms are available on base at Pearl Harbor/Hickam, you can stay there but if you decide to stay out in town, you are only reimbursed for what you would be charged at the Navy Gateway Inn and Suites.Yes, my out of pocket expense was a factor and the rate was great, much less than I’d spend on taxis or Lyft back and forth to Waikiki daily, but location was also a factor.The hotel is on Kuhio and Lewers! You are a few blocks from the International Marketplace and blocks from the heart of Waikiki! Frankly you are no more than a few blocks away from anything!I arrived on a Sunday around 3 and checked right in.The staff is friendly and while the decor is a bit dated, the rooms are clean and comfortable! When my TV remote died, a new one was upstairs in minutes. I even had a view! I was traveling alone and only worked or slept when in the room but it was just right. This place seems popular with Japanese tour groups and is family friendly. There is a small pool area in an interior courtyard for convenience but with the beach close by, who needs it.Rivals, the best sports bar in Waikiki is downstairs and so is IHOP.Overall, this rates a 4/5 in my book and I will probably stay here again in a few months!

The Ohana Waikiki Malia was a great little economical hotel right in the centre of Waikiki and within blocks of the beautiful beaches. We stayed on the 7th and then the 9th floor before and after our cruise. Both rooms were very clean, comfortable and quiet, but the 9th floor in the tower was a bit of an upgrade and we enjoyed the extra space.The staff were very friendly, and helpful. The travel desk was very convenient and also super helpful, as we booked 2 excursions and airport transportation from them.We ate our breakfast everyday in the Ihop next door and dinner at restaurants that were also within easy walking distance.So all in all, everything we needed at very affordable price. I highly recommend the Ohana Waikiki Malia

I visit family and friends 4-5 times a year and try to stay at the Outrigger Waikiki Malia or Outrigger Waikiki East!They are both located in the heart of Waikiki!The hotels are 3 star but their rooms are clean, the beds are super comfy and the staff always makeme feel very welcome!You couldn't ask for a friendlier staff and valet service...If you stay here, you will experience the true Aloha spirit and Hawaiian hospitality!The only downside is the resort fee added to your room but most of the hotels in Waikiki charge a resort fee plus tax...All-in-all my stays have always been exceptional!

We used Costco to book a week at this hotel. The room was spacious with a lounge which housed a double bed-settee, a kitchenette and a bedroom with a balcony. It was well furnished but lacked a kettle and a microwave. It has a tiny pool and we discovered a gym as we left. There's an ordinary cafe attached and it's on the main street with buses, ABC and all so convenient. The staff were pretty helpful and there's a travel desk.

This was by 3rd stay at this hotel. My room was on the 17th floor. The staff were friendly, helpful and amazing. The room was very clean and tidy and the daily maid service was efficient and accurate to attention.The hotel is excellent value for money and the location is perfect. The beds were comfortable and had an excellent nights sleep each night of the 11 night stay. The Pizza booth at the front of the hotel has excellent Pizza.The Expedia booth by the elevators was very handy in booking day trips.I will definately stay here again next and recommend it to anyone else looking for a reasonably priced.The Pink Line trolley stop immediately across the road allowed for easy access (Free with room card) to Ala Moana Centre.The location of the Hotel a short 5-10 stroll down Lewers street to the beach and Royal Hawaiian Centre leading on to the wonderful cheesecake factory and Duke's Barefoot Bar and Grill for excellent Food.Having the I-Hop restaurant located in the building meant easy access for lunch.

My wife and I were recently there on our honeymoon and I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy. We booked this place through Costco Travel and were looking for a place to stay in Oahu but we knew we weren't going to be in the room very much so we just wanted something decent. This place was NOT decent. First of all, we booked this place thinking there was a kitchen in it so we could save some money cooking breakfast and what not. There was a sink & a microwave and they called that a kitchen. The plates and silverware in the "kitchen" looked like they hadn't been washed in months. The put us in a room with a full bed for our HONEYMOON. I called the front desk to complain and let them know that we weren't satisfied and that it was our honeymoon. I was looking for something to tell me that they cared about their guests to make it right with me. They even put me on the phone with the manager. He pretty much told me to pound sand and better luck next time. It was by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed in on a vacation. Luckily we didn't have to spend much time in there, it actually forced us to go out more and explore since we didn't want to spend any time in the room. The bathroom was the size of a coat closet, the shower was nasty & small, next to zero sink space. The room hadn't been updated since the 80's would be my guess. I guess the worst part of it all is that they knew it was our honeymoon and they did nothing to try and remedy the situation with us. I would expect a little more from them when they for all intensive purposes catfished us with the pictures and descriptions of the rooms. Spring for the hotel that's a few $100 more, you will not regret it. This place is awful!!!

The experience was great while staying here. The views from our floor (8th) were amazing. The location is so handy about a 10-15 minute walk from the beach and the staff are all so friendly. I personally would definitely stay here again.

With my absolutely sincerity I can say that this place was the right quality/price compromise to stay in Waikiki. Placed in the centre of the tourist place, easy to reach and well serviced by bus. Five minutes by feet from the beach. Good service, appreciated hydromassage pool. Very appreciated the opportunity to make a shower after the check-out time, returning from the beach before going to the airport.Very satisfied.

Location, location, location...if being on the beach in Waikiki and paying $500+ a night for your hotel room is not "a must", then check out the Ohana Waikiki Malia by Outrigger. Located just a couple blocks from the beach (and a single block from the Royal Hawaiian Centre and all the action on Kalakaua Avenue), the Ohana Waikiki Malia by Outrigger offers budget friendly rooms in a clean and secure hotel. Part of the Outrigger hotel chain, the Ohana Waikiki Malia by Outrigger has a 24 hour IHOP restaurant and a sports bar that shows NFL games & UFC fights. Not what you'll find at the Four Seasons, but then for $112 + tax per night in Waikiki, can you complain? The Ohana Waikiki Malia by Outrigger is an older property, but its location is excellent.I stayed 4 nights in room 1629. The room, while not large, did feature a king size bed, comfortable pillows & lines, flat screen tv, a basic washroom with tub/shower combo, a safe and a fridge! All employees, from the front desk to room service, provided pleasant service with a smile and an "Aloha" greeting. Overall, for Waikiki and considering the low cost (for Waikiki), the Ohana Waikiki Malia by Outrigger does well for itself. True, you will find yourself surrounded by Japanese Tour Groups also staying at the hotel, but they won't bite and you might even make a new friend. My advice is do not dismiss the Ohana Waikiki Malia by Outrigger when searching for accommodation in Waikiki.

We really enjoyed our stay here. Excellent value property in Waikiki. The staff was extremely friendly, always greeting us by name the entire two weeks we were here. Pam at the front seat and Troy the bellman went over and above to make our stay excellent. We will definitely stay here again and share with our friends.

We stayed on the 5th floor in a one bedroom with kitchenette. The price was much better than other locations. This was perfect for our family as both of our teenagers were able to have their own single beds in the living room with a tv and we had a separate bedroom as well. Having the kitchenette was also very useful. Room was nice and clean. There was an issue initially with the air conditioner that was leaking but was immediately fixed. There is a small indoor pool and spa. Waikiki is busy so you will hear the street traffic at night. Bring earplugs if this is an issue for you. Location of the hotels was very close to everything. A few minutes from the beach and restaurants. There is a iHOP restaurant as well as a pizza place at the street level, The food was good at both of these locations.There is also a sports bar.You are offered free use of the trolley with your key card. There are lots of buses that do run in front of the hotel which is convenient and easy to use. We did not rent a car while we were in Honolulu. We traveled by bus and shuttles while we were there.The flower leis that are available at the front desk on a daily basis is a nice personal touch.

Location and price are probably the two best points of this hotel. The price of the hotel is moderate compared with other hotels in Waikiki. That is most of the time my first choice if I look for a hotel. I most say that I think the "resort/connection fee" they charged is way to much. The hotel does not have really resort features. The pool is terrible small and not a nice area. It is located between the buildings with no view. No sun loungers. Yes, wifi is ok, but $15 dollars for this, Ridiculous but unfortunately most of the hotel charge this fee now. Service is as you can expect, staff is friendly. Hotel is room is good too. You can see that the hotel is a bit older and it probably needs refurbising in the near future. Double glazing would be a good improvement. We stayed twice here in a fortnight. The first time we had a room at the 18th floor and than the noise of the road is almost gone, but the second time we had a room at the 8th level and this is pretty noisy. As I said, location is OK. On Kuhio, towards the end of Waikiki, so not in the really busy area. 10 minute walk to the beach, shops all around. 5 minutes to a supermarket. Would I stay here again. I am not sure. Maybe yes, but I will look first for an hotel with a comparable price, with a pool in an outside area, without a resort fee and maybe a bit more luxury, although I know I have to pay for this.

This is a reasonably priced hotel within walking distance to Waikiki Beach. The rooms, beds and amenities are nothing to write home about, they are on par with something like motel 6. The bathroom is so small that when open the door obstructs the shower. There is a small unrepaired hole in the wall on one side of the bed. There is also no on site restaurant or food service of any kind. However, the staff is extraordinarily friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean.Overall I would stay at one of the other outriggers that are on the beach if I came back. But if you have a tight budget and don't plan to spend any time in the hotel the OHANA Malia will do.

Before visiting Hawaii, I visited NYC and stayed at Ritz Carlton which was 10 times expensive than Ohana Maria. At Ritz Carlton, they told me that my reservation had been cancelled and there are no rooms.(I did not cancell) Is this famous high hospitality hotel? I did not feel any hospitality during my 6 days stay at Ritz Carlton NYC. and right after that,visited hawaii. when i walked into OHANA MARIA, thinking about what would I do if Hotel man say they are not holding my reservation? the man at check-in desk said" You must be Mr.XXX".I was so sureprised and so happy to hear that. relieved. I only stayed OHANA MARIA for 2nights, but everytime I walked into hotel, staff said "welcome back Mr.XXX" to me. This hotel is not luxury at all. No ocean view. But there is something much impotant than those things at OHANA MARIA. I was sureprised when I found out what OHANA means. Yes this is where I felt to be back home.

Checked in with 12 suitcases. One way trip back to Oz. Just 2 kids and myself as husband had to move our car. I had to go 4 times up the lift to the 11th floor. Checked in at 3:05pm. Noticed 3 male staff in the lobby, no one offered to help with the suitcases. Check in staff (male who checked us in) misdirected my husband to the parking area. He told him to just "go around the corner and the carpark is just there". My husband took 30 minutes because there were one-way streets that forced him to reroute and go around several blocks to get back to the hotel. Check-in staff had no eye contact and wasn't very helpful or informative and showed no inititiative when asked simple questions or offered any suggestions. In case you are wondering there is no valet parking, which was expected as it's not a 5-star hotel or anything. Carpark is extremely narrow and you wouldn't be able to take your average pick-up truck in there (due to the narrowness). Carpark attendants were nice but kept thinking we were "new" guests everytime we came back from somewhere even after an hour, seemed like no system in place. One indoor pool and spa surrounded by walls and car-park on lobby level. Small sports bar in lobby. We were allocated to room 1120, stayed 8/25 to 8/29 2017 - facing the marriott hotel. Small balcony. Two double beds. Good size room. Little fridge. Very narrow wardrobe. Small bathroom. Housekeeping service was great from friendly housemaid. Booked shuttle service through front desk. Male operator said he would call back to confirm but never did. So 3 days later I went to check at the desk. The female lady assumed we had booked directly with a shuttle company and said we needed to check with the company ourselves. I repeated to her that I had actually booked it through the hotel and was still waiting for confirmation. So she checked their books and reluctantly confirmed they had our details. The pool was closed on saturday night due to a "private function" but Im not sure if they offered to use another pool at an alternative hotel because I never bothered to ask. However we weren't informed of this beforehand or at check-in the day before. Paid $650+ including tax (USD) for 4 nights stay. Paid $30 per day for parking. Check-out process was smoother than check-in. Hotel is conveniently located near main strip. (It is above ihop... if you are very patient and can tolerate extremely slow service (took more than 20 minutes for drinks to come out and more than 30minutes for a simple food order to come out in a non-busy environment). Overall stay was "ok" at the Malia, probably wouldn't go back though.

The hotel room seemed a little sketchy, but there was nothing to worry about. No bed bugs, no dirt, etc. You essentially get what you pay for here. This hotel is, however, in a very good area to walk to everything. They also had complimentary luggage storage which made travel arrangements easy. No shuttle service to the airport. The shower/bathtub was very tiny. Our room was on an upper floor and had decent views of the city.

Pleasant, Friendly, and great service, will come again. Walking distance to everything you need and want. Parking is tight, high suv & trucks maybe an issue. Clean, close by to restaurants and beach. good value

We stayed five nights. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The location is great with shopping and restaurants nearby, easy walk to beach. Beach towels available for checkout. The room was very clean. I would prefer more updated decor and a bigger bathroom. Walls were thin; we could hear the guests next door having a regular conversation.

The Hotel is well situated, clean and comfortable. My room was very comfortable. The staff are always very pleasant and caring and only too willing to help when needed. It is my 4th trip to the Hotel and enjoyed each visit there. This time I brought my Canadian family, who enjoyed the experience too and wish to make a return trip too. My Husband and I loved this Hotel.Rosalie Thomas. Melbourne, Australia

We had multiple rooms for our stay so I was able to see a variety of room styles. One room had a full kitchen which was great. These rooms would be good if you have kids because there is a separate room from the kitchen and living room.The room I stayed in however was a bed, and a bathroom. Not even a microwave. AND no vent or air circulation so the room always smelled musky and like mildew. The parking garage gave me serious anxiety. It's super steep and ONE LANE!!! Plus it's $30/ day. Each corner you go around is a 3 point turn and if someone is coming up while you are trying to leave, you have to back up and around the corners. Just typing about it is making me anxious all over again. Pluses: staff were really nice and helpful. Location is decent with just a small walk to the beach. You get free use of a shuttle through Waikiki or up to Ala Moana. We took the shuttle once and it was really easy. Elevators were quick, and they have 4 so they are easily accessible and you never have to wait long. All-in-all, it was a decent stay but I wouldn't stay there again.

My stay at the hotel was okay. I don't think for what I paid for was worth the price for the service or the room. We weren't told anything about the parking price or resort fees. When I checked in for my stay I was just asked for my information and room keys. I wasn't told to take advantage of the other services that were available to all room guests at the hotel. Parking was way too expensive, $20/25 per day and the resort fee that no one even told me about shocked me the most. I just thought that once I had checked in I would of been aware of all the fees but I wasn't which was a bummer to my stay. My hotel happened to be in the end of the hallway which was a good and bad thing. Good because it we didn't hear any foot traffic from the other guest but bad because during the night you can hear everything outside of the hotel. Good thing that I was a deep sleeper but still some nights I could not sleep due to the noise outside. Also, I asked for a non-smoking room but here and there throughout the day and night when we were in our room there will be a strong smell of cigarette smokes. The smell was so bad that it made me not want to stay inside the room at all and also caused some sleepless nights at the hotel. The hotel is at a nice location where it's not far from the shopping centers and beach. That's the only pro that I can say about my stay at the hotel. I wish I can say more but that's the only two that is coming as of now to mind.Just keep in mind you will pay for parking and there is a resort fee that may not be told to you when you check in. Be sure to ask if there is any other fees that you would need to pay for when you do check in.

The Ohana Malia was perfect for our 4 night stay in Waikiki. The hotel is older but the room was a good size, fridge and clean! The ocean view was enough and the fireworks from the Hilton was perfectly seen. The staff is very customer orientated and amazing with the different cultures that came through. The pool area is small but perfect for a quick dip after being busy all day. Just 2 blocks to the beach and great location to eateries, shops and bus stop! Would stay here again..unless I'm going for the luxury type hotel. Thanks for a good vacation spot to lay our heads!

I wish I could give all 5-stars but I feel like doing so would be a form of dishonesty. Don't get me wrong, I had an overall good experience at the ʻOhana Waikiki Malia, but there were some things I found that weren't up to par with my expectations, which are pretty average. Here are the pros and cons of this hotel based on my experience there:Pros:1. The location is very good (close to the Royal Hawaiian Center & Waikiki Beach area)2. The Waikiki Connection Fee that is charged to every reservation includes unlimited rides on the Waikiki Trolley for each person with a room key card (just show the room key card to the driver when boarding)3. The IHOP restaurant on the ground level is very good and the service there was great4. There's a room option for three people looking for a room with 3 seperate beds (My party and I were all friends and didn't feel like sharing beds)5. The customer service at the front desk was very good and I felt like we were welcomedCons:1. The room we stayed in had some spots that weren't cleaned too well2. The elevator operation was very confusing at first (the front desk person helped us out though, which was a plus)3. Even though I was told by the front desk that late check-out was available for my reservation, when I called the cashier/cash office they told me that they couldn't offer us late check-out because there was no vacancy at the time (We had a flight later on in the night and wanted to keep our luggage in our room and be able to go back and take showers and things like that; although they did offer us a hospitality room and luggage storage at the bell desk, which made up for the fact)Overall, my experience at the ʻOhana Waikiki Malia was pretty good, and I would recommend it for people looking for family or small-group accommodations who are on a budget or people trying to find a decent last-minute option.

We were at the Ohana for 4 nights. The room we got for the first night had an old carpet. I told the front desk that we'd like to switch out of that room and they were very professional in accomodating our request. We got two connecting rooms for the same price on the 18 floor. Thank you Kayo and Manny! The view of the ocean from our rooms was amazing! Also the hotel is located walking distance from world class dining and shopping experiences. We couldn't have been happier. I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a hotel in Waikiki.

We have been to Waikiki many times but on this trip chose this hotel for reasonable cost. The customer service from check in until check out is outstanding! They go out of their way to ensure your request at reservation are met on check in which will absolutely ensure I will definately stay at this hotel again. The location is awesome....just steps from the ocean, restaurants, and the main strip of Waikiki. The bed and pillows were so comfortable and the room was extremely clean. The management and employees deserve 5 stars as they truly understand how to treat their guest with aloha spirit. This was my first time at this hotel but I will never stay anyway but this hotel when I return to Waikiki next year! Thank you for making our stay a special one!
user_name:
iluvtheocean
North Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

review_body: We only stayed here 1 night. Nice location – easy walking distance to Waikiki Beach. Pick up for tour companies is right across the street. Front desk staff very competent and pleasant. Room was clean, nicely decorated, great view from our window on the 15th floor. Did not need parking so cannot comment on availability. Indoor pool was tiny but most come here for the beach. Secure system for their luggage room. I would stay here again.

one problem we had we arrived at the hotel 8.30 am after landing at 6.00am was told our room was not ready till 3.00pm .We walked the streets till 12.30 pm went back to hotel to be told still not ready BUT we could up grade for $25.00 per night extra booking was for 9 nights a lot of extra money to pay out but we reclined the offer. Our room finally became available at 2.30pm Office staff seemed not interested in our problem My husband is 72 years old and I am 69 Not a good start to our holiday M Marsh

I stayed there 2 years ago and I'm glad that I came back. The staff are very helpful and the location is convenient to everything. I injured my elbow 5 days before my trip and my arm was in a sling. The staff really went out of their way to help me out, especially the bellman Pat.

We booked this hotel for the location and the value. The free pink line trolley seals the deal. But this hotel is far more than just good value. First thing we noticed is how clean our room is. Even the lamps in the room are clean. You'll be surprise how many are not.The staffs are very friendly and very eager to help. Even though when they were swamped with huge group of tourists checking in together, they will always flash you a smile and ask if you need anything. We have never gotten that from any other hotel or resorts.The wifi works very well. The beach towels are decent. The pool is small. The self serve laundry on the fifth flow is super useful.Note: The rooms on the far south west side of the hotel could be a bit noisy since there is a bar about a block away that has live music and their closing time is early morning.

Great location. Close to shops, restaurants, bars, 10 minute walk to Fort DeRussy Beach Park. The rooms are spacious, clean and the beds are comfy. (Thank you Susanna, our room cleaner, for all your careful attention to detail. You are great at what you do.) And it is great value for money! On top of all this you have the best front desk staff in Waikiki. Their customer service is second to none. Always ready to help you with a big smile and a 'can do' attitude. Thanks to Pamela, Brian, Manny, Junko, Kayo for all the fabulous customer service. These staff are lead by their manager Roy, who is exemplary in his position of front desk manager. It is because of Roy, and the gang, that we will return to the Ohana Malia time and time again, knowing we will be treated like Ohana. See you again real soon.

An older hotel this is very well maintained. Our room was on the city side and the traffic noise was a little loud, but did not disturb my sleep. The room was quite clean and I enjoyed the fitness room.

This is a nice, nothing fancy but very clean and comfortable hotel. It is 2 blocks to the beach, close to all the shopping and they offer you the trolley with your key card. And for the price you pay for this is unbeatable to almost every other hotel. Pool area isn't fantastic, but you have the use of their sister hotel a couple of blocks down and who really wants to swim in the pool when the beach is right there!! Very friendly staff and you can get a little flower for your hair every day :)

We stayed on the 10th floor in a very nice room. Quiet, clean, and comfortable. Waikiki beach and Kalakaua Avenue are just a short walk away. There is an IHOP at street level, which is convenient if you have to get a quick bite very early in the morning. They serve a plain breakfast for $12, but for a dollar more you can get something very special at the Hula Grill (above Duke's Restaurant) in the Outrigger Waikiki hotel on Kalakaua Avenue.The Ohana is on Kuhio Avenue and many buses stop right in front. The bus lines go practically everywhere on the island and with a little homework (and a Google phone app) you can get to places like Moana Falls, Diamond Head trailhead, Kailua, and Ala Moana shopping center for $2 each way (a ticket is good for unlimited transfers for two hours).

Good location that is walkable to the beach, on a bus route to go many places, restaurants close by, rooms were nice and clean.fridge in rooms.There was an indoor pool and a spa pool with jets that was very relaxing after a day in the sun.

After shopping around for a last minute room, we settled on the Malia as an alternative to the higher priced locations. The Malia is on the corner of Kuhio and Lewers, both very busy streets, at all hours of the day.The room was clean, very large, nicely decorated, with a separate desk and chair to the side. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was small but very clean and adequate.We were given a room on the Kuhio street side on the top (18th) floor. Having lived in Waikiki before, I had high hopes that this would be far enough away from the street noise to get away from the noise at night. Nope!Waikiki is a busy place at night, with lots of people in a party mood, until 4AM. The street traffic runs continually, complete with emergency vehicles, motorcycles and mopeds. Directly across Kuhio is another hotel, equally as tall, that acts as a sound reflector for the Kuhio street noise. All of the rooms facing Kuhio are going to be subject to the street noise.On my second visit to this hotel, I requested a room on the other side, figuring that being away from Kuhio would be much quieter. I was given a room on the 16th floor with a high room number, meaning is was the closest to the Lewers street end. Lewers isn't quiet at night either. At 4AM, people were yelling and screaming in the street.Admittedly, it was a weekend night, but still, I had high hopes of being able to sleep. It wasn't the traffic noise like the Kuhio side, but it was hard to get a night's rest. I wound up turning the AC temperature all the way down to try and block the noise.The hotel caters to a lot of international guests and the lobby staff seems to be very versed in handling Japanese customers. The lobby is small but adequate. Be careful stepping out the front door as the sidewalk has cars driving on it to unload guests. I went out the front door in a hurry only to be startled by a passing car.The hotel has a sports bar off the lobby and there's also an entrance into the IHOP restaurant, located in the same building. Very convenient. The hotel has parking, but you can often find metered street parking if you are patient. After 6PM the spaces are free, but you have feed the meter starting at 7AM, the next morning, unless it's Sunday.A lot of Waikiki hotels are now charging a 'resort' fee. It's a daily charge, added to your room bill. If the hotel was directly on the beach, or had other vacation amenities, a resort fee might be explainable. It seems like they're charging this because the other hotels are doing it. I don't see any 'extra' benefit to warrant the charge.The higher floor rooms, that are opposite from the Kuhio side, have a nice partial ocean view, overlooking the other businesses and buildings in the foreground. In my opinion, the better rooms are the ocean view, lower numbered rooms, closer to the elevator, rather than the Lewers street end. Definately not on the Kuhio street side.

Spacious room at a convenient location. I had a little table and chair in a seating area in addition to the desk. Nothing fancy but welcoming, clean rooms at an affordable price. I would not hesitate to stay here again. FYI on the bill, connection fee= resort fee=wifi fee

For business the hotel is fine. Rooms are basic but in no way bad. Clean and good size. Balconies are a bit small as well as bathroom, but again not bad. Many restaurants and lots of shopping walking distance. Not to far from Beach, about a 5 minute walk. Staff is VERY friendly. Reception are very nice and informative. For business, works fine.

This was my second trip to Waikiki and I decided to stay in a different location. Were very close to the shops, a 5-10 minute walk. Staff were friendly and helpful with directions. So close to the bus stops which helped as we used this almost daily.

Stayed here several nights on our way home from The Big Island because we wanted to visit the USS Arizona Memorial. The rate was good. The room was clean but dated and needs a little work. It was quiet and the staff is friendly and helpful. Because we spent little time in the hotel it was a perfect fit. We didn't rent a car and were able to walk everywhere (except the memorial - took a tour there). If you are looking for a reasonable, clean place that affords Waikiki walkability, would recommend this hotel.

On our 40th Wedding Anniversary ... we bought the package deal ... with flight and hotel. This hotel met our needs ... right in Kuhio Ave ... middle of many stores and eateries ... walking distance to Waikiki ... Although Ohana Hotel is on a busy street ... our room was quiet. The room had a balcony .. just nice to have coffee and McD .. rice and Spam or Portuguese sausage ... nice breakfast to start our walking tour ... and enjoy a nice breeze. They offered a complimentary bus that takes you to the Mall .. to connect to diff bus routes to view the island ... just take a ride around the island. In the evening ... just beautiful to take a walk ... burn off calories ... felt safe ... many tourist doing the same. Lots of ABC store to buy souveniers ..

The service manager Mr. Amante "Boyet" Castro was very helpful, very courteous, and very,very friendly.Every time we see him in the lobby. He made our stay in the hotel a very memorable one. Also, John ( I don't know his last name) from the Expedia local expert was very helpful in reserving our dinner/cruise on the Star of Honolulu. Me and my wife were supposed to go on Mon.11 April . We drove to the place, but because of traffic, we didn't make it on time and missed the boat. We told John about it and he made some calls and re-booked us for the cruise the next day. He made our day. Kudos to both Amante and John. A job very well done. MAHALO!!!!!.

Stayed just one night but it was a good choice. The front desk staff and bellman was very friendly and helpful. The room décor is a little dated but the room was very clean, AC cold, bathroom very clean provides shampoo, soap, shower cap..etc..love that it had a fridge...small balcony overlooking other buildings...didn't matter. Excellent internet connection. Girls and I had fun riding the double decker Pink Trolley to and from Ala Moana. IHOP restaurant right next to it. We had two meals there both meals were great. I would definitely stay here again.

Just got back from here. Excellent stay. This hotel is in the middle part of Waikiki. Not on the beach. About a block and a half. 10 minute walk to beach. I been to Waikiki many times. This is not a fancy hotel...and...to me..... does not have the greatest views since they are in the middle part and in between other hotels in front, behind etc. But my wife and I were not there for that. I have stayed in beach front hotels in Waikiki in the past.....many years ago.... but found that I was not at hotel enough to justify the cost. Anyway....the Ohana Waikiki Malia has it down perfectly. Great, GREAT.... friendly staff....from the front desk...to the tour promoter (not pushy)....comfortable rooms...excellent cleaning and maintenance room staff..etc. As far as the hotel itself...it is an older building....decor is older....but well kept. Building outside...looks clean...maybe it can use a new paint job! The color seemed kind of dull. Its sort of an off tan/yellow color. Anyway...no biggy. Pool area is almost non existent....but there is a small pool area ground level just past the front desk. Again...not very big. I did not use it. There is also an IHOP (International House of Pancakes) right next to hotel. Same building...and a bar....same building. Again, this is not a beach front hotel...some bar is inside....with no views. But..I did not use bar. But I did go to the IHOP once. All very good. Hotel over all is not too expensive, including the resort fee. (More on that below)....but I felt good about staying there. The one thing I am never happy, EVER, is the so call resort fee....which was $15.71 per day!! NO BUENO!! You'll be told about it when you arrive...and pay when you leave at check out. The fee generally pays for such things as beach towel, Internet access (internet access was EXCELLENT). At all times. I was on the 11th floor...maybe I was closer to the modem. haha! The fee also pays for.... Newspaper, Phone callsIn-room safe In-room coffee. I only used internet and newspaper. You would think the hotel price on the package is it...BUT NOPE!! I really wish hotels include this in the price...but I accounted for this prior to booking so I did not make a big deal. So please be aware that hotels charge extra. Its Hawaii....run by incompetent politicians who pass feel good laws so they get re-elected....so they feel good...but do they do any good? Nope! So.....businesses have to survive. That's my take. Anyway....I stayed for 8 nights so I added $125.68....again...I accounted for this. So the total fee was more than what your final receipt is. This last opinion has nothing to do with the way I felt about the hotel...and my review above...but the fee SHOULD BE PART OF THE PRICE. BTW....bed was comfortable and first time in a long time the pillows where great. For some reason pillows are never quite right for me at hotels. But this hotel...at least my room...was pretty good. I would stay here again...and recommend.

We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment with kitchenette. Great layout as couches were actually single beds which my son used at night - but we had a tv in the bedroom and balcony was off this also, so he could sleep and us not disturb him. Looked like our room was in an older section of the hotel but it was very clean and comfortable. It's less than 10 minutes walk to beach and resort fees include free use of pink trolley bus (which was great to visit the huge shopping centre) and wifi. Pool area is small and no beach view so good if you're planning to be out and about a lot! We were only here for a 36 hour stopover from Sydney to Canada but would definitely stay again and recommend!

We stayed at Malia as a family of four adults. In the past we have stayed at Ohana East but chose Malia for their bargain price. We booked a family room with 4 single beds. The room was in the Luana wing and was a bit dated, but it was perfect. There was a bedroom with two beds and a kitchenette with everything we could need ,and the lounge area had two days beds that were full sized single beds. The bathroom was good , the water was hot with good pressure. The lanai was a good size, but you had to stand to see over the rail (kept the noise out). Everything was supplied, coffee, shampoo etc. Beach towels were available from the front desk anytime you needed one. We used the spa and pool when they weren’t full of teenagers. Ihop downstairs was our go to eating spot as it was so convenient and good value. The free Trolley was great as usual and the bus nearby. This hotel is not as close to the beach as Ohana East but it is not much further and it is really close to the main shops and restaurants. Parking is available but the entrance is steep and narrow. We were out most of the time so had little interaction with the staff, but when we did they were friendly and helpful. The price we got was amazing. We would definitely stay here again.

While this is an older style hotel (not one of those big swanky properties down on the beach) it is very well looked after & provides for a great stay. The best feature however is it's great location right in the midst of all the Waikiki restaurants, shops (Rosses is just around the corner) & is a stroll to the beach. Because it's not on the beach it is much more affordable & all the bus routes to places like Pearl Harbor & Diamond Head pass by out the front door. There is also a free shuttle to the huge Ala Moana shopping centre.The staff are oh so helpful & make any visitor very welcome. We enjoyed our 5night stay.
user_name:
Jan M
West Pennant Hills, Australia

review_body: Our first time to Hawaii on a cruise and stay at Ohana Malia. I would recommend this to anyone, an awesome hotel and great location. A "free" trolley to travel Honolulu and bus travel almost anywhere in Oahu for only $1.00 for seniors. Can't think of anything negative to say about this hotel.

Stayed here for 4 nights and loved it super clean and comfortable great location for shopping in Waikiki would definitely stay here again the staff were very friendly and helpful. Older building but well maintained and looked after.

Great hotel ,Nice and clean hotel lovely safe . Yes it is older but the beds are so comfortable and the rooms have everything you need service is amazing . Close to the beach vey helpful. Thank you for a great stay .

Stuff friendly, good location and not too far from the beach. Let's say 6 minutes walk. Also nearby the shops & with your room card you got free access to the pink line trolley. The rooms are normal standard with a little balcony. I saw from my room the beach.

Booked this in a package .... booked a twin room as I was travelling with a friend. Found out a few days before travelling that we had a queen bed & a sofa bed. I hate sofa beds & to me they are for a third person in a room or a child. Certainly not a second bed in a twin bed booking!!! I emailed the hotel with this information & received an email back that she would put a request in to the booking. On arrival we found out we still had the queen bed & sofa bed so obviously no care factor here! We were put into the Luana wing which needs a serious upgrade. I'm not sure we were told there were 2 standards of accom when we made the booking or maybe they just put the Australians in this wing.Room was really dark as there was no window only a frosted window that let in minimal light in the main lounge. There was a balcony off the queen bed room but when seated you were looking at a cement wall & had to stand to get a view of the street. Some street noise from the balcony especially on Fri morning..... unbelievably noisy..... rubbish day maybe?The pool is tiny & didn't even bother to try & get a toe wet in there as it was always packed with young Japanese guests.Breakfast at iHop was great & used the hole in the wall pizza that was good value too. Free transport on the city circle pink line with stops outside the door & the location was good for shops, bars & restaurants. Not sure I'd stay again as this hotel seemed a lot more orientated towards the Japanese than say the Hilton Waikiki I stayed in Oct last year.

We booked our room through hotels.com and on the site it didn't state that we would be charged an extra $15 per day for a "resort fee". This hotel was by no means a resort. The rooms were nice enough but it was nothing beyond the standard cheap hotel room.

Room was for 4 of us. Consisted of a double bed and 2 sofas that were used. There was a nice bathroom with a good powerful shower. There was.a small kitchen area, with sink, fridge toaster and coffee maker. We had a balcony with chairs and small table. There was a jacissi and small pool off the reception. The hotel was central for getting around, and when using Waikiki trolley bus we didn't have to pay.

The Hotel is very clean and neat. My housekeeper was fantastic! The hotel staff and maintenance workers were unbelievably welcoming, helpful, cheerful, and truly care about their guests and security/safety. I will go back to the Malia next year--can't wait to see Manuel, Pam and Troy. Waikiki is getting quite busy and you can tell by the noise and traffic on the weekends. Nice ABC store across the street as well as wonderful transit system. You can ride just about anywhere for 2.50 one way!Rivals sports bar right next door with great specials you can't beat. Love you guys at the Malia!

We stayed at the Outrigger Ohana Malia Hotel for a week this month while our son and his family stayed at our timeshare a held block away. Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff accommodated our request for a higher floor which was good because as a city that never sleeps, there was a lot of activity outside on the street when the bars close.Housekeeping staff was very prompt and friendly. The bathroom was in good repair and very clean.The coffeemaker with complimentary coffee, mini fridge, and safe were appreciated and used daily. The only thing that could have improved the set up was a small microwave.The location is right in the middle of Waikiki and within walking distance of everything. It was a good value for the money.I would definitely stay there again, and I recommend it if you are not looking looking for fancy accommodations, but clean and cozy. Yes, there are much more expensive hotels and resorts in Waikiki. But if you are spending most of your time and money on beautiful Oahu activities, this hotel will serve you nicely.

Our room faced Kuhio Street which is very loud at night. There is a bar kitty corner from the hotel which seems to attract really loud people who want get drunk and whoop it up all night long. Even when you close your balconey door, it is still very noisy. On top of that, the noise from the traffic and sirens going by all the time it seemed. However, the hotel itself was very quiet. I never heard any noise from the rooms next door to us. The swimming pool was tiny and the few times I thought I would go to use it, it was filled with kids so I never had a chance to use it. Now for the good points, the Staff is very, very accommodating and friendly. They ALWAYS had a smile and a warm greeting. This includes the front desk, housekeeping, maintenance and any other staff we encountered during our stay. The rooms were clean. The only reason I would not stay here again is because of the noise at night. You could possibly ask to have a room which faces the opposite side but then your view is the parking ramp and the tops of other hotels. It's got to be much quieter.

All of the staff was great as well as welcoming. Could not have asked for a better place to stay. They were so close to everything plus they were very helpful in allowing us to use their Concierge to have a package place in our Son's room on the eveing of his and newly married Wife's room to surprise them. I sure that they felt that we were all a little crazy but the made us feel very comfortable during our stay. I would most definitely stay here again when givin the opportunity.

My husband and I recently got back from 10 days in Hawaii. We went to Ouaha Stayed at Waikiki Malia. Found it to be a nice centrally located hotel. Close to International Market and not very long walk to beach. The room was a bit outdated, but spacious and had a fridge which was great for keeping things in. The balcony was not vey user friendly....smaller than a postage stamp and no chairs and table could fit there let alone two people. However we did have a great view of ocean and some of the nicer buildings there. Was a nice little sports bar Rivals to get a refreshing drink and IHop restaurant was there. As well just up street was McDonalds and a pizza place. ABC store was on corner so was convenient for my husband to go get a decent tea each morning. Overall this resort suited the needs.

Look- it's not like we needed a swanky place to stay in Honolulu. The fun is all outdoors anyway. And the good parts of this hotel are that it's located just a few walking blocks to the beach, it's reasonably priced, and there's a bus you can ride for free around the downtown area. (The Pink Line- it does not go to the airport or to Pearl Harbor it's just around the shops downtown.)The not so good parts: it's pretty dated- tall people don't really fit in the shower, the bed was very small and the springs were super uncomfortable. The wall AC unit was very loud and when it was off we heard the neighbor coughing and the noise from the city. The pool is about the size of a hot tub. There were unavoidable steps to get to our room (ok we probably could have gotten an accessible room but we didn't think to ask.) I'm really not sure what the $20 resort fee covers but I get that most hotels here charge that extra fee when you arrive.Basically, if the price is right and you're not staying long it's probably ok. I do not recommend going over your budget for this hotel- "average" is generous but "poor" was too harsh. It's actually somewhere in between so we rounded up.

Nice hotel, comfortable room and good facilities. 4-5 minute walk to beach, but closer to shops. Ocean views from southern side of hotel and also a good view of the sunset. Public transport out front of hotel is another plus.

Stayed here with hubby and 2 kids for a week. Was pleasantly surprised as the lounge room doubled as the kids room with 2 single beds and we had our own room with a queen size bed. I just assumed we would all be in one room thinking it was a standard 'studio' room. Both rooms had an air con which could be adjusted and both rooms had a small flat screen TV. Staff were friendly, room was clean - cleaners were lovely and caring (the few times we bumped into them). Bathroom is small and shower spray on the weak side but clean and does the job. We were on level 9 which can be noisy from the street below but unable to hear your neighbors except for toilet flushes through the night which was really not an issue. 4 lifts, waiting was never a problem as they came down and went up pretty quick. Location was great, close to shops and beach. 10 min walk from Cheesecake Factory and right next door to IHOP and 2 mins away from Maccas. Would stay here again without issue.

We stayed here for a week in January. We did not have a car, but do expect to pay extra for parking privileges.What you need to know:1. While not on the beach, this hotel has a fabulous location. It's about 3 blocks from the beach and in easy walking distance to a myriad of restaurants and shopping.2. Attractive, comfortable, safe, clean, and budget friendly. And you will feel safe walking around the neighborhood day or night.3. Buses stop across the street and the front desk staff can tell you which one to take to places like Diamond Head and Pearl Harbor. You can buy 4-day bus passes and go all over the island.4. Best hotel coffee (in-room coffee maker); and, a mini-fridge is also provided.5. Internet signal is good; you pay for it via the resort fee, but this fee also includes unlimited rides on the Pink Line trolley.6. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful.7. Bring your refillable water bottle as they have a great water dispenser in the pool area (beside the elevators).8. In room safes are available.
user_name:
ReiversGo
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Rooms were pretty good which is the only thing saving this from turnin' into a 3 star review because that parking exit/entrance ramp is narrow. And, yes, ramp, singular - if you're leaving the first level, keep an eye out on your left for cars from the second level leaving on the same ramp. if you book this hotel buy insurance for your rental.

I did not choose this hotel as it was all arranged by my travel agent .who was trying to keep my costs down. The agent did a great job & the hotel was fantastic with very helpful staff. Apart from not having a jug for my cup of tea in the morning I have no other complaints.( the coffee machine does not make very nice tea) I thoroughly enjoyed my experience there & will stay there again. ( hopefully in a few months time) lets face it guys, I didn't go to Honolulu to have a holiday in my hotel room as it was a place to come back to after visiting the wonders of Honolulu. The spar at the hotel was the best I have ever experienced especially after walking around all day. Keep up the good work guys & I will be back soon.

We spent three nights here (including Christmas eve), and I'm so glad that we did! The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, the rooms very comfortable, and the location was central to most everything and anything that we wanted to see/visit. I have two children, and they felt very comfortable and welcomed - I think they visited the pool and jacuzzi about 5 times during our stay! Everything was within walking distance, and we really enjoyed riding the trolley around Waikiki and Ala Moana - the trolley passes were included in the hotel package - bonus! Parking wasn't a problem - even the parking attendants were nice and helpful! I would definitely return to this property again!

Pros:1. Good value for money than other hotels in the area2. Good location3. Clean roomsCons:1. Service staff is bad. They come across as rude as they have a lot of customers to serve.2. Parking rates are horrible3. Dated furniture

We stayed 2 nights on the 18th floor with a nice view of the city. One could board a free hop on hop off shuttle across the street. Staff was friendly and helpful and the room was clean. IHOP was right next door & the hotel had a discount coupon for there.

Same as always! Excellent Staff! Very helpful! Very polite! there was a misunderstanding with the number of days that we were supposed to stay there, but, they took care of it in a very professional way. The rooms were very clean (I had booked two rooms). Our friend was very happy with his room, too. Central location and good Senior prices. We will stay here again. I recommend this hotel to all. Our rooms were in the "Tower", on the 17th floor.

The rooms look pretty old but clean. Free Wi-fi. Close to lot of restaurants, food markets, the beach shopping centers.Be careful if you want some kitchenette, you must chose between a micro wave or cookers, you can't have both.Pretty noisy as the area is living 24/7.Team is really efficient and kind.

Was very happy with this hotel, staff was very nice, nice rooms, location was great, free shuttle buses to help get around, could walk to many places, dining, shopping, Waikiki Beach. Ihop was right inside the hotel, how convenient was that. Better to stay on the higher floors, very busy streets.

The price for the place was unbeatable. We stayed there for 3 nights. The only problem we had during our stay was that the fire alarms kept on going off in the middle of the night. They should check that out.The front desk staff was nice on check in and out. Housekeeping was excellent, cleaned our room every day too.

Rooms: We were in a 1 bedroom apartment on the third floor. Our room was clean but quite outdated with old decor. Single beds in the lounge were very uncomfortable although the queen in the bedroom was fine. We were on the 3rd floor so there was a lot of street noise - sirens, conversations etc but had a nice sunny aspect. Kitchenette was reasonable with a microwave and toaster. The shower/bath water did not drain until the water stopped which I had read about in an earlier review. Sufficient for a short stay.Facilities: Good well-equipped gym with water and towels. The pool is small and out of the sun as it's in the middle of the buildings but it is clean and refreshing. The spa pool was lovely. Coin-operated washing machines and dryers. Parking was difficult in a larger vehicle but they have reserved parking for SUVs etc so talk nicely to the attendants. Costs $30 per day (not included in resort fee). Wi-fi is covered by the resort fee. IHOP and Rivals bar are on the premises - both are great. Free Pink Line bus with room card.Staff: All of the lobby staff were great - very friendly and helpful. We used the Expedia tour desk as well and they were awesome. The housekeeper of our room was not so friendly though.Overall, a good hotel for the location (next door to DFS Galleria, about a 8-10 minute walk to the beach). 1 bedroom apartments definitely need an upgrade though. Would I stay again? Probably not but I'd recommend it to friends who are looking for 3 star, 1 bedroom accommodation.

Rooms: Clean and in good working order. The beds are extremely comfortable. The sound proofing between rooms is not that good. I could hear my neighbors. Parking: Don't park above the 2nd floor of the parking garage. The ramp from the 3rd floor to the 2nd floor is uneven and cars get stuck because the wheels won't clear the uneven pavement. I scrapped the bottom of my vehicle during my stay several times. and got stuck twice. The parking attendants are aware of this issue and they just tell me to go the wrong way as I go down. I just feel that they hotel should take care of this issue. cars are getting damaged daily.Service: Great service from every employ. I stayed there for 45 days and the staff is amazing.

IT was a clean hotel with good service for a last minute buy. I recommend for a short stay. They included breakfast with our hotel stay. The staff was always friendly and it is close to the beach, restaurants and store on waikiki. I would use again when i got back .

Stayed here for a few days from 19 to 23 Dec, 2016 in rooms #1507 & 1729 for our year end USA vacation with my family. Hotel is great and located in Waikiki short walking distance to the shopping malls, restaurants, pink trolley pick-up point and of course the Waikiki Beach. Hotel staff was great, polite and very helpful.The rooms were big, clean and had nice view of the ocean. Very convenient location to move around with alot of ABC stores for shopping.

Stayed here for the Honolulu Marathon. It was short walk to the Honolulu Zoo where the Marathon finish line and events occurred. Hotel is located in Waikiki walking distance to restaurants , shopping, little eating places,and to the beach. The hotel staff was great and very helpful.The room was clean and had a nice view of the ocean.The parking garage was very tight, so if you had a large rental car it took some skill to park. Other than that , it's a great place to stay.

Great location with many restaurants, bars and shops nearby. Staff are superb ... friendly and very attentive to your needs. Good size room with a very comfy bed, good bathroom and very quiet at night

We had a room up high that faced the ocean. The room was spacious and clean. Service was friendly. Free wifi was fast. The location was excellent and it was an easy stroll to the shops and restaurants and the beach. This hotel was great value in Honolulu.

OHANA Waikiki Malia is an hotel in a great position downtown: you can walk everywhere anytime; diners, shops, restaurants, bus stops are at a a few steps from the Hotel. The beach is a 10 minutes walking, too. There is also an expert agent ready to suggest short trips to discover the neighborhood. The room was large, well equipped, clean and quiet. The door service was very efficient and professional, though the hotel was really busy. I`ll definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

. The Ohana Waikiki Malia was an excellent place for us to stay while on Oahu. It’s centrally located, the room key allows visitors to use the pink-line transit for free, the rooms are comfortable and clean, and the desk crew is super helpful. There’s no water view, of course, but the price and convenience more than make up for that. We’d stay there again. Our room came with a voucher for breakfast at the iHOP next door. The voucher was for 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, and 2 slices of bacon or links of sausage with tea or coffee. We were happy with that breakfast.

Very friendly welcome & rooms are large & clean with tea/coffee machine & fridge. Bathrooms are small with shower in bath tub. We had dated room facing street on 11th floor but the street noise (traffic & people) were so loud kept us awake some nights. There is a small balcony with no chairs. We got a good deal of A$190/night including resort fee which gives you free transport on the pink line trolley/bus & free local phone calls. There is a heated spa & mini lap pool. Malia is in good location close to restaurants & beach but we won't return because of the noise in local area.

We had a great stay except for the street noise and we were on the 6th floor! We kept checking to make sure we closed the glass door to the lania, cause it sounded like our bed was on the sidewalk most nights. Also kept hearing the flush from adjacent rooms, the walls must be very thin. The room was good and clean, beds comfy, but kitchenette and bathroom could definitely use an upgrade.Front desk staff were awesome!

I chaperoned a senior class trip and we stayed at the Malia in 2012, the staff were the shining stars and the experience stayed with me so when I returned in 2015 with my sons, the Malia was the choice and once again, the staff were so kind. The rest of the details, room/cleanliness/amenities were standard hotel rooms - clean and a good base as this hotel's location is great. I appreciate the staff ready to help with any question I had. We'll be back!

So after 30 days of exploring the USA my last two nights were spent here. I arrived late evening and found the hotel to be as advertised close to everything Waikiki. Literally an easy walk to everything. The room was a good size, compact bathroom (small) but with a bath ahhh lovely after my flights. The hotel has several choices for food, the staff are friendly and helpful. If you like to chill around a pool this isn't for you but if you want something in the heart of everything at reasonable rates it's pretty good.

There was 7 of us in our group, 1 stayed for 7 days and another stayed for 5 days. The remaining 5 stayed for 10 days. The hotel staff were very friendly and very helpful with anything we required or needed to know. The Hotel in it self is a little old but very clean and tidy, we all thought the location was very central to Waikiki and the Pink Trolley stop was just around the corner. We all are thinking of returning in 2017 and we will be staying here again.

This hotel is older, probably really great in the past. It was very clean, nice view from our room, coffee maker, coffee, etc. The hotel staff was very nice and accomodating. The parking garage is very narrow, but was able to get in with medium size SVU.

Flew in from Scotland arrived at 10.30pm ish and the hotel staff who greeted us were very helpful n friendly... They put us on the 18th floor and read reviews was a little hesitant however nothing to worry about as everything was fine.. Noise was to be expected due to location and brilliant location central to everything we wanted. Absolutely brilliant loved the place n staff. Mahalo..

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a week and the service very good and the room was very clean as well as not out-dated. They initially gave us a room with two queen beds but they were happy to switch us to a room with a king size bed at no additional cost. There was no microwave in the room, but there was a mini fridge. There was also a small balcony that looked out into the city but no outdoor furniture. The location is very central in Waikiki. It was great to be able to easily walk to so many places. Overall, this hotel is nothing fancy, but the prices were reasonable and there was nothing negative to report. I would be happy to stay here again.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Ohana Malia. This small older hotel has a boutique quality and very friendly and genuine staff. I would highly recommend the hotel for it central proximity to everything. Walk to beaches or shopping within minutes. On a bus route for easy transportation. My only wish was for an outdoor/ open air pool, then it would be perfect! Complimentary passes on the PINK trolley was a bonus.

We have just returned from a 10 night stay here and were very satisfied with the overall standard of the single room accommodation.This place is well located just back from the main drag with the pink trolley included and located close by. The room we stayed in were clean and big enough for 3 in the one room with a fold away cot. We decided to down grade after initially booking an apartment . The reason being the apartments were old ,small and not as roomy as the single room accommodation, the apartments are located in a different building . We found the staff here to be so courteous and helpful, Troy and Lance in particular went out of their way to help us. My daughter needed to freeze an icebrick for her insulin transport and it wasnt a problem. The housmaids did a meticulous job of cleaning the rooms.Internet worked perfectly in our roo s , no complaints at all. We will definitely return to stay here. Thanks Ohana !

Stayed here for two segments in our travel. It was our initial stop and stop just prior to return flight home. Front desk personnel was very pleasant. Special shout out to Pam, who always had time to help with a bus route or general question. Location is very good. Close to the upscale Galleria type shopping district. Rooms are a little dated, but still clean and comfortable. Complimentary passes on the trolley are a plus. Allowed us to preview the area and make informed decisions on how we'd like to spend our otherwise "unplanned" time. Avoid the Expedia tour desk.
