EXTREMELY pricey for outings you can coordinate on your own. Bell staff was great, keeping our extra luggage when we ventured to other islands for a few days. Would likely stay here again if we venture back to the islands.

Great location. Friendly staff. But this place is more geared towards groups rather than couples. Recommend in the future to request the east side of the building as the west side overlooks a large roof with air conditioning turbines humming loudly NONSTOP. Not a romantic hotel at all. Beds were okay. Things just looked a little "dingy" but not dirty.

GOOD:- Attractive room rates- Conveniently located at busy end of Waikiki- Spacious, clean rooms- Good housekeeping staff- The complimentary beach bag is a nice touch and souvenir NEEDS IMPROVEMENT:- There was a lady at the front desk who needs people skills training - The water redirector for shower was leaking quite badly, so had half bath, half shower- Front desk service needs to be consistent, most of the time we were simply handed beach towels, whilst a couple times had to sign our name on a register for them.- Pool is tiny, but the reason I come to Waikiki is to swim in the seaCOMMENTS:Having previously stayed at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani and Sheraton Waikiki, overall I was pleasantly surprised by Ohana Waikiki Malia. Spacious, clean rooms were reasonably modern, doing their bit to contribute to Waikiki hotels' painfully slow emergence from 1980s style. The biggest annoyance we encountered was at checkin. Our flight arrived very early in the morning and we had queried about an early checkin, which we understood is subject to availability. At 9am, the initial friendly check in gentleman casually said to come back in a couple hours. We returned at about 12.30pm and queried if we could check in, this time with a lady. She said "your room is ready' but you will need to pay an additional charge if you want it now, but if you wait 25 minutes, you can check in. What was the point of making us wait longer when she said the room was ready? It was overly petty to make us wait.Other than that hiccup, the bellmen and other front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating. I would return to stay here again in the future and just avoid a certain front desk agent.TIPS:- We weren't impressed with the adjacent IHOP, waste of money- Theres a mini pizza joint adjacent to the hotel entrance which makes a decent pie

great little hotel located away from the hustle of waikiki beach. room key gives free rides on pink line bus which was great, bus stops close by. room well appointed. small pool but not a major problem. wifi worked well on 15th floor. fantasic staff. great little bar onsite as well as the small pizza stall there. ihop nearby

Amidst the more pricey fancy resorts in Waikiki is this affordable, no-nonsense hotel.If you're like us: mostly looking for just a great place to sleep at, in between day trips, this hotel is perfect.

Very courtesous and overall great service. After a lengthy flight, we arrived at 9am with the expectation that we wouldn't be able to check-in. The clerk saw we looked like zombies and offered to let us check in immediately at no extra charge. This was much appreciated and allowed us to clean up and plan an even more fun day. The location is very good relative to Waikiki and everything was always in walking distance.

Check in was good the person's name was Robert gave us a room on the sixth floor.Room 604 very old but had everything we needed for our convenience for ten nights.Hotel very noisey, thin walls,old, Low water pressure for the sink. Garbage trucks start at 500am. 604 luana wing had no view from the balcony. The sink plugged daily but we told the maid and she took care of it daily. Very pricey for what you get but I think that is Hawaii. The Pink line double decker tourist bus is very useful and convenient and free with the hotel just show your room key. The hotel is conveniently located if you don't mind being away from the beach. Good wifi, Large one bedroom with a kitchenette. Maid service very good. When riding the buses always get a transfer they usually have a two hour window to use it again and continue on up to two transfers. The weather seems always the same 85 during the day and 78 during the evening and morning. Seems like five days is enough for Waikiki if you rented a car. By public transportation 7 days is enough. Times and route on google for the bus are very accurate. We managed to get around the entire island by bus it was really fun and economical. We saw all the sights from the Dole Plantation, North Shore's, Giovanni's shrimp truck, Hanauma bay, Manoa falls, Diamond Head, Leonard's bakery, Pearl Harbour, Chinatown and lots more…Ideal location off the beach!

My travel agent recommended this hotel and it was a mistake. The property is old and run down, in desperate need of renovation and modernisation. Despite being in a convenient location, i would not recommend this hotel.

This was my second time staying at the Ohana waikiki Malia and I will not now stay anywhere else.I stayed there for 9 nights as my base.Right from the moment I checked in the service was first rate, friendly and professional.1. The room on the 18th floor was excellent, clean and tidy and large enough for myself. The view was excellent.2. The housekeeping staff were friendly and efficient. The room was cleaned daily, the beds made and the towels replaced.3. The location was perfect being only a short walk to the main street and the beach. The location meant I was able to walk to everywhere I wanted to go to.4. I will most certainly stay here next year and recommend it to all.5. The inroom wifi connection was great and there were no problems connecting at all.

Rooms where clean, toiletries where place in bathroom everyday. No coffee, out dated décor, stain carpet. If you're looking for a place to rest is very good for the price and the staff are very helpful and nice.

The room amazing view although did get single beds not double the pool and jakuzi bit small but nice just a shame nowhere to change bar the toilets got bar and food outlet next door everybody friendly

My husband and I stayed here 4 nights. We made our reservations late and I was unable to get a room at the Marriott where we've stayed previously. This hotel is a couple blocks from the beach and close to some restaurants, shopping, and also a car rental agency (we only wanted to rent a car for one day and didn't want to deal with getting it back to the airport). Our room was on the 17th floor, comfortable and clean. Housekeeping was great and the staff was friendly. However, even being on the 17th floor, I was awakened 2 times during our stay in the middle of the night by some late night party people yelling on the street nearby. The Expedia desk staff was wonderful. We would definitely stay here again.

My husband and I spend 10 days here during a conference. While the hotel itself is average - they do a great job at working with what they have. A nice and clean (small) pool/spa area is sandwiched between the garage and hotel... nothing you would spend the day at, but a great way to cool off from a hot day. The location is great - we didn't pay the big prices of the "on the beach" hotels, but we were a short and enjoyable 10 minute walk to them. Great restaurants all within walking distance, LGBTQ visitors: there is a great small gay club/bar across the street (Bacchus). Overall great stay.

I have been to waikiki several times and this was our first time in the waikiki malia - we were on a budget and they claimed to be an outrigger hotel. the staff were efficient and helpful. The room was just average. We upgraded to one with a "view" it was ok, just a bit of water views but it had a very tiny lanai (balcony) and there was no furniture and you couldn't sit there to enjoy said view which we paid more for. The bathroom was ok, I wish they would just change these tub/shower combinations to an actual shower. I hate the combo's and also shower curtains are not the best. for some reason the shower curtain was curved up and so most of the time the curtain slid down to gather in the middle very annoying as of course water went everywhere.overall good service and it is in a good location. room could be better

This is the first time my husband and I didn't stay at a resort going away on vacation due to the fact we were originally suppose to go to Germany. We had to find something last minute within the same price range, and because everything is was totally booked, we stayed here. It's average. Nothing fancy at all just a place to shower and sleep. It's very clean, they have a parking deck if you rent a car, IHOP is connected to the building for breakfast, they provide beach towels upon request, and it is very close to everything which is nice. I'm not sure what noise everyone is talking about on here... we stayed in the 12th floor and it was fine. Either that or I'm used to noise since I'm from NYC/NJ. What I HATED was the shower situation. There's no drainage level so the water can back up while you shower which grosses me out. Also, the floor kept getting soaked and I couldn't figure out why until I realized the shower liner is so terrible that it makes the outside curtain soaked causing the bathroom floor have PUDDLES of water which is completely annoying. so tip? Make sure the shower head is pointed towards the wall and it's ONLY hitting you or else you'll have to clean up the mess. Other than that, it wasn't bad... just not my first choice (at all) and I wouldn't stay there again unless I absolutely had to

Although this hotel was decent, the ac was non-existent, the room smelled like mold, and I have never slept in such a uncomfortable bed in my life! The bathtub/shower was ridiculously shaped for the size of a child! I couldn't even take a bath, it was like they took a normal sized bathtub & cut in half. Was not happy about that at all. Also, alot of noise!! Very, very noisy!! Got woke up every single morning 5:00 with dump trucks beeping, etc. We will never stay here again.
user_name:
Shannon M
Grants Pass, Oregon, United States

review_body: Hotel is conveniently located to almost everything. An average of 10minute walk to the Waikiki Beach, food (fine dining and fastfood) and shopping centers (in case you forget to bring bathing suits or flip flops). We were lucky to get an ocean view and it was a good sight to see waking up every morning. And yes, I'll book the hotel again if I'm on an average spend in Honolulu for hotels.By the way, travel booking options are at ground floor. It's a plus when you travel to Oahu without any tour itinerary! Look for Koa.

Booked this hotel as it was mid-range in price and central to transport, shopping, restaurants, trolley line and beach. I read ALL the reviews and although most were favourable I was a little worried about the noise levels that were mentioned. There was no need!I found this hotel to be comfortable and in the right location. Lobby staff were welcoming each time you walked in and I would like to especially mention Troy (doorman) who helped out several times.My room was on the 8th floor in the Malia Tower. I didn't find the noise levels annoying at all. Yes you could hear the traffic but it didn't keep me awake at all. If you are a light sleeper I would suggest asking for a higher floor.All rooms have balconies - not huge but enough to have a look outside and more importantly, get some fresh air!Although this hotel is 2 blocks back from the beach and there are no 'beach views' - they still provide a handy beach towel service and really a 5 min walk is nothing! I always say 'you only sleep there' regarding a hotel - especially if you are overseas and are out sightseeing and exploring every day.The pool is small... if you want to laze beside a pool in the sun this hotel is not for you. I still used it and had a refreshing swim. The spa is large and very hot! Lovely after a day of hiking... or simply shopping!There is the $15.70 daily room fee which they take off your credit card as a 'hold' each day. All my 'pending' charges were released back to me as soon as I checked out. If you are using a travel credit card just keep in mind these fees are taken out daily.IHOP is adjacent to the hotel and Expedia staff there to book tours etc.Of course there are 'negatives' to this hotel (and every other one) but I chose to look at the positives and I guarantee the positives outweigh the negative :)I would recommend this hotel and stay there again if I return!

The hotel is centrally situated on Kuhio Drive, and is only a short 5-10 minute walk from the main Waikiki shopping and beach areas. A Food Pantry supermarket is situated 10 minutes up Kuhio Drive (heading towards the Zoo /Aquarium), which is very convenient if you're on a budget and want to make your own breakfasts / lunches. There are several bars and restaurants on Kuhio Drive which vary in price, most are cheaper than eating on Kalakaua Avenue, so the hotel is very well positioned.I found the standard of the hotel to be acceptable, the room was clean and had enough space for the two of us, our view wasn't the best but then this is always a bit of a gamble in Waikiki with all the highrises, unless you're right on the beach. Amenities include an Expedia desk in the lobby, which is great for organizing trips (though you can sometimes get cheaper prices if you book yourself on the web), a small pool, a sports bar (with reasonably priced beer and a happy hour), a small gymnasium, and our stay included free use of the 'Pink Line' tourist bus to Ala Moana Shopping Centre, which we weren't aware of but was a nice addition. The rooms have microwaves so this was good for us as we made our own breakfast arrangements.Even in October, which is supposed to be off-season, the hotel prices seemed to be more than what I would generally pay for this kind of place. But this is Hawai'i, so everything is a bit more expensive than what you would usually pay, and you are paying for location in particular here - it is very well situated, and Roberts Hawai'i shuttles run straight to the hotel from Honolulu Airport, so transfers are pretty easy to arrange.Overall, I would have no problem staying here again on my next trip to Hawai'i, I found the place to be comparable in both price and standard to the competition and found the staff to be welcoming and approachable when we had queries or needed advice on the local area.

booked this hotel thru my work discounts the hotel was close to everything the staff was very nice and always someone there to assist--however the disabled ramp was out of order so I had no access to the restaurant nor the restrooms it was out of order for the whole week I was there no telling how long it was out of order-which if the desk clerks needed a restroom and could not climb the stairs how would they like to be told so sorry we can unlock the restroom for you but unless you can walk the steps then you are out of luck-to say the least I had to hold it already checked out of the room cannot climb the stairs and the ramp was broken-not a top priority I guess-god forbid the workers ever need it so needless to say I had to hold it for the 45 minute or so ride to the airport going over the bumps and being stuck in trafficthe bed was a little hard for me but my husband-but I like my bed softer the cleaning crew cleaned the room well and nothing disappeared- a couple of years we stayed in a 5 star hotel and the laptop walked off was later located but not good experienceI have very long hair I am 5 5 and my hair is below my bottom so the ladies who cleaned our room always left extra towels and shampoos which were appreciated-With the exception of not having access to the restrooms and ramp broken for however long I would stay here again and the Expedia-x-pert James was awesomewould strongly recommend him

We stayed here because it was part of an iCruise package for Hawaii. This package provided a two-night stay at a hotel. We were assigned this one. Roy Shimabuku was very hospitable. Roy had the vouchers ready for our visit that was attached with the package. Each time I asked about a place to get something to eat, he was more than helpful. He provided us a map and highlighted the route for us. He even followed up with asking us how it was. I was looking for a post office and the lady who was working next to him gave me excellent directions!

We were a family party of 8, and had booked AND PREPAID for four rooms, for 2 nights on our way back to Auckland from Kaua'i. When we arrived, we were told there was only ONE room booked!!! After waiting around in the lobby for a good while, they eventually told us we had rooms - all on different floors! Then, the DAY BEFORE we were due to check out, I found they had charged my credit card for the room (and 'incidentals") When I approached the Manager, he just told me to "ring the bank" and walked away!! I then checked with the rest of my party, and it was the same with them. After over an hour, we were told that it was a mistake, and we would all be reimbursed - however, five days LATER, and AFTER our return to Auckland, the money is STILL not in our bank accounts!!!! What do you think of this mess up? We definitely wouldn't stay there again!

Our room was affordable and comfortable The hotel staff was above and beyond friendly and helpful! I loved that they had fresh flowers for our hair daily :) The location was convenient to the beach, shops and restaurants. Our room was a little outdated but the beds were very comfortable. I would definitely stay again....

Our home for the week in downtown Honolulu. From the time of arrival where we were met with big smiles and "Aloha" from the team on the front desk, to the time we departed. We know that when we return a stay with the Ohana is on the cards. Clean, roomy, comfortable bed and a great sleep. Neat central location and catching the free bus or just walking...very convenient.

My husband and I Just love returning and staying at the Ohana Malia. The staff are lovely and treat us well, we always feel so welcome, so we keep returning. The rooms are a generous size, and having a laundry and gym, plus swimming pool, is an added bonus. The location is very central, with the free shuttle and bus stop straight across the road. The Beach is only a short walk away and there are a variety of bars and eating places, and of course, shopping, close by. We highly recommend you book your holiday and stay at the Ohana Malia, you won't be disappointed.

Very nice location close to waikiki and surroundings with a short walk. Friendly staff & Clean hotel. CHeaper than rest of the hotels but the quality is perfect. If you are willing to save a few bucks go for it. Staff told us about a helicopter ride which we've choosen to do (will do a diferent review about it).

We wanted to save a few bucks so we picked this hotel and glad we did location is perfect in the heart of it all with short walks , They helped us book tours and were nice , Parking is a-little strange go to IHOP parking but once we figured it out , after three trips around the block it was cool, service good , rooms simple but nice and clean , not a resort but a good solid Hotel , but since we were not looking for a resort, perfect and the saving well worth it Yes I would book here again.

These 18 years, I stay at the way back from Big Island for 1 night continuously. It's being remodeled, but facilities' being old isn't avoided, and if it's a stay on 5-6th, the hotel with a little higher hotel charges may be preferred. If it's a short-term, the location is good and the stuff is very friendly and if a cost are considered, thinks as the best hotel.

honest review im on the 8th floor (803) im here for 29 days..this hotel is busy there is alot of turn over. alot..with that being said the rooms look like they have seen alot of traffic. i dont mind that its not updated but the rooms are run down. at 225 a night with the mandatory resort fee and 25 a day to park i cant find the value. i feel like im staying at motel six for 225 a night. the bathrooms are moldy a bit, the tubs are dirty, and when i checked there was someone else pubs and hair all over the bathroom. on a poitive note they are on point with towels and sheets and vaccuming. i bought my own saniwipes and wiped all the surfaces dow. also my suite has a kitchenette and i pulled out dirty silverware so ive avoided it. they do keep the rooms stocked with soap, lotion, and coffee. the pool forget about it its indoor and abnormally long and thin..really who wants an indoor pool in hawaii??? the bar rivals has a good deal for happy hour and the attached ihop is good nd quick even with big crowds. final word only get a compact parking is tight for oversozed vehicles forcing you to park on floors 3/4/5 comming down for there is a super tight drop more than half the cars have scrapped the wall.

The staff is pleasant, but the layout is not convienent. The elevators are broken often, and it is hard to get to parking levels. you have to go to the front desk everytime you want to use the fitness center and the elevators make moving around the building a pain. The parking garage is dangerous!

We landed at 6:30am and went straight to our hotel. We were advised that checkin would be at 4pm. They were extremely friendly and accepted our luggage and showed us to a bathroom to freshen up. They called us only a few hours later to let us know they had a room available.The rooms were very well kept and service at the front desk was always friendly. Look forward to our next visit to Honolulu .

I was initially looking at a few VRBO rentals at the Island Colony but after adding in exorbitant fees, I came across the Ohana Waikiki Malia. I found a great rate using my AAA discount, even with the hotel's resort fee.I arrived around 10 am on a Sunday morning but they were unable to accommodate an early check in. The hotel seemed full but they were able to store our bags so we could explore the area. Check in went smoothly. I usually ask if the king bed I book is available but didn't this time and assumed that is what I would get. When I got to the room, it had a double bed. A call down to the front desk quickly resolved the issue and after exchanging keys, we were settled in our room.We had no issues during our stay. As mentioned in other reviews, due to its location, it can get noisy from traffic but we were on a high floor and it really didn't bother us. Although not on the beach, it is a short walk there. The central location can't be beat and the free pink trolley was useful but be aware it only runs until 10 pm. I would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend coming here as long as you set your expectations correctly such as no beach and a very small pool but instead you will find friendly staff, clean rooms (at least in the new wing) and a very affordable rate.
user_name:
ISPpilot
New York City, New York

review_body: Really enjoyed our recent stay at the hotel. 10th floor corner room was perfect. Quiet, comfortable and everything worked. Location couldn't be better. Couple of blocks from the craziness of the Sheraton/Royal Hawaiian area but close enough to walk Waikiki and watch the crowds. Staff was beyond great. We are locals from Kauai and work in the hospitality business and really appreciate when a hotel gets it right.Thank you Ohana Waikiki Malia for being a great value and a great place.

Not impressed , quite noisy on second floor due to traffic noise, get a room on a higher floor, could have been cleaned better as there was mold on ceiling of bathroom. On a positive the staff was friendly and helpful, easy access to pink line and close walking to beach and shopping. Hotel was in a nice location but walking distance from the beach so if your looking for a water view this is not your place.

I travel to Honolulu 3-4 time a year, and this was the first time I stayed at the Ohana Waikiki Malia. The staff, room cleanliness, location and amenities were top notch. We found our new hotel in Waikiki!

This hotel is fantastic. The main shopping street is round the other side of the block. It is in the middle of waikiki so everything is easily accessible. The waikiki trolley stops right outside the hotel which will take you to the shopping mall. All other trolleys are within the Galleria shopping centre literally around the corner. The local bus also stops outside the hotel which will take you to Honolulu and to othwr parts of the island. The other tourist trips have pickups outside Ross which is about 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel dont have a conceige but has an expedia expert. I would advise not to book with him but do get his advice. The trips i booked with cost me nearly double what someone else on the same trip cost them.The hotel is clean and tidy, a tad dated but for the amazing location i found it perfect. They have laundry facilities too with a number of machines located in the older part of the hotel. They do have coffee facilities in the room. The bed was amazing and the view was great too. They gave me an upgrade to overlook towards the sea. There was road noise from the irish bar down the atreet but you are in the middle of everything. Friday and Saturdays were a little noisy but not hugely excessive.

Booked her for three nights and missed my connecting flight in Phoenix so I called to reduce the stay to two nights. The staff accommodated the request without hesitation although they technically didn't have to do so because of the late notice. Although the hotel is not right on the beach I wouldn't expect it for the cost. The walk is about seven minutes to the public beach. The property is centrally located to lot's a good dining options and shopping. The property seems to cater to Asian tourists as we were one of the few English speakers staying here so the staff is bilingual.The place could use a remodel since the furnishings and decor are dated. In spite of this the place is clean and tidy. The lobby is cozy especially when a tour is loading or unloading. But after all we were in Hawaii, so who wants to hang around the hotel except to sleep anyway?!

Our visit, part of a Costco package, was for two nights. The entrance, with all of the pedestrian traffic, was a little difficult to see and pull up to. Due to overbooking, we received an "upgrade" to a larger, but old style suite which we did not like for several reasons. We complained and the next day, we were given the room we had reserved along with credit for two days parking which was $50 and had not been included in the Costco package. The new room was very nice and what one would expect from a quality hotel. This location is about two blocks from Waikiki beach in downtown Honolulu and is a busy area day and night. We would stay there again.

We stayed at the Ohana Malia for 3 nights in April/May. Prior to arriving I had emailed to request a quiet room and this was accommodated. Our room was at the end of the hall on the 10th floor. The room was nothing fancy but was very clean and comfortable had free wi-fi, and had (quiet) air conditioning and a small refrigerator. The bathroom was very small with the shower over the tub, but water pressure in the shower was fantastic. King bed was comfortable, however the pillows badly need replacing (all very hard and flat). A big plus is the free travel on the pink line trolley that you get by showing your room key to the driver. As with most Honolulu hotels there is a mandatory nightly connection/resort fee. Overall, we had a great stay and would most definitely stay here again as it was clean, comfortable and great value in a great location.

The OHANA Waikiki Malia was a very nice hotel. The room was exceptionally clean and comfortable. The location was great, it was close the Waikiki beach, transportation and resturants. Great hotel for the price.

One bedroom apartment with my two sister in laws Queen in bedroom and two comfy separate beds in lounge. Small balcony out front which we sat on most nights and had a couple of wines. Small pool and spa but the beach is so close and so beautiful. Shopping around the area wonderful as well. Resort fee is a pain but lots of them have that now.

Easy and friendly Check in/ out. Room is a decent size, clean and bed is ok. Balcony is tiny - 2 standing fills it up . Bathroom is ok - but about the size of a large closet. Tub type shower. Amenities ok. Bus line is right in front of the hotel. You will have some street noise, but after all, its Waikiki ! Parking is 'challenging' if you have a full size or truck / van. Located in the middle of Waikiki but easy walking distance to everything. There are two clubs down the street, so if you are on that side of the building, it maybe noisy until 4am if you are a light sleeper. But if you're a clubber - you're good to go ! Other side of the building has nice views of the City / mountains. No view of the beach, fyi.

very good location, near to Waikiki Beach, you can walk from the hotel up to Honolulu Zoo.Very close to International market, you can walk in to any hotel around.I don't need to explain haw friendly the people there because every one knows about Hawaiians. you can figure out yourself.

We stayed three nights- the room was clean and well kept. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was perfect. If it wasn't a short walk- most things were- we made use of the free Pink Line Trolley pass we had (by showing our room key) or used the local bus. (We didn't rent a car while we were in Ohau and got to see basically everything we wanted for about $15 in bus fees.)The beach is less than a 10 minute walk away from the hotel and having the iHOP connected to the hotel was great for a quick breakfast before we headed out. It's right in the middle of the busy nightlife for Waikiki, so there were some folks out late whooping it up that you could hear, but that's to be expected when you're down in the city. Within the hotel itself it wasn't noisy. We would definitely stay there again if we were in Waikiki.

We stayed here overnight on the first leg of our trip.The hotel was easy to find and close to Waikiki Beach. Room was on the small side, but equipped with coffe maker which is always a plus. We would stay again.

I visited Hawaii for two nights last week. We absolutely loved our stay at the Ohana Waikiki Malia. Things we loved the most were 1. The location. The hotel is in the heart of Waikiki, close to Waikiki beach, many restaurants and shops, and there's a city bus stop directly IN FRONT of the hotel, which was so convenient. We took the city bus from the airport directly to the hotel and only paid $2.50 per person. There is also and ABC convenience store on the street corner which sells drinks and essentials at an affordable price. 2. Resort amenities gave us access to the pink line Waikiki trolley which was a great way to get around at no extra cost, beach towels at the front counter was so convenient to pick up on your way to the beach. 3. The IHOP downstairs on the lower level and the Rivals sports bar were both awesome! The IHOP prices were a little expensive but I ordered a kids plate each morning and it was plenty of food for me and saved us money! Rivals has a lunch special $9 for a beer, burger and fries. We loved it. They also had great drink specials and you could pick up your drink and enjoy it at the pool and hot tub (the bar had a pool access door). 4. The hotel offers free luggage storage. After we checked out at Noon our flight didn't leave until 7:10 pm so it was a truly awesome perk that the hotel offers this service so you don't have to haul your luggage around with you all day while you wait to head to the airport. Some other nice details: The hotel staff were friendly and knowledgeable and happy to answer any questions we had. There were fresh flowers to pin in your hair at the counter every single day! Every room has a little balcony (ours was very small but we loved it!). Bottom line for the price we paid for this hotel (a hotels.com "your special price"). It was a fantastic stay and a pleasant surprise that the hotel was so wonderful. Highly recommend.

The hotel is located few hundred meters from Waikiki beach, in the lively downtown, which makes the location perfect. Plenty of good eats around, really enjoyed acai bowl from a shop nearby every morning.The room interior as well as the whole building feels a bit dated, but of the same type as most of Waikiki, so it felt pretty organic, nothing to complain there. Sort of time machine, you know!Amenities included Hawaiian coffee and unusually pleasant (coconut?) soap, which I still remember to this day.The elevator is a bit funny, but it seems many elevators in USA are like this, from my other experiences.The staff were very friendly and unintrusive, also spoke several languages which was very nice from them.One day there was a police investigation going on the same floor due to a burgled room, as far as I managed to know, which was a bit worrying, because the doors were symbolic and there was not much check on who is going in and out.One thing I remembered were balconies which were tiny, but with great view of Honolulu and mountain range, I enjyed sitting there, eating snacks and looking around.On friday night the noise coming from outside was surprisingly loud, considering the fact my room was at a high floor and all the noise was people chatter outside.

This was my kids first time to Oahu! They loved it. We stayed here at the Ohana Waikiki Malia, we were there for 6 nights. The rooms are not to big nor to small, I think they're of perfect size. We had one incident with the mini refrigerator not being cold at all, but maintenance came prepared and automatically just swapped it out! Every thing else was great! Will recommend to others!!!Robert at the front desk was very awesome as he checked me in as I made it easy as well being a former front desk agent myself. It was a very smooth check in process. We were one of 3 families traveling together and at one point we were in need of finding something particular for a child, and Jack (parking attendant) was so helpful in any way possible! Pam at check out was very pleasant as well. I will definitely be back and can't wait to see these familiar faces!

The hotel charges resort fees of $12.50 per day for:InternetPaper cup in room12 x 12 poolResort fees is a result of in room amenities , additional hotel services for pool, fitness center, Internet .We spoke with a few other guests and they felt the same poor service for the additional resort fees. In fact the did not leave a maid gratuity as a result of the resort fees.Check with trip advisor and other hotels for the resort fees cost and the service provided before booking your expensive vacation.

An older three star hotel excellent for budget minded travellers. Has an IHOP restaurant attached. Very small pool. Never used it...kind of tucked away..The rooms were very clean. housekeeping staff did an excellent job. Free Wi Fi. In room coffee replenished every day. Two blks from the beach.

We were concerned about staying here after reading the mixed reviews. Were there a lot of Japanese tourists? I don't know. There were a lot of people that didn't look like me. I learned they were from London, Germany, and Canada. There were also Japanese tourist who were the politest of all we encountered. If you want to see and hear only people who look/sound like you, stay home. Some reviewers complained about the size of pool. TIP: Walk a few blocks to the Pacific Ocean. Swim and/or float to your heart's content. This hotel is just a few blocks to the beach. Our room was on the 11th floor. We had a small deck with a slight view of the beach. We also had a small fridge, coffee maker, flat screen TV, and safe. The bed and linens were devine. Bathroom amenities were really nice. All spaces were very clean. Front desk staff was super friendly and helpful. Loved being able to swing by the front desk and pick up a beach towel. Wi-Fi service was quick and consistent. Would stay here again in a nano second.

The Ohana Malia is a great place, it's very comfortable and a good location with walking distance to Waikiki and eating places.I didn't mind that the room didnt have much of a view since there's alot to do and see around Oahu.A bonus is having unlimited access to the Waikiki Trolley- Pink Line which goes to the shopping areas.The staff are very friendly and helpful.
user_name:
Evan Qelo N
Viti Levu, Fiji

review_body: Enjoyed our stay here. Very comfortable beds. This is not the Sheraton Waikiki or Outrigger Waikiki where we also stayed. If you don't wish to spend all your money on beach front accommodation this is a good alternative. It is only one block away and you can just cross the road and walk down Dukes Lane to get to the beach. There is a McDonalds just down the road. The staff were very helpful. This place will improve as it had just changed from being student accommodation to join the Aqua hotel group I believe. There was no resort fee when we stayed. There was no ice machine however staff assured us that was coming. Wi fi was average, sometimes couldn't get it in the room but could down stairs. It is close to buses and I would stay here again.

Checked into this hotel for just one night. Thank God it was only for one night. The one bedroom unit we were in looks very dated and most importantly " very dirty". However, the hotel staff was very friendly, the location is good. Maybe the hotel has a "renovated" wing that we didn't get to stay in.

The hotel is conveniently located only a block, although a long block, from the main action of Kalakaua avenue shopping & restaurants; approximately 2 blocks from Waikiki beach. If you desire an ocean view, you might get one on the upper floors facing the ocean, but don't count on it being a postcard moment. The staff was very friendly & attentive, so they definitely get a 5 star rating! There's nothing to speak of for a restaurant on site, except for a sports bar; however, there are plenty of options withing walking distance from fast food to fine dining. If you're someone who is looking for a pool to use, the one here is non-existent, more of a therapy sized pool on the bottom floor without any view of the outside to speak of.The room was nice, nothing fancy, but a clean, decent sized room to lay your head after a long day of enjoying Waikiki Beach & Honolulu. The biggest issue with the room was it didn't deter much, if any, noise. You could hear outside noise, as well as people down the hallway, at all hours of the night. If you're a light sleeper, make sure you get a room on an upper floor (we were on the 6th floor, which is the lowest floor for rooms) or think twice before staying here. Finally, for being close to most of the action by Waikiki, the hotel is definitely worth a look on a budget. We've stayed at OHANA East also, a few blocks down from this one, & would definitely recommend that one if available.If you're looking for a decent place to stay on a budget, without anything fancy to write home about, this may be the hotel for you, but don't even consider a 5, or 4, star experience.

This hotel has a great location as 1 block away from the main shopping street. And 2 blocks from the Waikiki beach. Rooms are basic but perfectly fine for us (being a couple). Room size was quite big and we had a twin room. We were able to put our suitcases on the ground and walk around the room comfortably. No breakfast is included in the rates. The main buses to diamond head and ala moana shopping centre also leave from the hotel.

It was a great stay in Hawaii. The Hotel staff is very nice and always making your stay relaxing and comfortable. The hotel is in the center of honolulu and just a minute walk from the sea away! Price and place aswell as the friendly staff make this hotel great for me. I thank all the people there for our great and unforgettable time in Hawaii.

Very disappointing. Rooms and bathrooms were small, peeling paint, very antiquated. After traveling for 14 hours, had to wait for 3 women at front desk to help one man-- talking, joking, kept me waiting to check in. Then 2 of them went on lunch break-- the third answered phone call, infuriating me. Finally 20 min later, with steam coming out of my ears they checked me in.Trying to find parking garage is not easy-- mostly non-marked one way streets (oh, we forgot to tell you u have to drive into another hotel to turn!!) Forget eating in the IHOP in the hotel-- its the biggest rip-off on Oahu-- over $20 per meal (yes, for pancakes only!!)Our room was facing ocean, but alas we couldnt see it because the high rises and parking garage in front of us. I imagine even the highest floors have no view.There are only 3 elevators (the rest are broken) and you have to wait forever if you need the garage elevator (no, there is no dedicated call button for garage elevator-- its a waiting game)We felt like we were in Tokyo-- everyone around us was Japanese (same case for all of Waikiki area, not just hotel)TV reception was horrible-- static on every channel. Perhaps they use same antennae from when hotel was built in 1910?Squeals from tires making turns in parking garage keep you up at night-- parking garage ramps are ridiculously small- parking spaces are crazy small.Driving around this area sucks-- traffic is a nightmare. Truly. Think holland tunnel in rush hour, with accident ahead. You have to have patience of a saint to tolerate it

We are from the outer Island local people who purchased the package airfare, car and hotel. So we chose Ohana Waikiki Malia. It was to be 4 nights/4 people. We were accompanying my elderly parent who needed medical attention. We wanted a kitchenette, 1 bedroom, which we got. However I could not sleep due to the fact that late at night you could smell heavy cigarette, and constant traffic in that section. Hawaiian Air said that it was a prepaid package we could leave but no refund, so we spoke to front desk and she put us on the 17th floor, which would be in the newer renovated Tower, no kitchenette. We took the room. The elevator was card secured. That made us feel safe. We had two queen beds clean and comfortable, a mini fridge, nice bathroom. The only difference was that there was no microwave which we really did not need. We just wanted a one bedroom but that worked. We requested a few things from housekeeping and they were prompt in delivering. We tried the IHop Restaurant which the food and service was good. The room had an awesome view of Waikiki and the ocean and at night the Honolulu city lights. You can walk to Waikiki and public transportation is right across the street. They have a parking structure next to the hotel with levels, pretty tight but the attendants are helpful and locals get half price. The Lobby/Front Desk is like a drive through but there are sections where you can sit, and door men who were helpful. What could have been a horrible 4 days was truly pleasant. Mahalo to Pam and the folks at Ohana Waikiki Malia!

There are some problems getting to the Ohana; the traffic, the distance off the four lane, and the overwhelming amount of one-ways in Waikiki. If it is the first visit to Hononlulu add time to reach the hotel. The hotel is located on a one-way and the elevated parking is on another one-way. Ergo, you have to pull into a slight semi-circle infront of the lobby, drop off the luggage, check in and then circle (a series of right turns once you leave the hotel front, about a six block circle) around the streets of Waikiki to the ramp entrance. The parking facility is cramped but a regular van will fit with a bit of maneuvering. Parking is $25.00 per day and is your best bet. Let's hope they have gotten their elevator crisis cured, because only one elevator stops on the parking lot floors on the way up. The hotel itself is old and basic with the European flare of no flare. A plus to the site is the connecting bar/grill called Rivals. This place had the cheapest beer in town. One door away is an IHop and it serves the usual IHop fare that allows quick in and out. Don't count on using the hot tub, very small, crowded and unattractive. The biggest plus to the Ohana is the easy walk to the beach, bistros and plush shopping.

PROS: Nice location on Kuhio, near the cheap and good Murakame Udon. Local bus stops are around the corner and across the street. Pink Trolley is free, just show your hotel card key. Helpful staff, shout out to Kayo for entertaining my daughter who loves everything about Japan. Hiccup on the wifi during the first 2 days but after it was fixed it was a strong signal in our room. Got a fridge and safe in the room. Beds are very comfortable. We got a little bit of an ocean view, just don't look directly down or you'll see the ugly top of the neighboring buildings. CONS: No microwave! Have to go down to IHop to have our food heated. Additional info: Resort fee charged everyday (I think it was $15 a day) for pool and spa (tiny pool but why use it when you have waikiki beach?), pink trolley (we made use of this at every opportunity), local calls for 15 minutes (tried to use it once but can't get an outside line, so gave up and used my phone), wifi (their signal is good, at least in our room), and business use (we requested for them to print out our boarding passes and they obliged). All in all, this hotel was good for the price we got it, but maybe next time we'll check out airbnb first.

The Ohana Malia was a good choice for our two day stay in Oahu. The location is great. Easy walk to Waikiki Beach and dining. Clean rooms and friendly people. Very helpful They were able to arrange transportation to Pearl Harbor before we even arrived. The attached IHOP was a good option for breakfast. They even give you coupons for some if the other Outrigger properties.

Our room was on the 18th floor, with an ocean view, excellent bed, clean, mini frig, daily paper, new beach towels, new elevators with a security card system, and a balcony to greet the morning sunrise or watch the fireworks on Friday night. However, the very BEST aspect of this hotel is the employees!!!!!!! Shawn T, Roy, Troy, Peter, Victor were all outstanding every day/night in every aspect. They treat every guest with respect and kindness that is sincere versus patronizing. They welcome guests regardless of the arrival time, and are constantly unloading heavy suitcases from delivery trucks for guests that bring every item they own. These men deal with young, naïve travelers and patiently answer their questions night after night. Malia employees deserve a raise!!

It's was our 5th time on Waikiki but first time we so disappointed. Hotel was very dirty. Dust on the wall, on AC unit , everywhere. Mold in bathroom, with terrible smell, ants on balcony. Elevator not working. Bed bugs , all my legs and arms was bites.

Coming from Canada with a weak currency, we were looking for an economic stay in Waikiki. I looked at travel websites for months and finally found a decent deal through their website on Cyber Monday. The hotel is centrally located on Kuhio Avenue (landmark is the IHOP) and close to everything. Despite my dislike for resort fees, I was a bit softened to discover that presenting the Ohana Key Card allowed me free transport to and from Ala Moana Mall on the Pink Line Trolley. So long as two people use that trolley twice a day, even for a few stops, it can pay for itself.Check in staff were friendly and we received our free Ohana Beach Bag. Although the hotel is a bit older, it is kept very clean. There are a couple things that can be improved on...1) bathroom door - a sliding door would make more sense as there is really not enough room to swing in the door when opening. 2) fridge can be cooler as the cooling function only seems to work for quick cool and the temperature of the fridge seems mild again after a few hours.I also liked the fact that an Expedia counter was on site allowing us the convenience of booking excursions.

It's a nice hotel at Waikiki beach. Stayed there for 3 days from 9th January till 12th January. Got an ocean view , though little far but it was nice. Room we got was equipped with a little fridge and basic amenities but if we had microwave also then it would have been much better to heat up some food. Hotel staff were nice and very friendly.

I really liked this hotel. It was close to everything and you could use your room key to ride the trolley around places close to Waikikki Beach. The front desk people were very helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Stayed here during thanksgiving weekend and when checking in our room wasn't ready so was offered one of the family rooms in the old wing of the building, it may have been a little dated but I was impressed with the layout of the room. It has 2 singles in a L shape with tv as you enter and a queen size and balcony at the other end, this is separated by a kitchenette and bathroom in between. If you don't mind the fixtures and fittings to be a little dated but want a good practical room this is a good pick.

I recently stayed in this hotel after a cruise around the Hawaiian Islands. My friend, who was celebrating her 80th birthday, and I arrived at the hotel at around 10am and were warmly greeted by Pam at reception. Even though check in was not until later that afternoon, Pam found us a room on the 18th floor - what a view, and we were able to check in straight away. It was good to drop our bags and head off sight seeing. All the staff were polite and helpful, wireless wifi worked perfectly and the room was very clean and comfortable. Would highly recommend this hotel for those wanting comfortable accommodation within walking distance of the beach.
user_name:
Annie H
Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia

review_body: Superb location, great staff, clean rooms, large rooms, convenient and cheap parking, it has at all for the 3 star. Do yourself a favour and book this saving cash for the restaurants and shops of Waikiki. Pretty much true of all the Outrigger properties I've stayed at really. Great for families too!

Upon arrival staff at the front desk were not too friendly which was a bit of a disappointment after just coming off a long haul flight. There was three lifts in the hotel though for most of our stay only one managed to work though when it did it was extremely slow and we were better off taking the stairs to the 10th floor! The air-conditioning in the room was very loud, the lighting seemed quite poor and the bathrooms quite dated. it was very loud as the building across the road was under construction, so had to keep the door closed for the duration of our stay. As being an Australian, there was no kettle in the room for a cup of tea just a coffee maker. Apart from the helpful bell men the staff did not seem to care very much for customer service. The hotel is quite dated and could do with a bit of a re vamp. Though if you are just looking for somewhere cheap and to stay the night I guess this could do. The highlight would have been the hotel being placed on top of an iHop and convenient location.

This hotel is a solid 3 star hotel. It is older - so the room finishes aren't the greatest and the towels and sheets are worn. That being said, it's very clean (which is the most important thing in a hotel to me), and it is centrally located. Waikiki beach is just a rock throw away, so are lots of great restaurants and shopping. We also took advantage of the pink line tickets that are given as part of the resort fee. Overall, if you're on a budget but looking for a good hotel, this could be the one for you!

I just returned from a 3 night stay. Very friendly and helpful front desk staff. Amazing location, very close to shopping, restaurants, public transportation, and only a few blocks from the beach. The room was a nice size. The hotel could definitely use a soft goods renovation though. The shower curtain was especially nasty. You will hear noise from the street and from your neighbors since the walls seem to be quite thin and the doors slam.Overall, I did enjoy my stay.

We took the entire high school marching band and staff to march in the Pearl Harbor Memorial Parade and stayed and Ohana Malia. The rooms were clean and comfortable and only steps away from Waikiki beaches and shopping. A great hotel in one of the most gorgeous places in the world!

We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and couldn't ask for anything more for the price. Perfect location with the trolley tour bus's right outside your door step. A short walk to Waikiki beach and the main centre. The rooms were a decent size, comfy bed and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

The staff was extremely friendly. The location is really good, near ABC stores, restaurants and great shops. And it's not so far to Waikiki. They have a parking next to the hotel. It's quite narrow, but at least you have a place where to leave your car. We stayed here for 3 nights, but we enjoyed our stay. Wifi was only available in the lobby at the time we stayed there, but they were going to change that after we left. The room was big enough for the 4 of us, but more important...it was very clean. We didn't hear any noise from outside. We were on the 8th floor. They have a laundry room, which we used quite a lot. It wasn't too clear how to put the change in the machine, so they helped me with that. They even helped us weigh our luggage. If you stay at this hotel, you can use one of the bus lines that goes around the city. Very easy and great service. I wouldn't mind staying here again. There was a security guard in front of the elevator at night to make sure you're a guest staying there. They checked your name on their list before you went upstairs. Loved the pool and spa.

Good central location to most things, transport, shops and an easy walk to the beach.We stayed 5 nights and if you need sleep check out before the weekend as the Friday/Saturday noise is very loud even though this place is away from the nightclubs,you'll still hear them, plus the noise from the sports bar.Our room was nice with a separate bedroom and living area. Kitchenette was pretty useless except to organise breakfast. Plastic disposable drinking cups and styrofoam cups for coffee was extremely tacky/terrible, no oven or microwave so no cooking.

All the Hotel staff were extremely helpful. Started with me arriving at 1.30pm and being able to checkin early, the room i had booked wasn't ready but I was placed in another room on the 17th floor and this room had 2 views of the ocean ( a bonus). The guy who checked me in was very helpful. The house keeping staff very very efficient with the room being vacuumed, towels changed each day etc.The location was perfect, not too crowded ( Stayed 26 Sept-5th October 2015.)I had no problems sleeping and did not notice the noise from outside, after all it wasn't too sound and it is in the city.The expeadia desk in the Lobby was full of great advice and efficiently booked me on a Circle Island tour.The Bathroom and complete cleanliness was great Top marks to the housekeeping who were responsible for room 1715.Checkout was fast and efficient.I will MOS CERTAINLY stay here again!!!!!

We spent 10 nights at Ohana Malia as a group of three ladies on a girls' trip. The reception staff were amazingly friendly and helpful. They gave us bus and travel information, change for the laundromat, beach/pool towels, weighed our luggage, gave us lots of advice and were continually lovely to deal with. Roy and Robert were our standout helpers. The apartment was simple but fine and cleaned daily. Location was very central. Wouldn't hesitate to return here anytime.

This was a great place to stay, the staff was friendly, the rooms terrific and comfortable. my room was always cleaned in a reasonable time and immaculate. my only complaint is there is no aircon in the foyer or lifts and if there was it clearly wasn't working. the pool is small but was still nice and comfortable. It is central and close to everything I would definitely stay here again.

One night stay didn't hurt much. The room was big w/ a sofa and a range (but not useful for us). I would say that the bathroom was gross because the shower curtains were so old (they could even buy a new one from the dollar store) and the wallpaper so dated. The plus is it's location, other than that, it's just ok. The next morning I was awaken by the noise from the garbage collector and the buses and cars. Will we come back? Maybe not, we will opt to find a better option coz there are so many hotels in that area.

First-timers to Hawaii. Just spent 4 days on Oahu as part of a longer trip, and stayed at the Ohana Waikiki Malia. We booked this hotel as part of a package deal, through our travel agent and United Airlines. Parking $25 a day, plus a $12.50 additional facilities/connection/resort fee which many hotels in Hawaii seem to tack on.Pros -Good location in the heart of Waikiki, three blocks from the beach.Reasonably priced, very clean, with very polite and helpful staff. Secure parking.Cons -Parking garage ramps and spaces are extremely tight unless you are driving a tiny or subcompact car. Trying to park anything bigger is truly frightening (and I was once a professional driver), especially entry and exit, and will have you wishing you had purchased the comprehensive coverage from the rental agency. We did not use the ground-floor pool, which seemed small. One of the three elevators was not in service for the 18-floor wing, the whole 4 days.Rooms and hallways seemed spartan, decor-wise. Room with king bed was not available to us as a couple. That was our fault, as we should have specified a king when booking. I mention it only because the hotel does not seem to cater to couples that much. The separate beds were comfortable though. Most of the rooms have a small balcony, but don't let your children out there.Rooms have views of either the water or the mountains, but mostly of other high-rises and buildings, given the location. Noise from, and view of, rooftop air-conditioning units of neighboring buildings did not bother us, but might bother those who are sensitive to such things.All in all, we were satisfied with the hotel, since we were intent on maximizing our time away from the premises anyway, to see as much as we could of this beautiful island. But I would shop around for a different hotel next time, especially if I had a car to park.

Our room on the 17th floor had good view of the ocean. Also a refrigerator & coffee maker, only downside was polystyrene cups. Beds were good bathroom facilities also good. A major plus for this hotel is they have a hospitality room if you need to freshen up for a late airport transfer. You have to ask for it & it's complementary.

Had a late arrival, checked in around 10:00 pm. Given a room in older side of hotel. Went to the room to find it not suitable for us and returned to the front desk. We were given another room in the Malia tower (18th floor). Room was much better and had a view of the beach. I found the front staff very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is close to main shopping and easily accessible to buses and pink line trolleys. The only negative thing about the stay was that they were replacing one of the elevators and made waiting for the elevator in the heat a little tiresome. I would have no reservations recommending this place to anyone looking to stay there. Price wise there are probably cheaper, but you get what you pay for. This place was clean and is in a good location.

The hotel is very clean and comfortable and didn't cost as much for the facilites. The downside is no free breakfast....However the upside is there's an IHOP connected as well as a bar to the hotel. There's a Hard Rock Café, a PF Chang's, Starbucks and a shopping Galleria all within minutes. If you like the upscale stores, they a just around the corner. In other words, you have everything but the beach within walking distance. Do not stay at the Marriot courtyard, the rooms are very very small for the money. It's too small just for one person (I never seen a room like that). From the Ohana, you can ride one of the bus lines for free which will take you all around the city. A must do is the sunset cruise, The three star package includes all you can eat crab legs. Make sure you go on a Friday........there will be a display of fireworks for free while on the cruise. I hope this help with the decision.

I was there for a extended time , one bedroom , no kitchen , it was a nice room , clean and internet work good. The main thing was it was close to beach it had a shuttle that would take you around Waikiki and the mall. Within walking to anything in and around the beach . Parking was tight ,and you had to pay but worth it. I would stay here again .

We arrived late Sunday afternoon and checked out on Friday at noon. Room was ready and made up and only one other time was it made up. We had to call for towels in the evenings. Pool closed when we arrived and was closed until Wednesday. An elevator was down for servicing Wed Thru Friday and the Hotel was 100%. The resort fee was partially used to use pool and housekeeping service. I asked for a discount but was refused. In the lobby there is a Local Expert tour desk run by Expedia. We booked several tours but was upset that the agent told me that on our Pearl Harbor tour that if I booked the USS Missouri you were not able to go aboard for tour. She became quiet almost argumentative about going aboard. Maybe not a big enough booking fee.Not my idea of customer service.

our room was a one bedroom with kitchenette, very dated. the housekeeping was very hit and miss sometimes forgetting to replace items they had took for cleaning. staff were pleasant but didn't go out of their way to help:(. the lifts were extremely slow. and the lobby was extremely hot. the spa and pool were great:). the ihop was great. and the sports bar. also the pizza bar next door, (awesome food). its in the centre of Waikiki. we were on the 6th floor in the annex and the garbage guys woke me every morning as I'm a light sleeper and the Harley motorbikes too revving up for the day:(.

旅行会社のパッケージツアーでたまたまこのホテルに当たりました。ワイキキ中心部に位置し、トロリーバス乗り場のあるロイヤルハワイアンセンターも徒歩圏内で観光に便利でした。ホテルの斜め向かいにはABCストアがあり、お土産や食べ物を買うのに最適でしたし、ビーチへも歩いて行けました。ツインルームにサブベッドを入れたトリプルルームでしたが、それでもヨーロッパのホテルに比べるとまだまだ広く、各ベッドもキングサイズでさすがはアメリカという気がしました。小さいながらバルコニーもあり、そこから眺める山側の夜景が素敵でした。各種アメニティも揃っていました。ホテルのグランドフロアには小さいながらプールとジャグジーがあり、クヒオ通りの喧騒を眺めながら入るジャグジーは格別でした。レセプションの方々は皆フレンドリーで殆どの人が日本語を話し、館内表示も日本語で書かれていてここは日本かと思いました（笑）。特にパムさんという女性の方が親切でした。リーズナブルでお勧めのホテルです。This hotel is located in central Wikiki and very convenient for sightseeing and shopping, and the beach is within walking distance. We stayed in a triple room (2 king sized beds and a foldable one) but even so, the room was more spacious than the ones in average European hotels. Our room was facing Kuhio Avenue, and we enjyoyed the beautiful night view from the tiny balcony.There were a swimming pool and a jacuzzi on the ground floor, and being in the latter watching the hustle and bastle of Kuhio Avenue was otherworldly. All the receptionists were friendly and helpful, especially a lady called Pam. I definitely recommend this hotel.

It's a great hotel with lots of helpful staff and has a pool. The rooms are a little small and there is one part of the building that isn't renovated and obviously, stands out. The rooms in that side are larger in size, though.

This was our second stay at the Ohana. We got in late around midnight took a shuttle to the hotel, check in was a breeze. Got up early, went to the front desk to get beach towels. played all day in the water. When returned to our room it was nicely made up, air conditioner was a savior. We went and talked to Pam at the front desk, she had remembered us from our previous trip, very friendly and informative. We used the complimentary shuttle to get an idea of what we wanted to do. I would definitely stay at the Ohana again. Clean room (with a mini fridge), great air conditioner, quiet and relaxing.

Booked this hotel online, was very pleased with what we found. Initially our room was in fact too big and in the old side of the hotel. One simple request had us moved to a much more appropriate room for a cheaper price in the renovated tower. The beds were comfortable, the room and all public areas clean and fresh. Water pressure was a bit off but that was hotel wide I think. The pool and spa was a welcome haven from the hustle of shopping and beach. Troy in the front of house area was exceptionally helpful and pleasant, the concierge was informative and the reception staff just lovely. Would definitely go back without a doubt. Thank you for a lovely stopover, three nights was not enough!!

We've been to the Ohana Waikiki Malia hotel 4 times over the past few years and have always been satisfied with everything in the hotel. Has a 24 hour Pancake House right next door, as well as a bar and a pool. Quick walk to the beach, main street and the Food Market. Although it is not the newest hotel around, its still in good condition. The staff are also welcoming and try to help make the guests happy. Would (and have) recommended to friends!

We were happy to get an early check in and have all the benefits of staying at the Ohana explained to us by Pam at the front desk-free beach towels, free shuttle, free mini backpack as a gift on arrival. Our room on the 14th floor had city views with glimpses of water -the canal not Waikiki. The beach was a short walk from the corner down Lewers Street with access through any of the beach front hotels or next to the Army fort. We found the beach very narrow and although the water was crystal clear and very cooling in the humid weather, very rocky and uneven and shallow-you can keep your Crocs ON!We tried the pizza at the hotel from the adjacent Rivals and found it cheap ($6 a huge piece) and delicious. Cold drinks from a vending machine on 5th floor near the gym and guest laundry....$1.25 for drinks or water making it an island bargain.

Just like 1 more recent review, My stay was 6 nites at the hotel. Around 21 May 2015NEG first: iHop not being a real part of hotel. That extra fee. That Pretend reeferGood: Roomy. My room on 12th floor was roomy and comfy. AND Hotel is handy to shopping. Why shopping well where I stay Shopping Sucks.and Too beach bit far. Ya course I should have used my PinkLine (Trolley) pass more.I do recommend this hotel. I got as a package deal... * Downtown = Honolulu by Bishop and King streets. NOT WAIKIKI!

The car park is a nightmare, not designed for American cars. Spaces narrow, unload your bags before you commit to park.The elevators are painfully slow and small.The rooms are spacious, but suffer from dated decor.The cleaning staff do a good, job. Good luck in the tiny showers, I guess men of the Japenese stature don't have the same space requirements as a 6ft Aussie, they are the main clientele. A good location, 1 street back from the action. There is an IHop in the hotel and a small bar with the worlds loudest music.I can't believe this hotel is Number 1 on Trip Advisor! Average at best.

Here on convention room large with refrigerator and great security. Lots to do all around. Had ability on pink line for free to visit other areas in waikiki. Staff friendly helpful. Tooms clean. Everything worked and daily service great recommended to all.

Had a total of 6 nights 2 then were back for a further 4 after a couple of nights at Maui.First time it was so so, mediocre room was average but once we returned we were offered a different room on the 18th floor which was way better and also had a reasonable ocean view.Roy on the reception was very helpful & went that bit further to make our stay one to remember.Very reasonably priced.

Central position in Waikiki, free rides with trolley Pink line. Nice surroundings. The beds are very comfortable. Good cleaning of the room. No wifi in the rooms, only in hotel reception and pool area, though the sofas in the pool are are really comfortable.

Close to everything that is everything in Waikiki! Quick stroll to the shops, eateries and the surf! Simple fittings and fixtures with exceptional service. We flew in the early morning - the staff made all efforts to allow us to check-in early. Our holiday group had two rooms and the hotel arranged for our rooms to be next door to one another which made things easy and managable.

To find a hotel that was brilliant.Couldnt fault it.Lobby was clean and inviting.Staff were friendly and very helpful.Rooms were large and clean.Housekeeping doing amazing job.Didnt use pool.Why would we when we have the sea and beach 10 minute walk away.Used the free trolley pass loads.Hotel in good position.OK you don't get brilliant view from room but hey,for the price .....Just Go There.

I had a great stay from June 1-8. All the staff were very helpful and professional and the room was very clean. This hotel was in a perfect location for what I wanted to see. I would definitely stay there again.

The beds are comfortable, the lobby is nice (you'll spend a lot of time here if you need internet) and its within walking distance to everything. The staff are very lovely as well. The only issues I came up against was some kind of daily "connection fee" to be paid at the end of my stay. I thought my rooms were fully paid for. I hope this connection fee isn't for the lobby internet. I can get better for free at the McDonalds a few doors down. Also I stayed in my room for a day because of jetlag, and put up the do not disturb sign. I then had a piece of paper put under my door saying if I put up the do not disturb sign again they'd come into my room anyway! Apparently for my safety. I'm a grown adult. I can only see this being useful for those with mental handicaps or someone so elderly its possible they dropped dead in their sleep. Just because I want to sleep in on holiday some days doesn't mean I'm in any danger!Anyway, like I said, the beds are comfortable, the television is good, and the view from the balcony is excellent, so I wouldn't give it a low score, but the condescending note did sour my mood a bit. The rooms have a fridge and air conditioning so its nice to return to after a day at the beach.

This is a slightly older property situated in the heart of Waikiki. Close to the beach and Ala Moana Mall, this intimate hotel offers everything the budget traveler needs. Friendly staff, clean rooms with air conditioning and cable TV, comfortable beds and an easy walk to just about everything.

This Hotel was clean the room was nice the front desk staff was very accommodating, we had a minor incident where we needed security to respond and they did so very fast . I would most definitely stay there again ...Oh and also everything you need from dining to shopping ,beach or dancing is less than a block's walk away.

we stayed here from 16/5 - 29/5. When we arrived at 9:00am we were told our room was not ready, which is fair enough, but when I booked the 1 bedroom over their website I put on it that if possible could we have an early check in. Well not only did we not get into our room early, though everyone else did, we didn't get our access key until 3:20pm which is 20 minutes past check in time. No doubt if I had overstayed my check out time they would have charged us accordingly. Also the woman at the front desk who said she would get our room ready, and keep us informed, happened to disappear and not be seen again. The one bedroom was big enough and may I say the housekeeping staff were magnificent, maybe a few of them should be on the front desk. As like everyone else there is no wifi in the rooms and to have to go down to the lobby is a bit ordinary, we are in the 21st century get with the times.

We were here last week and loved the location of this hotel. It's a 3 block walk to the Waikiki beach. There is a enterprise about 2 blocks away. The customer service we received was the best. The parking lot is very small and tight to park your car. The only down side is you're next to the street and it is very loud. You will hear every trolley, bus, and car that goes by. If you're a light sleeper it might be hard to fall and stay asleep.

This Visit to Oahu with friends and Family was both Business and Pleasure. This is why we chose this location and hotel for our trip. I am somewhat familiar with Oahu having spent time there with my wife when she lived there while attending UH@ Manoa. We have had numerous friends and family members stay there while visiting Oahu in the past as well. My Wife is amazing at finding deals online, and it is an art to knowing when to jump on a good price for a flight and/or Hotel, and she did both for this trip!We flew Hawaiian and stayed at the Ohana Malia in Waikiki, also rented 2 cars from enterprise... The review on the hotel is somewhat short. It was clean and pretty quite from our room on the 17th floor. U need a key card to go up to the rooms so it felt somewhat safe in the busiest part of Waikiki. We also had parking and that was a tough structure because it is so small and cramped to pull into, but most parking is very limited right in Waikiki.... $25.00 a day. They had a pretty small pool and Jacuzzi. It seemed pretty clean and I am really picky... They had cool Disco lighting for both the pool/ jacuzzi. WIFI only available in lobby, which is whack! so we rented a wireless router for super cheap, and my wife dialed that in too... She's awesome! The hotel also has a Laundry room. We used it once, and it was chill. Good/Clean laundry...and a Fitness Center. SO if you can find a good deal I would definitely recommend staying here, and I would stay here again...

I stayed at the Ohana Waikiki Malia in September 2014 and would highly recommend it! We were on the 18th floor with an ocean view. The room was always clean and comfortable, staff were wonderful and the location is incredibly central. I have told everyone I know to stay there and will definitely be back!

The location is very good because DFS and trolley stops is very near. When you are going to the waikiki beach,it is convenient. And this hotel have a bathtub.Also,the charge is reasonable. I love this hotel.

This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. I find it very accommodating and very handy to Waikiki shopping. The staff are friendly and helpful, the Rivals bar is a great place to relax and have a few drinks. The only negative I have is that it is a bit tired and needs a bit of a face lift in the rooms. Cleanliness I could not fault.

This is our favorite hotel in Waikiki. Easy access to our room from the parking to the elevator to the room. The people who work here are like "family" and they are all happy friendly folks with a desire to make you comfortable. We started sharing our wonderful experiences at the Ohana with our friends and family and many of them have shared the same sentiments. This is the PLACE!

The staff was excellent. The room was wonderful. The service and thehelpful attitude of the staff was awesome. This place was in the middleof everything and the room key is a pass for the trolleys Close to shopping and lots of restaurants . All within short walking distance.Also nearby bus terminal.

Friendly staff, central location, free internet, no resort fee, and spacious 1 bedroom suites. This place is basic but comfortable & a great value. Excellent alternative to pricier brand name options in Waikiki.

Stayed here for nine nights family of 4. Nice clean accommodation bit dated. Pros: close to beach, pink line included in price which was well used. Cons: didn't mind wifi only in lobby but it wasn't good very often. 3 large school groups staying which made it rowdy and difficult to get on lifts and through lobby. Charging a resort fee Would stay here again though.

This was a very unplanned anniversary trip. We saw a bargain in the newspaper which included a week cruise and after it we requested three days at the Ohana waikiki Malia Hotel , first time there. Our cruse was fantastic . We went to the hotel a nineth floor room was assigned to us. It was clean, big enough and a lot of pillows. It had a barcony from where you can see the horizon. Very beautiful. The employees were very pleasant and explained in good English all of our doubts. The hotel is located in the Waikiki beach area. Walking steps to the beach. In front there us a bus stop where you can take the trolley for free to see the soroundings areas. At the site of the hotel there is an Ihop restaurant where you can have breackfast, dinner etc. During night hours you can walk freely to the Waikiki avenue, whichTurned to be a very happy musicalAvenue very different during day hours.I definitely will return to this hotel very good located and you do not spend a fortune

For being crazy enough to come during what seems like spring break for planet earth:-) I have found a comfortable and centrally located place. Now if you're expecting extreme fanciness, you've come to (or are looking at) the wrong place. But if you want a clean, comfortable, central Waikiki location, I don't think you'll mind being here.I have (since I'm currently still here:-) ) room 825 which is a lower level room but high enough to quiet the city noise that begins rather early with garbage trucks and tour buses. The Pink line trolley, which is included in your room charges, runs throughout the area and up to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. While they do have free wi-fi, it's not in room and can only be accessed down in the lobby (could we fix that please? Thanks)... you have to use the cable provided in the room and, if you travel with a tablet as I do, you'll be using your own hotspot since most tablets don't have a cable port.The location is FANTASTIC... everything that Waikiki has to offer is either within walking distance or not far from the free trolley stops... and it also stops right in front of the hotel. The hotel staff is friendly, right down to the attendant in the garage. The fee, per day, for guests is $25.00. Word of warning: this is a EXTREMELY tight parking garage... large vehicles, such as the Pathfinder I have this time, will have to have help negotiating the corners on the ramps because they are super tight and just a bit more than car width.I will be back... O'hana means "Family" in Hawai'i... so far, so good:-)

Our room on the 16th floor was comfortable, quiet, well maintained and clean with a view across the cityscape towards the beach. The king size bed induced comfortable sleep. Room facilities were basic. The coffee/percolator was welcome. All staff were cheerful and helpful. The reception staff were prompt and attentive, and helpful with information about local attractions. Free wifi was only available in the lobby area which become crowded at peak times. Very good value for the money, and in a good location to Waikiki beach and its attractions.

My wife and I took her father to Hawaii for his 90th birthday. He is a WW2 and Korean War Navy veteran but had never seen Pearl Harbor or the Arizona Memorial. Through Costco Travel, we chose the Ohana Waikiki Malia for its convenient central location and overall value. Our 2 rooms were clean, tidy and well maintained. We stayed in the newer section on the 18th floor and found the stay to be very comfortable and quiet. The only thing missing from our rooms were a microwave, a nearby ice machine (5th and 15th floors only) and WiFi (available in the hotel lobby and adjoining Rivals Sports Bar only).
