Considering there is no room service offered, the food at Rivals was excellent and reasonably priced! Next door, the IHOP was also up to snuff and open 24/7. McDonald's is a short block down the street, an expensive but delicious Italian restaurant is right across the street and 2 quickie grocery stores are a half block away. Even though Waikiki Beach is a few blocks away, we chose not to rent a car because the Pink Line bus stops across the street every few minutes and will take you around Waikiki simply by showing the driver your room keycard. But back to the hotel, we found the staff to be very friendly, professional, helpful and always willing to please. No attitude, only smiles. Even though this hotel seems to cater to tour groups, there were no issues and we would definitely stay there again.

the hotel was in a good location for getting around with the bus and shuttle stops very close. The room was clean and we were able to see the water from our room. Free wi-fi but that was only available in the lobby. Would reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Hotel was very nice! The service was speedy and respectful. They have a pool, hot-tub, and free beach towel rentals. Cleaning service was great every day. We had a GREAT view of Honolulu from our room, and it was just a standard room. The location was also perfect, it is the center of Waikiki, very close to the beach, shops, and restaurants! I would go here again.

Traveled with a group of friends (39 of us.)Pros: Room was comfortable, good water pressure,hot water was easily controlled.Cons: Even number rooms face Kuhio and you get a lot of street noise. Coffee pot was dirty. Did not validate but room has hard wire internet in room (should be wifi). TV quality was very poor on our first visit. On our second visit the TV worked much better. The lobby wifi was very difficult to use even with the assistance of the staff. The desk staff could not tell me what number to dial to reach the desk from my room.

Nice room. No view for standard rate. Parking extra but worth it. Great location for downtown activities. Very friendly staff. Secure. Small lap pool and hot tub. IHOP and club located in bldg. Everything you want is within walking distance. Beach a few blocks.

This hotel was very close to the beach, less than a 10 minute walk, which was fantastic. Our walk was nice as well, we went through many shops. The suite was a little outdated and the carpet was a little smelly, but nothing a little airing out couldn't fix. Maid service did the dishes for the first few days we were there, but then that stopped (we were there for 10 days). It was great to have beach towels available at the front desk and returned at the same. Denny's right off the lobby, my children enjoyed. The kitchenette was great! You'll find Waikiki costly, Walmart isn't too far away to get some groceries and there's an ABC store on every corner. Beware, parking is awful!!! incredibly narrow, we didn't drive, but we were dropped off, and had to drive into the parking lot, it was so small! Everyone was nice, helpful, we enjoyed our trip throughout!

Great location very clean and management and staff top notch. Had 40 senior citizens for pre and post australia and new zealand cruise . One client lost gold wedding ring of 46 years on pre stop over and 23 days later on our post stop over it was found. I would definately recommend. Wonderful staff. They work as a family.

Excellent location, staff on front desk very helpful, nothing too much trouble,room with kitchenette quite spacious,however if you want your bed made each day, strip all the bedding off yourself ! unless you want to sleep in camel humps! beds were only pulled up, not made.Mattress protectors are not anchored to the bed,and the twin beds are very small singles! no Wi-Fi in rooms, Wouldnt stay again, not good value for money.

We stayed here for 2 nights before our Hawaiian cruise on Norweigan. We got an awesome rate through one of the online booking services(sorry, I don't remember which one). But for the price we had a living room with two single beds that doubled as couches, a kitchenette, a nice sized bathroom and a seperate bedroom with a queen bed. Talk about getting your moneys worth! This place is close to EVERYTHING. Ten minutes at most to the beach, shopping and food within a blocks walk. There's even an IHOP right next door. There is a bar in the hotel and the drinks are good and decently priced. The hot tub is large but the adjoining pool is skinny. Still a nice way to cool down though. This was a great base of operations to work from. If your going to see anything outside of a walking distance, I suggest Charley's Taxi. They have a flat rate to everywhere that will save you at least a couple bucks. You have to call them when you need them but they show up within about 10-15 minutes.

Staff is friendly and helpful. You can walk every where, or you can use the pink line trolley. Close to shopping, restaurant and the beach. The rooms didn't have WiFi, but was available at the lobby. The room was clean and confortable. We get a kitchenette, one bedroom with a queen bed and two beds on the livingroom. We have a great time.

Awesome place to stay at. Staff are so helpful and friendly. So close to everything and man did I use that pink line service. Rooms were comfortable and kept cool 24/7. We booked day trips in lobby and the guy i cant remember his name. (Very sory.) was so helpful and a great bloke to chat with . Thanks mate. We had a great experience and are thinking of coming again this August with other family members. And yes we will be staying with you guys again. Thanx again. We will recommend you to all our friends. Thank you and we will see you soon. HIGHLY Recommend. *****

The location is walkable to every tourist trap. That is a positive.I was shocked the rooms did not have WiFi. The elevators were slow, but it could have just been the number of guests. It took over 30 minutes to check in as they had only two employees behind the front desk.I liked the little gym, but it is a whole bizarre process to get access. It is in the parking garage which is a precarious nightmare.Bottom line is that $80 for the night gets you a decent bed and water pressure.

My family of 4 including my husband and sons(13 &16 year olds) stayed for 7nights last week. We had a room with a kitchenette, bedroom and 2 single beds in the living room. It was big enough for the 4 of us and our luggage. Also had a decent sized lanai which overlooked the street below. The room was clean, tidy and adequate for the time we were there. The location was central to shopping, restaurants and an easy walk to the beach. We spent time in the pool area and made use of the adjoining sports bar. Bar staff were friendly and accommodating too. Wi-if was available in the pool area and lobby. All hotel staff were helpful and friendly throughout our stay. Would recommend this hotel to families who want good value accomodation that don't expect a brand new luxury hotel. Best bit- our room was available for early check in at no extra charge which was a god send after a long flight. Worst bit-very loud in our room from street noise (we were on 5th floor).

Last year my parents and I had stayed at the "OHANA WAIKIKI MALIA" in January, March, July and October and had always received nothing but good, courteous and efficient service from all the staff. We will be staying there again this month for a couple of days and hope to see all of the OHANA there, Front Desk So'o, Alvina, Pam, Junko, Les, Robert, Manny, Amante, and the Bell Staff Peter, Troy, Lance, Brian and the rest of the crew. I've worked in the Visitor Industry over 15 years and have dealt with all kinds of people ranging from very pleasant and happy to be here to I'm the guest and I'm always right. To me that saying is not good because I feel you should always treat a person the same way you want to be treated and we all can live as ONE OHANA! That's why I believe that the "OHANA WAIKIKI MALIA" has one of the best staff and crew in it's family. My parents and I always look forward to seeing Troy - Bellmen, he is always so courteous and efficient and apologetic. A couple of times when delivering our bags to the room or pulling the bags from our room he is running a little late and he apologizes and we tell him no problem we understand that it gets busy at times. When you're in Hawaii learn to "LIVE ALOHA" and put a smile on somebody's face like all the employee's do at the "OHANA WAIKIKIMALIA"!

I have stayed at the Malia on five separate occasions and have always been pleased with the service, friendliness and cleanliness of the hotel. The rooms are spacious and well-equipped with a fridge, coffee machine, safe, etc.The staff on the front desk are helpful & welcoming and greet you with a smile as you come & go. The housekeeping staff are friendly and do a great job. The location is fantastic and I always felt safe walking back to the hotel at night on my own.

I have stayed here before, so I was aware of this hotel. I was able to get it at great rate so I decided to stay here again. It has been improved, the room was more home-y. It was the laundry mat that was a disappointment. Other than that, it was worth the price I paid.

My son and I usually stay at the sister property .. Ohana Waikiki West. This hotel is central. . has a very small pool and jacuzzi -- but these are not really things you need in Waikiki . It's just a few minutes walk through to the beach. Pam on the front desk is great and very helpful

The hotel rooms are renovated, pretty small. They added a surcharge for use of internet and trolley in Waikiki. But, the Wi-Fi is not available in the rooms, only in the lobby and by the pool. The lobby is tiny, the pool area has better sitting. I don't use the pool. It is inside the building, you may say it is in the lobby. Overall, OK to stay there.
user_name:
stanbrat55
New York City, New York

review_body: Absolutely loved this hotel. Our room was perfect, 17th floor with an awesome view. Front desk staff were always courteous, parking garage attendants were friendly and helpful. Location was within walking distance of everything we were interested in within Waikiki. Easy to drive to and from. It was perfect, really made our trip the fantastic trip we were hoping for.

My wife was verbally abused by a staff member of the Ohana Waikiki Malia named Troy. Troy also physically assaulted me when I stood up for my wife whe he screamed at her and I stepped in. I asked staff members for the general manager of the Ohana Waikiki Malia, Nora Weatherwax. One moment I was told Nora was on the phone and would get to me regarding what can only be explained as an atrocious behaviour from Ohana Waikiki Malia staff against paying guests, a moment later I was told Nora was no longer there. This lead me to believe that the care factor from the general manager of this outrigger managed hotel was zero.Other aussies, guests and even front desk staff were absolutely shocked when Troy a man standing at five foot ten screamed at my wife who is five foot one. Staff members, Manny and Yuoko at the front desk agreed that it was unacceptable behaviour but still failed to provide any help when it was occurring, like it was an everyday occurrence?After completing a security report of the incident and raising the incident with security and the guest service manager, Mr Castro, nothing was resolved. No plan of action, sincere apology for our experience, or steps on what will happen next provided.I tried to call and email Nora Weatherwax, the general manager for the Ohana Waikiki Malia and Outrigger Hotel but have yet to receive a reply and don't think I will. As a business owner of 3 Australian based media companies I cannot imagine providing this level of service to anyone of my customers and believe that there is a bad side to Hawaii that tourist don't get to see as illustrated by our experience at the Ohana Waikiki Malia.If you're looking to visit Hawaii don't stay at the Ohana Waikiki Malia, if this is the training that is provided to staff by Outrigger who manage several hotel chains, I would try my best to ignore all hotels managed, owned or affiliated with Ohana and outrigger. You are better off spending your hard earned dollars with a more reputable hotel chain that really cares about the service quality provided to guests.What was meant to be a priceless experience was ruined by Troy from the Ohana Waikiki Malia, ignored by the general manager Nora Weatherwax and the processed followed by staff that lacked any care appears to be the training provided by the outrigger group who mind you , claim to be the best hotel service quality providers in all of Hawaii.

Very disappointed in the hotel and unpleasantantly surprised after reading the reviews. We had to wait for our room to be ready even though it was nearly 5pm when we checked in. The elevator is not great to get a wheelchair in. Our "kitchenette" consists of a microwave and gross refrigerator. The fan in the bathroom doesn't work so mold is starting to form on the ceiling. Thresholds and doorways are extremely hard to get a wheelchair through. It's also extremely loud. Not just road noise, but we can also hear our neighbors conversations through the walls. Take my advice, don't fall for all of the great reviews like I did & stay elsewhere.

This hotel has THE WORST staff of any hotel I have ever stayed at. I will never recommend this hotel to anyone and I will never stay here ever again. Got locked out of my room after visiting the second room my family was staying in and front desk refused to give me a new key. Mind you, it was 5 in the morning and I was extremely exhausted. Front desk not only deactivated my key but refused to give me another one without a picture id, even though I had confirmed my identity and was the name on the room. Made me call my hotel room and wake everyone up just to open the door and then demanded I be followed by security to my room to check for an ID. Security is also posted right by the elevators and refused to let me and my 2 other minor family members back into the hotel after 8 because they did not have hotel keys even though I had our room key and told him they were minors.

Our stay was very rewarding.Stayed there for two days. THE front desk staff were awesome. I would like to thank PAM,ROY,ROBERT for their assistance on a couple of issues. This is one of the best places we have stayed.The rooms were clean and well kept. The lobby was very busy with people all over.I can understand why this hotel is busy. Great job to the staff.

Our family of 4 stayed for 9 nights....room was fair had minor problems with air conditioner leaking at times. No Wi-Fi in room was a pain and the pull out beds were so so. Location of Hotel was central for getting about and the pink trolley was great value to get around. Very noisy near the pool area when there is a NFL game is on due to the big crowd and bar Would we stay there again........maybe

The only real downfall in this hotel is that there is no wifi in the rooms there is internet in the rooms but only for laptops and not everyone lugs a laptop on holidays and not everyone owns one!! It was a pain having to go down to the lobby to use the wifi there! Overall it was a great place to stay just a few blocks from the beach the staff were friendly and helpful I would definitely stay here again but please put wifi in the rooms!!

This is a great hotel if you want to be right in the 'thick' of Waikiki. Unfortunately being on the 3rd floor, you have a lot of traffic noise and my husband is a terrible sleeper. As we were coming back to the Malia after a few days on the North Shore, we spoke to the lovely staff on the front desk, explaining our small problem- Not a worry, we were changed to a room on the 10th floor and the noise was quietened quite a bit. Lovely staff, always attentive to their customers needs. The only negative I could give was the gentleman on the advice desk- re trips, sightseeing etc. He was not very helpful and we felt that we were just annoying him with our questions but going to the front desk, we were helped straight away. The rooms are very clean and we were staying in the older section and were very pleased with our rooms. The housekeeping ladies were lovely and very friendly. Great hotel, would happily stay here again.

not bad stay. a couple of streets from the beach. not as expensive as ones closer to ocean. easy to walk to attractions. yes, it's a little outdated,but the place served its purpose I would recommend this place.

My family and the stayed overnight in Room 301. The room is in need of renovation desperately. We had to we walk down to the service desk to let them know that the phone in our room didn't work. We are still waiting for someone to come and look at the problem. Still waiting!!! I wouldn't refer this hotel to anyone. P.S. the service desk people and bell desk staff were accommodating as they could be given the condition of the hotel. :( :( :(

Stayed here 3 nights in Sept and we were really happy. Staff were excellent. Had a problem with the toilet not flushing one evening and someone came immediately and fixed it. We had room 203 a one bedroom with kitchenette. Our daughter's had separate beds in the lounge, we had a balcony off our bedroom that looked over the street. Yes it had traffic noise but it didn't bother us. It's Waikiki after all and very busy. The corridor outside our room looked over the pool and jacuzzi which was nice and because we were the first floor up we tended to use the stairs at the end to go down, past the pool and into the lobby because it was quicker than the lift. Wifi only in lobby but it didn't matter. Always managed to get a seat to sit on. Computer available to print boarding cards for flight back. Ihop next door, open 24 hours a day. Took about 15 - 20 mins to walk to beach.
It's near to TROLLY station and also near to bus stop! Room is clear and goo service!!! I've gonna stay again!!

Decent sized room and comfy bed. BUT very small pool (though can use pool at sister hotels); Wifi only available in lobby, so lobby always full. Hotel seems to cater to mainly Japanese travellers. Rooms & facilities could do with an upgrade. Like most US hotels, can't get a cup of tea if you don't want coffee. A couple of blocks from Waikiki beach.

do not stay here if your first time to Waikiki very disappointing. this motel only caters for Japanese or Asians the only wifi is in the lobby area which is full of people trying to use the wifi the place needs a upgrade especially the elevators.
user_location: Albion Park, New South Wales, Australia
user_name:
Tracey P
Albion Park, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: My husband and I stayed here and we love it because its within one block from the beach, brand name stores, dukes bar and restaurants... The staff were really friendly, we had a cruise to catch in the afternoon and they took care of our luggage while we make a quick trip to diamond head. A plus is that they have an ihop in the first level and you can have breakfast before your tours. They provide towels if your going to the beach, the rooms are a good size and everything is clean, if your looking for a hotel that have good price and close to waikiki beach this is great option.

This hotel's name means family (Ohana). And it is just the way they make you feel . Very clean and large rooms. Not expensive. Very well located. In front of the hoyel there is a bus stop were you can take thd bus or trolley for free . You can ho walking to the Wailiki Beach which is right in the corner. We decided to stay two day before and after our seven days cruise throgh the islands. When we came back and waited at the hotel till night there is another view of the Waikiki Avenue during night hours. Very musical very colorful and different from day hours. Just a few steps from the hotel . There is sn Ihop restaurant at the side of the hotel. I will be counting the months to visit again Hawaii and stay in this hotel. Great vacations. .

Had a fantastic two week stay here in August 2014. Stayed in room 605 which was big enough to be comfortable for 2 adults in the bedroom and two teens in the lounge. We were welcomed on arrival, and escorted to our room. Any minor problems (not enough pillows, aircon dripping) were sorted pretty quickly. The front desk staff were genuinely caring and helpful when my son broke his hand, recommending Straub hospital and making sure we got there. The location is great, a short stroll to the beach and shopping area, with a bus stop right outside to most locations on the island.We were there during the hurricanes Iselle and Julio, the hotel staff sent round letters to the rooms to make sure we knew what was happening (easy to not check the news on holiday) and had a board in the lobby with updates.The location could be noisy at night, but don't forget you are staying in the city centre!The one thing I recommend they change is wifi in the rooms, at the moment this is only available in the lobby (wired internet is available in the rooms but you need a laptop)Mahalo for a great holiday

I had recommended this hotel to someone before I had even stayed there. Once I got there I then understood what he had meant about "don't go looking for the pool." The pool is behind the hotel lobby and bar on the 1st floor - no sunning. The recommendation still stands since I'm there in Hawaii for the sun and beaches that are only 2 blocks away.Now, back to the hotel, the staff is warm, friendly and very accommodating. After reporting a broken A/C unit that Maintenance couldn't easily fix, the lobby staff relocated me quickly to another room whose A/C worked like it was meant for a meat locker. Wonderful, as the week's weather was sorely missing the normal trade winds. The room was on the back side of the hotel and on the 15th floor so there was no issue with street noise.As for adjacencies, the Hotel is located on Kuhio Ave. across from the Courtyard at Lewers St. There is an "IHOP" and a bar, "Rivals," both next to the lobby. McDonalds is on the next block and a Jamba Juice on the block after that. An ABC and another convenience store are at the intersection of Lewers St. One block down Lewers are an Irish Pub, a Japanese Sushi restaurant, another Asian restaurant and a sports bar/restaurant/nightclub (Moose McGillycuddy's) with great breakfasts and morning libations and a 2-for-1 breakfast coupon in "the Best of O'ahu" coupon book available everywhere on the streets. Lewers St. two blocks down from Kuhio is the site of the famous "Waikiki Beachwalk."If you're looking for a tip - with this and other Outrigger/Ohana Hotels go to the Outrigger.com website for the best prices and use your AAA card for even more discounts. This King bed room on the 15th floor for me was $99 + tax/night.Using your OHANA card allows you free access aboard the "PINK" line buses to Ala Moana Mall and around Waikiki.

Stayed here a few years back but it was one of the best priced hotels around. The room was big,roomy and clean. The staff were wonderful, polite and very helpful. There are many places to eat, shop and they are all within walking distance. I still recommend this hotel to my friends even after all this time as it was such a positive experience for me.

Stayed one night at Ohana Malia before my husband and I moved into our vacation rental. Chose the hotel for it’s positive reviews and it’s accommodating early check-in policies.Pros• Arrived late morning and sure enough, Amante at front desk immediately assigned and upgraded us to a one bedroom – 802.• Room was clean and smelt fresh. It even had a small kitchenette, small lanai and views of Kuhio Avenue.• Staff were all very welcoming and friendly.• Location is in the heart of Waikiki.• Show your card key and you’ll be able to ride the Waikiki Trolley Pink Line for free. • Rates can be really reasonable, but book early!Cons• Our room looked down on a motorcycle rental. Trying to nap in the afternoon was practically impossible with motorcycles revving up every few minutes.• Walls are very thin. Fingers crossed you have quiet neighbors (we didn’t!)• Parking structure is tight. We had an intermediate category rental and managed. Navigating with SUVs and bigger cars would be problematic.• Decor in room is slighted dated. However, rest of hotel looks revitalized.Tip • If you are checking-in with car and luggage, highly recommend that you head to the parking structure first, then check-in after. From Kalakaua, enter the structure from Lewers Street.Because of the noise issues, we cancelled our return stay to this hotel and upgraded to the Outrigger Reef instead.

We stayed there first weekend before a cruise. After the cruise we stayed at the Hilton Waikiki Village. Rooms Tied, they gave us a room in an old tower in the Hilton. Pools Hilton wins because Ohana Have a tiny one. The beach Ohana wins by far, even they are not in front of the beach they are within 5 mins walking, the entrance is next to the Cheesecake Factory Restaurant, Dukes Bar is there. If you have the GoOahu Card this is the place to stay because the catamaran, snorkel equipment rentals and tours depart from here. The beach at the Hilton Village after you visit some in the island will depress you. The Ohana have an IHOP which is great because you can have a good breakfast before your tours for a good price.

I arrived on August 18th around 215. My room was not ready which was understandable considering the 3 pm check in. They locked away my things for me so I could explore until it was ready. I arrives back around 3 and my room was ready. I stayed in a king standard room on the 18th floor. It was extremely clean and everything was in good condition. I'm a housekeeper so I know what to look for and how much work goes in to cleaning rooms. I did try the spa tub and it was a nice feature of the hotel. I did not go into the pool or try the other available pools. I also did not have a vehicle so I did not use the garage. The balcony was also nice. I also appreciated the hotel recycling. I ate at the IHOP one morning and it was very good and convenient. This hotel is in a very good location and the staff is excellent. They were all very kind and always trying to help. I had an excellent stay.

Spectacular location in the heart of Waikiki, walks from many top stores of a very charming neighborhood. Ten minutes walking to the beach.Reasonable conservation, nice security, you might be asked to show key card of the room by evening to access elevator. Elevators are old ones but are working fine.Internet wireless is free of charge, but works only by the lobby, you cannot reach it from the room.Spacious room, nice for four, good bathroom, everything was pretty clean.Parking costs $25 a day and may be a little bothersome, as curves are very sharp and must be done cautiously, particularly if you have a large car. You could even access your parked car directly from the room if you choose to park in the same floor.Complaint is the noise from the street as acoustic isolation is not goodDefinitely is a good option at low cost to stay in Honolulu.

Stayed for 4 nights (family of 4 with 9 & 13 yr old). Rooms are dated and a little small but good for what we were looking for, as we didn't spend much time at all in our room. Pool was small but kids had a quick swim each day and enjoyed it. Pool towels can be collected from front desk. Great location a couple of blocks from the beach and trolley stop right outside.

It was a good stay but room was on side of parking structure so there was a lot of car alarm beeps and loud noise from cars driving through structure but overall good stay. Had a cut on leg and stained bed linen it was not changed until 2 days later.
it's located very close to waikiki beach and shopping arealin front of the hotel, there is a torolly stop.if you wanna save money, the hotel is old and service is normal but it's affordable.

This hotel is located about 2-3 blocks away from Waikiki. Needing updating but is in a good location. We had a room with 2 double beds but a little cramped for 4 people. Room had small fridge, coffee maker, iron and hairdryer. Very small balcony... barely for 2 people to stand. Onlyhas a lap pool but there was a big hot tub. You do have access to use the pools at the Ohana East or West.

Overall our trip was pleasant. We stayed for 8 nights with 6 family members and 2 adjoining rooms. This was not the Ritz Carlton, by any means, but it was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. There was no wi-fi in the rooms. There was an ethernet cable, but no connection for USB. We had a room on the Ocean side, 10th floor so there was no noise except the banging of doors in the hallway. The bathroom was clean, but small. The shower curtain leaked all over the floor and out the door if more than one person showered (we had 3 adults in our room). It looks like this has happened for some time as the bottom inch of the bathroom door frame was rotted. Some softer toilet paper would be nice. There was a small refrigerator that almost got cold, but no microwave to warm up leftovers from restaurants. The A/C was fabulous and we actually had to turn it down. The guys turned theirs up and loved it. The price was very reasonable and we had an OK stay.

We were staying here on our first two nights on Oahu before we went out to a beach house on the north shore for the duration of our time there. There are some things that I liked about this place a lot. The location is great - easy walk to wherever you want to go. They have a room type called One Bedroom Kitchenette which the set occupancy is 4 people meaning that you will not get charged additional fees for each person over the first two which is really hard to find. And the set up is just fine. There were eight of us so we only had to get two rooms. There is a big bed in a bedroom and out in the "living room" there are two twins. That is a great savings. The people at the desk were also very nice. There is a fun bar downstairs and an Ihop if you need something to eat quickly. There were some things that weren't great. It's not a fancy place and while the rooms were ok, they weren't particularly clean. There were some weird handprint marks all over the wall in our bedroom and you had the sense that really good cleanings didn't happen very often. But it wasn't the worst I've stayed in. The elevators were really bad. Scary even. And the system they have for beach towels was strange. It's great that they have them for you to check out, but you check them out at the front desk (sign a card). We did so and sent our kids off to the beach. When you are by the elevators, there is a box for towel return and so my kids threw them in there because that is what everyone was doing. But I was afraid that we were going to be charged for them because what's the point of the big signout if they don't record when you return them. So, I thought that was confusing and I just now realized I didn't look at my final bill to make sure I wasn't charged for the towels. The parking lot situation is pretty crazy. It is a really tight fit to get in and out of there. Also the little circle in front of the hotel is very busy and sometimes someone parks there so it is impossible to pull in and load people up. I see that some people have complained about the noise. That doesn't bother me. It is to be expected when you are staying in a place like Waikiki. Anyway, this place is in a great location and honestly, I'd stay here again. When we're on vacation in Hawaii, we aren't hanging out in our room. Everyone was very nice and it was affordable.

Other than location, this hotel has really nothing going for it. Wifi only in lobby, wired internet in room is slow, no business center, can only print from lobby computer which costs, elevators slow and force you to lobby. Only one of three elevators goes to parking. Parking garage is tiny and hard to maneuver vehicles. Parking costs $25 a day. Hotel needs to come out of the 90s and renovate.

My wife our son and I stayed here for one night 7/4/14. I gave this place a low rating more on things that are outside the properties control like road noise and what not. But nonetheless it does effect if I'd stay here again (I would not) and so I wanted it to reflect that. Where to start. Noise. We stayed on the 6th floor room 605 and being 6 floors up does not insulate you from the street level noises. You can hear every word of every conversation taking place at 2am. Cars are constance. Maybe a much higher room would get you away from the road noise like in I the high teens but not sure. Room. The room is fine sized for 3 adults. However the bed is very stiff. The bedroom has a queen. In the front room are 2 singles. The front room does insulate you from the street noise so if you must sleep in the front room it does help. However it does not insulate you from the coming and going of the early risers and the door slamming is loud. Cleanliness. The room was decently clean however the bathroom has mild growing in it on the tile and ceiling. This I suspect is mainly do to the fact that there is no fan in the bathroom. The toilet is small by American standards. I think because the bathroom is small and this hotel seems to cater to Asians who are typically smaller people. For a 250lbs guy it's just too small. Therefor the shower is small, a single person only a 3Foot by 3 foot basin. I'd say this hotel is 90% Asian occupants. Parking. Parking is $25USD per day. You can come and go as much as you want. However the beach is just a 10 min walk if Waikiki beach is your thing. Pay more money stay someplace else and you'll enjoy you stay much more.

Location is definitely the key. The room is not much to brag about- small specially the bathroom. Hotel parking garage is treacherous!!! Be careful. It's not conducive for big cars.Although we line the location not sure if we want to return to the same hotel.

My arrival into Hawaii was greeted with warmth all the way. I had booked my accommodation online at the Malia for nine nights. The front desk staff were so friendly and was allowed to check in as my room was ready. The room had two double beds and was very spacious. Views on the 18 th floor to die for. This Hotel ticked all the boxes for me, safe, clean, affordable, location was a skip to the shops. free trolley pass to the biggest mall and i felt safe there. This has been my Visit #6 to Hawaii and i will return back to stay for my next Hawaii fix of fun in the sun. The Concierge was ever so helpful, Mahalo!!! Janine Macfarlane

My wife and I have stayed at this hotel repeatedly! Last month we were there again and we experienced the same friendly service and a super clean room as always!!! Keep it up Malia!!! Places like yours make us want to come back to Honolulu often! Mahalo!

My parents and I had another enjoyable stay at the "OHANA WAIKIKI MALIA" from March 18 to March 20, 2014. It was nice to see all my friends again at the front desk: Soo, Alvina, Pam, Junko, Robert, Les, Troy, Peter, Lance, Roy and the rest of the crew.We arrived around 12:00pm but the room wasn't ready. Alvina was very pleasant as usual and kept in touch with housekeeping to check when the room would be ready because we were in the lobby waiting. Finally about an hour later she said the room was ready and we could check in. When we got to the room the bedroom had 2 twin beds and also the living room had to twin beds. My parents are not used to sleeping on twin beds so I called Alvina and she said when another room come's available she can room move us. She let us stay in the room to relax and gave us a call when another one was ready. My mom had a doctor's appointment at 2:30p.m. and just before we left Alvina called to say the other room was ready. Before we arrived at the hotel we picked up some groceries for our stay which some of them had to be refrigerated. So, I put them in the frig while we waited but when Alvina called I took them out and just left them on the table so Lance (Bellmen) would know to take them also. When we returned later that afternoon and checked into the room we were very happy. Alvina got everything we wanted as we requested: lower floor, close to elevator, queen bed in room, twins in living room, microwave etc. When I checked if we got everything when Lance room moved our things, I found a note that he had left for us: "I WASN'T TOO SURE HOW LONG YOU ALL WERE GOING TO BE GONE, SO I PUT THE FOOD IN THE FRIDGE. DON'T WANT IT TO SPOIL! (Lance (Bell). I thought that was so thoughtful and nice and really appreciated that gesture. Can't wait for our next stay again at the "OHANA WAIKIKI MALIA" from July 22 - 24, 2014. It was nice also meeting "Amante" at the front desk for the first time. With all our stays at the Malia I've never met the lady in charge of this wonderful crew of this property, Manager "Nora Weatherwax" to tell her they're the best of the best!

We visited Honolulu to attend a destination wedding. The bedroom had two single beds and the living room had two sofabeds so all four of us were comfortably accommodated. Hotel is centrally located and the famous Marukame Udon is within two blocks! Staff was helpful at giving us directions. Free trolley and public transit are easily accessible. Hope hotel could expand complimentry wifi to all rooms in the future. Great value for the location.

There was something weird about this place from the start. I definately would not call it a warm welcome, location is in the back streets. Sure i received a discount for industry rate but very unhappy that 2 days after my departure they charged me again for the room with no notice. Furthermore very hard to follow up.

My husband and I booked at this property after researching online and learning that they offered a VERY GOOD airline staff rate. I have worked in the airline industry since 2009. So to find a property that offered such a grear rate ($99) per night and all the included amenties was GREAT! So we arrived in the late in the evening due some flight delays, around 10pm or 11pm. Check in was smooth and easy, but to be completely honest we were a little irritable and tired, so quick to get to our room and skip the pleasantries. Upon arriving in our room at ANY hotel I do a quick sweep, like a cleanliness inspection. (I don't care how tired I am, I ALWAYS make time for this. I am not going to possibly contract any illness' while on vacation if I can help it!) So first stop, the bathroom, no mold, pee on the seats, no hairs in the drains. The bathroom was very clean. Next carpet and seating areas, clean to the naked eye, no stains or tears. Then last but not least the BED, ok so this where everything starting crumbling down. I pull back all the sheets and inspect them one layer at a time. The first layer was fine, then the second layer I noticed some hair and dirt..eww. But that wasnt the worst of it. I got to the final layer which had a huge seemingly urine stain and small blood smudge. Disgusting! I immediately called to the front desk to inform them of this. The manager on duty came up and inspected everything with us and sincerely apologized. Because it was so late there was no one from housekeeping to come and do a cleaning. So they decided to put us in another room. By this time it was around 1230pm. So you can only imagine my irritability at this point. This is thw last thing you want to deal with after flying for almost 20 hours, delays, etc. So management finds us another room and has one of the employees check the room thoroughly before we came in. (We waited in the initial room until the new room was ready for us) So we get to new room and once again I do my inspection. Everything turns out to be GREAT! So by the time we were finally settled, showered and in the bed it was around 230pm :-( In the morning I went to the front desk to discuss the previous nights issues. The manager ended up coming 3 of our 5 nights and giving us breakfast vouchers. We were very appreciative and also appreciated that the night staff went above and beyond to assure we were satisfied with our accommodations. Now as far as the amenties, the pink trolley is by far the best! We took that thing everywhere! Its such a money saver to be able to hop on and get around the island for free :-) So even though our experience did not start out on a great note, it ended beautifully. We are actually planning another trip later this year and of course we'll be staying at the Malia again!

If you're visiting Honolulu or Waikiki, Ohana Malia is a good choice. Its walking distance to the Waikiki shops and beach, and there's a free shuttle too. Rooms have been renovated and are clean, spacious and comfortable, as well as quiet. Desk staff is helpful and polite. I routinely stay here on business trips and am very happy with it. The pool is more for a dunk than a swim - its extremely small. Parking is available in the hotel, but is not included in the price ($25/night or so).

Good location and very clean and friendly. Many restaurants and shops close by with an IHOP downstairs. Walkable to the beach and free shuttle service around the area. Beds were comfortable and air conditioner worked great.

After a bad experience for one night at Ohana Waikiki West we changed to Malia the first morning. The reception staff was great. They offered a room to view before we swapped hotels. We got a room on 18th floor with partial sea views. We happily paid for the upgrade from Ohana West. The room was very clean - reasonable decor incl fridge and large bathroom! The beds were comfortable and room was tidied every day. Cable Internet and free wifi in the lobby. Small lap pool and spa pool just off lobby. The location was great - only minutes from the beach and right by all the action. No noise from the street! We really enjoyed our 11 night stay! On our last day the staff even made another roo5n available after check out (no charge) to freshen up after a day at the beach and before we left for the airport. Great value for money! Wouldn't hesitate to recommend!

What an amazing experience staying here was! From start to finish the staff were always friendly, helpful and most accommodating! Access to buses, stores, shopping and Waikiki beach ranged from a walk of a few minutes to 5 minutes maximum. The rooms were well air conditioned, cleaned regularly and most appealing. The kitchenette was great for creating snacks and the lounge and bedroom allowed people to spread out. Having access to free internet and wifi was awesome and appreciated as I prepared notes for a conference presentation. Service was immediate and check out time was great, essentially meaning there was no need to rush. It was a truly relaxing stay. Mahalo Ohana Waikiki Mailia! Your facilities and your staff were fabulous!
user_name:
Kimiora2014
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Hospitarity of all the staff.Good location for eating and shopping.Just behind of DFS.larger room with enough facilities.Able to use free-wifi at the loby.free pink trolley ride with just showing room key.Can easy to access ihop on the ground floor.Reasonable price.

We stayed at this hotel once a year for 2 years. We booked 3 rooms, one room was for from Tokyo and the other 2 rooms were for from Sapporo. We arrived separately but the reception desk was friendly enough to arrange our rooms got close and the 2 rooms were adjusting rooms. Some of the receptionist could speak Japanese so everything went smooth. Room facility: A shampoo & conditionerBody soap and facial soapA hair dryerSafety boxCoffee (Lion filtered coffee and coffee maker)Bath/Face/Hand towelsLocation:Just behind DFS shopping centre and walking distance to all Waikiki area and restaurantsWeak point:Only one thing in bathroom. The bathroom was ample enough but the water didn't come out properly from the shower. The water pressure was enough though. Overall:We want to stay at this hotel again as the location was excellent and staff were all friendly.

The hotel is in Waikiki Beach, but not on the ocean front. However, it's very close to the ocean (about a 5 minute walk, if that). Like everywhere in Hawaii, it has some moisture and humidity "issues" but you'll get used to this after a couple of days of being there. The room was clean and the a/c worked very well, so the room was a comfortable 70F even when there was 90+F outside. Because you're on one of the busiest streets in Waikiki beach, the rooms are not very quiet. But you do get the convenience of walking everywhere, without needing a car, and the pink line of the trolley is in the hotel's garage - more proximity and convenience. The most amazing thing about this hotel is the staff! They are the most friendly and helpful people I have ever met! They helped us navigate the streets of Honolulu (most of them one ways), the restaurants and bars, and they were super nice on our last day when we had a very late flight - they carried away our luggage and offered us the hospitality room to freshen up later in the day.Two reasons why I gave it just a 4 star: the noise of the street, and the fact that we booked a king bed room, but they were "sold out" of king bed rooms when we got there (how can you be, when we had reservations 4 months in advance?!). We ended up in a 2 full bed room, so we shared a full bed, which seemed even smaller than a normal full bed. They did offer to change it out later in the week, when something became available, but it was not convenient after we had unpacked. If I found a great price, like we did this time, I would definitely stay there again in the future.
user_name:
a s
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: My family of five stayed for two weeks at this hotel in two rooms.. We were very happy to get early check in after a 10 hour flight. Both rooms were very clean and quite spacious, with comfortable beds, good showers, clean bathrooms, good air conditioning and good block out curtains. The rooms were well maintained over the two week period by nice, polite housekeeping staff. Their job would've become harder the longer we stayed with our increasing shopping! We soon got used to the traffic noise and it didn't interrupt our sleep. I would recommend that you request to stay in the newer tower. The hotel laundry was very handy and the front desk gave us change for the machines. The pool is small but the beach is within easy walking distance. It's nice to sit in the pool area and have a drink and pizza or other food from the bar if you don't feel like going out. Bar staff were friendly and prices reasonable. The hotel position is excellent, just set back from the crowds but still an easy walk to the beach and restaurants. There are plenty of restaurants close by and the waiting time is a lot less than those near the beach. The free trolley is just around the corner and you'll always get a seat as it's the first stop. The staff were always very friendly, greeting us every time we went by and also helpful with any requests. We didn't have an ocean view but we didn't pay ocean view prices, not by a long shot. It's a great value hotel and very clean and handy to everything you could need. We would love the opportunity to stay there again.

We spent 4 nights at this hotel before catching a cruise back to Australia. The staff are excellent, great location and within walking distance to beach, shopping and restaurants. The room we had was really clean and comfortable not the most modern hotel but value for money you wont get better. Will be staying again when we visit Hawaii.

Ohana Wakiki is one of the best pricing of the Outrigger Hotels. It is one block off the beach in the heart of a veey popular Waikiki. My first impression it was not and old hotel but not very modern.The front desk was friendly and efficient and was able to check in quickly.My room - a queen was good size very clean with a desk and coffee machine. I saw the pool not a big deal since you have the beach a block away and if you really want a pool splurge $ for a hotel on the beach. Location is great. It is close to everything ABC markets, Tsunami Bar and next is a iHop and a short walk down the street is McDonalds Starbucks and lots of other food options.I would recommend this hotel if your solo or a couple and family with teenagers and you dont want to spend $$$. It is nothing fancy - and no where do they try to be. Friendly staff - you get all the benefits of being in a cool spot of Waikiki and will enjoy your stay.

Our 4th stay at this hotel since 1988 and the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff has never faltered. Our room was always clean and the hotel is conveniently located around the corner from the waikiki trolley depot and close to bus stops and restaurants and shops. 10 min stroll to beach. Only downside is the noise echoing of early morning revellers on the street going home after a night out which sometimes interrupted a good nights sleep, good excuse for a sleep in. Will definitely be back!

We stayed for 8 nights on the 17th floor. I waited 10 minutes one day only to discover the down button light had gone out and I had to continually press the button for it to come to our floor! The hotel needs to fix it!The room was very clean. Pillows comfortable and bed OK.Two of the nights we stayed my husband and I had no hot water for showers after bathing the kids. The water was only very lukewarm to the point where you could shiver once finishing your shower.The staff were very friendly and welcoming. One man needs to know more about Waikiki and the time it takes to get to Waikele outlets. We were told 1 hour on public transport for $2.50 each. It took more time than this!!! Once we were there we found a guy who charges $5 to take you there from Waikiki. It took 45 minutes by car direct. We were never given any information about these type of services. The only options given were the hotel shuttle bus but we needed a minimum of 12 people or public transport! We could hear conversations from the room next door. Soundproofing must be very minimal.The pool is the smallest I have ever seen and WI-FI is only available around the pool area. The pool was always clean. We were told the sister hotel offers WI-FI in room so one would think the Malia could do it to!Check in was great. Our room was ready when we arrived which was considerably earlier than expected.Overall, this is a clean hotel in a good location, but would I stay again... probably not

Very impressive desk service: They were extremely helpful and friendly.The location was perfect and the room was above par! The only set back was the pool, which was near the lobby, just enough to get wet and splash around. Other than that it was quite, clean and good dollar value.

We had booked this hotel through tripmasters package deal. Took us about an hour to get from airport to this hotel. Blame it on Honolulu' s traffic!! The parking at this hotel is on rear end which is not convenient. The staff were very friendly. There is a iHOP next door open 24 hrs. The rooms are compact and clean. The restaurants and shopping places are close by and so is the beach. We walked around the area easily. Overall a nice stay !!

We stayed at the Ohana Waikiki Malia on our very first night in Hawaii. We arrived later on at night and the reception staff were very helpful and friendly. We were able to check in quickly which was great with children in tow. The room was clean and comfortable and the location is great- Kuhio has lots of restaurants and shops. Although we wre only there for one night the hotel was happy to hold our luggage for us until our flight later on in the afternoon. Having a 12 noon check out time was also very accomodating. We found the street noise a bit intrusive BUT we live normally in a very quiet location and city noise is to be expected The children enjoyed the pool and spa and the area beside this worked well with wi-fi and couches. I would recommend this hotel for those travelling with families.

This review is long overdue:Dates Of Stay: 7/9 - 7/10 2013 (1 Night) 8/20 - 8/23 2013 (3 Nights) 10/29 - 10/30 2013 (1 Night)Next Date Of Stay: 1/28 - 1/29 2014 (1 Night)I've been staying at the "OHANA WAIKIKI MALIA" for over 20 years and have always been welcomed back by the employees of the front desk & bell desk. Love the rooms, love the location but most of all love the OHANA (Family) feeling you get when you stay there. Last year my parents and I have stayed there a total of three times due to my mom's medical problems we have to fly to Oahu from Molokai where we live. A big MAHALO'S (thank you) goes out to Les Laa, Troy Boyce, Peter Nonales, Soo, Alvina, Robert, Roy, Lance, Brian and the rest of the front desk & bellmens. THE TRUE MEANING OF ALOHA AND FAMILY...THE OHANA WAIKIKI MALIA!

I stayed here with a friend for three nights and it was a nice, comfortable stopover on our way to the mainland U.S. for Christmas holidays. The hotel is tucked away next to an IHOP on Kuhio, a couple of blocks over from the main shopping and eating district, but it's a nice, easy stroll to get to Waikiki Beach. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable, good amenities and the staff was friendly. They were even able to check us in 3 hours early, as our flight landed at the crack of dawn! No complaints, and would definitely stay here again.

Spent New Year's Eve at the Ohana Malia. We arrived in Wakiki early and called to see if our room was ready. It was and we were able to check in early. Front desk staff was very friendly! Our room was very clean and perfectly suited our needs. My only dislike would be that the shower was only a hand held type which was just not my favorite. However, the shower was very clean. Hotel location is great. We returned, it felt like, at the same time as every other guest after the fireworks. There was security staff there to direct everyone on the elevators and the lines moved very quickly. All in all, a great stay!! Perfect spot if you want to spend a day or two to experience Waikiki!

Our group stayed at Ohana Malia for 10 days, December 12-22, and we were all impressed by the excellent service provided by the staff at the hotel. From the front office staff, to the housekeeping, to security and parking, I was impressed on a daily basis with the courtesy and professionalism shown to our group. We had rooms booked in both the old and new wings. The older rooms are large, with generously-sized decks with an eastern exposure. The kitchenettes had refrigerators large enough to store a large quantity of cold food, and the utensils and cooking tools were clean and well-supplied. The newer rooms are slightly smaller, but in both cases the beds and pillows were very comfortable and scrupulously clean. The lobby and pool area have wifi, and tend to be places were guests congregate to be connected. The pool is small but clean, and good enough for a quick dip on a hot day. The Pink Trolley is available right outside the front door, and will take you all over Waikiki, from Ala Moana to the Zoo, free of charge. The parking garage can bit a bit tight for larger vehicles, but the staff is there 24 hours to assist. This hotel is great value for a very good location, a 5 minute walk to the beach.R. Allen, Langley BC

This hotel is 2 blocks from Waikiki beach. The rooms are large, clean and quiet. It has a small pool and hot tub on main level, both very clean. Free internet in lobby. There is a ihop restaurant is attached.

We booked this hotel because of the 4 twin beds. Very rare to find this. Loved this feature. The small kitchen was handy and a grocery store near by.This hotel had the feel of a motor lodge, I felt like I was in a 'parking ramp'. The bus line is in front of hotel, good for getting around, but the noise woke me at 6AM every day.Get a room away from the street or up higher (we were on 6 floor)Staff was great! Friendly & helpful.Location is good, transportation good, walk easily to beach etc. Good value, but does not have an 'island' feel. You are in the heart of a big city.

This is a terrific bargain for Waikiki. Close to the beach, stores, and restaurants. Clean comfortable beds. The staff was excellent, from front desk to concierge to luggage handlers and housekeeping. All were competent, friendly, and helpful. They answered every question and our entire stay went flawlessly. They did everything except prevent the liquid sunshine from occurring.

We stayed at this motel as part of a school trip. It was picked for us by the tour company. I'm not sure what the price was, but it was probably worth it. It is a nice enough place to stay. Double beds are a bit cramped for two adults, and it needs a few upgrades. Elevators need work, they are a trip hazard. They do have all kinds of security, so you feel safe.

Just come back from Honolulu,we stayed in Waikiki but it was all skyscrapers. There say Waikiki is only 2 miles long and 1 mile wide but its full shops and hotels. It's a very long way to go just to go shopping, and the beaches are not very good I have been on a lot nicer. The hotel was more like a travel lodge, very clean and the staff was all very nice, the swimming pool was the smallest I have very seen, I think it was about 12 foot long and 4 foot wide so we did not bother, been there done that got the tee-shirt not going back (to far) 28 hours traveling.

Hi although the room was not flash we had 2 rooms separated by a wierd little kitchen corridor and the bathroom. It ade it good for the younger adults to get away from old naggy mother. It is a good location close to shops, walking easily to both ends of waikiki and even possible to walk to The big Moana Shopping Centre though the bus is right outside. Good price Wifi in lobby or cable internet to the room if you have a laptop.

This is a family motel OHANA meaning family, it's very clean newly remodeled. It has a IHOP restaurant in the lobby very convenient for breakfast they have great food! Very good area to be in Waikiki, not far from the beach and just around the corner from the trolley station. The motel also gives you free trolley rides with your room key.

Stayed here for one night as mix up with our accommodation in November. Best sleep ever in king bed and reasonable price for WAIKIKI, but at the wrong end of town, free pink trolley rides around town,rooms are fairly spaciest, but no internet in rooms, no Lani, balcony to small even for chair, friendly staff but no milk for coffee asked staff and said you have to buy it from store. Over all well priced but wouldn't stay there again

The ohana waikiki malia is good value for your money. The rooms are spotless and the staff are great and the hotel is very central.I would not hesitate in staying here next holiday.The higher rooms are quieter.

We stayed here for a couple of nights in May for my son's graduation because we did not want to drive through the nasty traffic each time we have to go to town while in Honolulu. Restaurants, bars, clubs and shopping places are walk-able. Beach is also a block or two away. This hotel is one of the reasonable places to stay in due to rates are competitive for downtown Waikiki area. Certainly not your mainland price for the size and accommodations offered but, good enough to sleep in and shower for your next day adventure. Laundry area was conveniently located right around the staircase where our room was, and is coin operated. Glad that I got to do some washing before we checked out. The room just need more cleaning to get a higher rating. Perhaps new paint job and new carpet/flooring will get rid of the "mildew-y/musty" smell in the room. The house cleaning people really need to do some good cleaning in the bathroom to get rid of mildew stains around the tub. Good "elbow grease" on the floor will definitely help, too! Other than that, this small and a bit smelly place, could potentially get better rating in the future if they strive to clean the place a little bit better.

This is a great hotel! Not on the beach but so close and you don't pay the beachside prices. Also, it is very clean which is highly important to me. The employees were all very helpful and friendly. Right down the street from Starbucks and Jamba Juice and a great breakfast place, Seaside Diner and Grill - they have a great breakfast special (make sure to get the coconut syrup with your pancakes!) I would definitely stay here again on future trips!!

We Had a great time on Oahu. The only thing I regret is staying at this Hotel. The employees were never friendly they never said hello to us when we entered the front lobby. We left one day and came back to find that some of our things were taken. I brought this to the attention of the hotel manager and he said he would look into it. I never heard back from him. If this hotel was the last place on the Island that had a room I would want to go back home!!!! I will never ever stay here again!!!

The employees were informative and helpful. It's located just beside the trolley depot. Guests of the hotel are able to ride the pink line for free by presenting the room key card. This takes you around downtown waikiki. It's only one block away from kalakaua ave. where are all the shops and restaurants. The walk to waikiki beach is also bearable under the hot weather of Hawaii. The down side is the super slow elavator. It doesn't seem stop at the 17th floor where we lived. You have to keep pushing on the going down button for its to come up. Our room smelled like smoke when we arrived. It didn't go away for days although we were provided a machine to clean it up. I figured that they could have done that beforehand. Also, the fire alarm went on three times during our stay. One time we had to walk down from 17th floor carring our baby. There was no apology from the staff whatsoever. Someone just casually looked at us and mentioned, it's just a problem with the fire alarm. I will recommend this hotel if you want a convenient location and save few bucks.

We have stayed @ the Ohana Malia many times and at different times of the year. We always find the same "aloha" spirit in every employee. Superior employees that we look forward to seeing are Shawn, Roy, Paul, So'o and every one of the people working the front desk. Housekeeping employees are the best and always pleasant. The woman working at the parking gate always sends us on our way with kindness, and welcomes us "home" at the end of our day which is sorely needed whether returning from a family funeral or a day on the beach. You will truly feel like you are coming home to "ohana" when staying with our friends at the Ohana Malia.

We had a great trip. Not the cleanest hotel but ok. Close to shops and resturants. Not to far fromt he beach. The staff is friendly and do all the can to help you find what you are looking for.Nice to have extra bed for the kids and not to long of walk to resturants

Our first view of the hotel, from the hotel garage, wasn't much to get excited about, but it got better.We had a room with a queen bed in bedroom and 2 twin daybeds in the living room. Perfect for our 2 kids who don't like to share a bed! There was a nice, small kitchenette.The bathroom was large enough, but their isn't any counter space and just a small shelf to put your toiletries on. The tub/shower was about half a normal size. The only other thing was the location of the toilet paper holder......really????Management...please add a large shelf in the bathroom to make this a more user friendly place to stay.Garage parking is super tight!!! Great location, can walk everywhere easily. There are lots of dining options around, and an IHOP restaurant outside the hotel lobby.

When we arrived, we were pleasantly greeted by the front desk staff and even received some great advice on good eats around town and things to do. The room was clean and comfortable with firm beds--just the way I like them. I did see a small cockroach in the bathroom on the first night, but because we're in a tropical area, you have to expect that you'll come across one or more on your trip here. Decor and finishes are dated, but everything works just fine. The hotel also has security at nights to ensure that only hotel guests are in the guest room floors, to ensure security. Internet in the room is free and available, except that it is only for wired connections. WiFi is only available in the lobby. Overall, I was satisfied with my stay here and would return here in a future visit. Mahalo for a pleasant stay!

We stayed on the 12th floor for 4 nights. The hotel was certainly NOT the cleanest - some mold in the bathroom and hairs left from the previous occupants (gross!!). But, its location to the shops and restaurants was great especially for the price (we booked through expedia). We didn't spend much time in the hotel room so it met our needs. If you're looking to go to Waikiki Beach every day of your trip, I'd recommend finding an hotel closer.

First the good: clean room, reasonably spacious, location is fine as long as you don't mind being a few long blocks from the beach. The main plus is that the price is right. Some big negatives: no Wi-Fi in the rooms, And the front desk that just can't get its act together. I waited over two hours for a room when many people after me were checked in. I was told it would be before 3 PM but had to beg to get a room at 3:15. Turns out there were rooms all along, they just didn't change my assignment. Weak!

we booked thru a travel agent. She didnt really recommend it as it was a few blocks from Waikiki Beach, but I wanted a cheaper priced hotel.in the end, the hotel was actually well located, well priced and had great facilities.certainly good value and would stay there again. the only downside is that it doesnt have a pool and bar area to lounge around in, but hey- there are plenty of other hotels you can do that in

Got my room on Priceline for 6 nights. This was a great location for my budget. The hotel needs a little work and the amenities are nothing special. (Embarrassing excuse for a pool, no special restaurants, terrible parking.) However, when you are 5 minutes from the beach, restaurants and bars, you can't go wrong. We were close to everything we needed and to save an extra $200 per night I'd say it is definitely worth it.

We have been travelling to Hawaii for the past 25years and have stayed at the Malia most of the times. We have always found the staff very welcoming, helpfull, friendly and will go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. A lot of the staff have been there from the first time we stayed with them. Our last trip was a 23day stay and loved every moment of it. It is on the bus route and only a few blocks away from the lovely beach of Waikiki. Our accomodation was a 1 bedroom with a kitchette. A little home away from home. It was clean spacious and the hotel maids were accomodating. We certainly book with them again.

We booked through Virgin Australia's Velocity Rewards. Extremely pleased with the room being in the refurbished section and away from the elevators. Good size room for our requirements. Didn't use the pool (very small) or the carpark which appeared to be most suitable for small cars. The desk staff are all very helpful and welcoming. Housemaids are all friendly,willing to please and appreciative of gratuities. We found the location suited us as we loved to walk and discover the Malls and Markets scattered around the neighborhood. A bonus was being able to access the Red Bus Route at any time by just showing our room key card for the Hotel. Waikiki Beach is but a short stroll away too. The refridgerators are dated and in need of replacement however, When we called down to the desk regarding the fridge not cooling properly a maintenance person was at the door within ten minutes and very quickly had the unit working much better. Would definately stay here again when visiting Hawaii.

We were in Hawaii for 6 days and stayed here the entire time. We loved it! The room was clean and had more than enough space for the 4 adults in our party. Our beds were very comfortable and, though the rooms are a little dated, we had an extremely comfortable stay. When we got there, our Internet connection was not working, so we called the desk and someone was there almost immediately and had the problem fixed in less than 5 minutes. Housekeeping was great and even did our dishes for us each day, which we were not necessarily expecting. We loved the location of the hotel...not right on the beach, but close to pretty much everything! The only things that were a little bit annoying during our stay were the lack of wifi, the slow elevators, and the parking garage. No wifi and slow elevators were only minor inconveniences, but the parking garage is, without a doubt, the worst parking garage I have ever seen. Before our vacation, we read reviews that talked about the awful parking garage and we were prepared for the worst, and then it ended up being even worse that we were expecting. It was such a tight squeeze to fit in any of the spots, back out, turn, pretty much anything you would have to do in a parking garage was difficult and miserable. So, if you're planning on renting a car, be aware that it won't be a pleasant experience. Other than that, I would whole-heartedly recommend this hotel.

We had a one night layover in Honolulu and had previously had a bad experience with the hotels located near the airport which are over-priced and not that nice. We took a chance with a low-ball bid on Priceline for Wiki Central and were not disappointed. This is an older hotel and the furnishing somewhat dated, but the staff is extraordinarily helpful and cheerful and the location perfect for our needs. The maid saw me struggling with the bags as we left our hotel room, and immediately dropped what she was doing to help me with them. Denny's is across the street and the Food Pantry down the street has a food court with good, cheap eats, something hard to find in Hawaii.

Vey clean, king size bed, all updated. Stayed in the remodeled tower part of hotel. Housekeeping very nice. Front desk staff wonderful and very helpful, My camera died before a wedding, and I asked where I could go to buy a new charger, and they brought out a couple of boxes of chargers that people had left over time and had one that fit my camera (had a very unique charge port). Lifesaving! The hotel is on a busy street, stay up as high as you can for less noise. We only found the noise on Fri-Sat nights to be louder than normal (drunks on the sidewalk) but it wasn't unbearable. The bad thing: no microwave. Really could have used this. We did get a fridge, which should be standard in all hotel rooms today anyways. Food is high in Hawaii no matter which way you buy it, but having a microwave would have helped too. We couldn't see paying an extra $20 a night (minimum) for a kitchenette, so it comes down to spending 100 or more for a few kitchen supplies or eating cold food. Room faced the street at corner of building, so we even got a mountain view, which was pretty. Face it, you're in Hawaii, it's beautiful almost everywhere! Three blocks to the beach, seems a little long because it is not 3 direct blocks to the south, you have to know where to go for the public access points. We did not use the pool while we were there, we went to the ocean.

We just returned from this week. Very nice stay but older hotel. clean except for a few strange hairs when we entered the bathroom but after that room always well cleaned. Old building with old features. The Internet in room would not use wifi which makes it hard to use iPad on vacation. Staff were very good and helped in everyway asked. On a whole our family enjoyed our stay.

I was here for business and it was a pleasant 20 minute walk to the Hawaii Convention Centre. Handy ABC store across the road. The sports bar on the ground floor was a bit of a dive and quite loud, but in my room on the 8th floor, the noise didn't bother me. It was great to have a balcony. My room faced the street, not the ocean, but it was still a reasonable outlook. Super housekeeping staff - really friendly and kept the room in a good state. Front desk was a bit random - sometimes fabulous, sometimes a bit unfriendly. Internet access limited to lobby which I always complain about - I think in 2013, free wifi in hotel rooms should be standard. Also no wifi (even at cost) in room, only cable access which doesn't work if you don't have the right adaptor with you. Location - close to beach, shops; hotel organised tours which I didn't use but plenty of guests did and seemed happy.

We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Ohana Waikiki Malia. We arrived at the hotel after 9:00 p.m. and checked in. We had reserved a one bedroom suite with one queen bed and two twins. Upon arriving in the room, we discovered that the bedroom also had two twins instead of one queen. I called the desk requesting that we be moved to what I had requested, but was informed that they were 100% full and that this was the only available room for that night. However, I was assured that if I checked the next morning they should be able to move us to the correct room. The next morning I checked with the desk and was given a new room assignment when the room was clean. The staff had us pack our suitcases and told us they would move them for us. As it turned out, we had returned from the beach when the new room was clean, so we moved ourselves. Throughout all of the this, the desk staff was amazingly friendly, helpful, and always making sure we were happy with the move. The new room was what we had requested and was some nicer than the first one. This hotel was clean, friendly, and very helpful with every need we had. From moving rooms, to recommending a taxi ride to our destination (and then arranging it!), and from giving directions to getting us part of our luggage the last day so we could use their hospitality room to shower and change....all done with a smile and "Aloha!" The service could not have been any better!!! Our room was in the Luana Wing. Our lanai was right on Kuhio Street and on the 7th floor. This wing with the one bedrooms only goes up to the 9th floor. That stated, they are noisy. We didn't notice any room to room noise, but the street noise is loud. I would strongly recommend ear plugs, especially due to the ringing of the trolley bells! I don't quite know why they ring their bells after 11 or 12 at night, but they do and sometimes there was loud cheering after they rang their bell. Rather hard to sleep through at 2 a.m. The room itself was clean, we had good space, the beds were good, our kitchenette was perfect for breakfasts and lunches. We even cut up pineapples and mangoes in it! The small refrigerator worked well, we had a microwave in our room, and the toaster and coffeemaker were a nice touch. We were very happy with our stay after the first night. You aren't on the beach here, but the lower cost was a trade off we were willing to make on this trip. I have read several complaints about the elevators, but we didn't have any trouble at all with ours during our stay. This isn't a five star hotel, but we found it to be a good location, and adequate for what we needed. And, again, the staff is amazing!!

Four of us stayed for 5 nights (2 adjoining rooms) and enjoyed the clean rooms with views overlooking the city area. The staff were more than helpful and we were were given a free pink bus card on arrival which allowed us to travel around the city at our own pace. The bar down in the lobby was reasonable for a few drinks before dinner. Our most sincere thanks to all the staff for making our holiday one to remember. I would recommend this hotel and will stay again if we travel to Honolulu again. Before booking this hotel I read reviews from other people and some people were not very kind about The Ohana Waikiki Malia. I can only add that some people are very hard to please and will never be happy wherever they stay.Gerald Hardman. Yarrawonga. Victoria. Australia. nol_ger@hotmail.com

We stayed there for 5 days.. Half the time the elevators didn't go to our floor (the button didn't work). Not classy!!! The beds weren't that great! Bathroom was very small!! The cooking area doesn't have enough counter space in order to cook anyway or a store to buy anything to actually cook!!! Good location. Small sitting lobby!!!!! Small bar but fun! Smallest pool I've ever seen!! Staff were pretty nice!

We stayed here 4/21~3nts, and had a great experience. It's hard to find a reasonable hotel near the center of Waikiki, but this was a great find!The location is close to DFS, the shopping street (Kalakaua Ave.), famous eateries like Eggs 'n Things, and so much more. Guests can use the pink trolley that goes to Ala Moana Center for free, so that's another plus. The staff are SO helpful. We requested connecting rooms which were completely booked when we checked in, but they were kind enough to search and offered room change since there were openings on the following day. We declined since we were too lazy, but appreciated that fact that they tried to help. The room is okay, maybe a bit on cheap side but you've got all the necessities. The balcony is small, and pool is VERY small so don't expect too much about it. As someone mentioned, the sound proof is not great, you can hear everything going on in the hallway and room next door. We were lucky to not have any issues, since it was off-peak and weren't that many guests staying. However, I noticed during our stay that most of the guests were Japanese, and they are pretty known for their etiquettes so maybe not to worry too much about it? Rental car is a must in Hawaii if you want to travel far, and there is Enterprise Rent-A-Car about 3~5minute walk away on Seaside avenue. Very convenient. Free Wi-Fi is only available in the lobby floor.

I chose this hotel seeing at as once of the few < $150/night options in Waikiki that is not atrociously-rated. My key notes on this hotel:(1) Only a few blocks down Royal Hawaiian Ave through the Sheraton gets you to a really nice stretch of Waikiki Beach, and the location is quite central to everything.(2) Hats off to the genuinely friendly and helpful staff. (3) Some of the worst sound-proofing I have ever witnessed in a hotel; You hear normal conversation from neighboring rooms as if the people are in the room with you. (4) The "city view" just looks out at the unattractive roof of the neighboring buildings(5) The pool and hot tub aren't too appealing as you feel you are in some sort of alleyway, but you are allowed to access the much nicer pools at the other Ohana's!(6) The rooms are clean and comfortable, but spartan. Basic, lino bathroom, etc...(7) No in-hotel breakfast or restaurant/cafe. Your downstairs options are IHOP (Yuck) and the worst pizza ever. At least there's a Starbucks a couple of blocks away, else you'll have to head closer to the beach for decent food. Let's face it, unless you are on your honeymoon, how much time are you going to spend in your hotel room in Waikiki? If you are not looking to spend a lot, this is a reasonable option. My caveat is for light sleepers. I woke up every night just hearing people come into their room next door and talk for a few minutes, at a perfectly reasonable volume. The walls are like paper.

I came to Oahu for work but added a few days of vacation to the trip. Stayed here for the vacation portion and was pleased with the choice. We had a city view room on the 12th floor.
