The room was clean and spacious, the staff were helpful and friendly and the location was very convenient. Many restaurant choices within easy walking distance. The tours we took picked up within a couple blocks of the hotel. The trolley was a nice bonus - we didn't have a car and didn't need one. They even had fresh flowers at the desk to tuck behind my ear every morning. Like other reviewers, we noticed the noise, but that is typical for most hotels in big cities. My company put me up at the Doubletree for the work portion of the trip and I think the Ohona Malia was just as nice but was half the cost and in a better location. We will definitely stay again.

I celebrate my birthday in hawaii with my wife and we booked on this hotel,with the help of my uncle. We enjoyed the beautiful ocean view in our room and we feel so secured coz you can't get inside the elevator without showing ur key card to the hotel security at the lobby. It's just 5 minutes away to waikiki beach! We appreciate the excellent service of the hotel staff. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and relatives. Thank you Ohana Malia!

Would stay here again.Clean and friendly. Room cleaned daily and well. Front desk staff friendly and very helpful. The pool and hot tub were great additions, we used them a lot. Kids loved the Ihop. Conviently located to the Beach, Restaurants, and Grocery store.

While this isn't the most luxurious hotel with direct beach access and all of the bells and whistles, it's a great place to stay on a budget without feeling like you're on a budget! It's just a few blocks off the beach, the staff are friendly (especially the housekeeping staff!), and the rooms were always kept very clean. It's right in the center of it all, with shopping and great restaurants right out your door. I only gave it 4 stars because the rooms can be a bit noisy at times. If you have a rental car, make sure to get a SMALL CAR. The parking there is tight, the ramps are steep, and I definitely didn't envy my husband having to park the car every day. The parking staff is incredibly friendly though and can guide you down the ramps if need be. I stayed there for my second time just a few weeks ago (March 2013) and was just as pleased as I was the first time. I would definitely return.

I spent five nights in this hotel while in Hawaii on business. It was an ideal location with short walk to Waikiki Beach, tons of nearby shopping and restaurants, and great on-site food (Rivals Waikiki). Room was plenty big enough and property was clean. Staff were accomodating and always had a smile from the front desk when returning after a days work. Would definately stay at this property again!

I stayed for 12 days in this hotel during my first time in Hawaii from 20/2. I am very pleased that Amante Castro have organise what I requested. Peter and Efren are very helpful to us. Close to everything, love the pink trolley , heated swimming pool and spa. Kids enjoyed it very much . Free wifi in the lobby I just hope in the future that they will put wifi in the rooms as well . There was no fan in the bathroom I hope in the future this will be added. Its just too foggy when u take a shower. The only thing that we did not enjoyed is the loud noise outside specially on the weekend during at night. Due to being close to the streets its so hard to sleep at night . As we stayed in the luana wing level 5. The good thing staying in level 5 is the laundry I will definetly come back when i go back to hawaii again.Thank u guys for providing to our needs.I will recommend your hotel to my family friends but i will ask them to request to stay in level 8 at least to prevent from noise. Thanks again amante ur amazing

We booked this hotel based on the suggestion of a travel agent and knew nothing about it except it was 3 blocks from the beach. We chose it mainly because of price. Boy, were we ever pleased! The room was plenty big for the 2 of us. We had a beautiful oceanview. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom and amenitied were good. The hotel staff couldn't be nicer. They helped with anything we asked for. There is also a tour desk in the lobby with very helpful staff even if you are asking questions not related to their tours. And there is an IHOP in the building which was very convenient for breakfast. I also used the hot tub and pool (the pool is small). Their is also a bar their which we did not visit. I would definately stay there again if we visit Honolulu.

Great hotel at great location. Rooms are cleaned to perfection. Front desk really helpful! Stayed at city view room at 17 floor. It was pretty noisy with opened window. Overall it was great. It was better than expected .

I wasn't too comfortable in this hotel as the pillows were flat, the sheets were ok, and the bed itself didn't have a nice clean feeling. The staff were great. I didn't try the food in the resort. I liked how it was close enough to the strip, and there was this canal that i could go for a run around in the mornings. It was my first time in hawaii and it was great. The pool was great too although you are not allowed to bring drinks to it and there is a bar right beside it which is kinda weird.

Among many expensive hotels in Honolulu, this hotel offers an excellent service at a nice location - four blocks from Waikiki beach. There is a small pool, complimentary wireless. The rooms could be bigger.
user_name:
Marco L
Belo Horizonte, Minas Gerais, Brazil

review_body: I stayed here in early January 2013 for 6 nights. The room was always clean, the housekeeping staff were great. Although the rooms have not been renovated in a very long time, and are very dated, all was maintained well, and was clean, neat, tidy and in working order.There was an issue when I checked in with my room door key, (a new security card system). The front desk staff and the maintenance staff tried to quickly resolve the issue for me.What I liked best about this hotel, that it was located near but not on top of the main Waikiki strip, it had a bar, pool, spa, pizza outlet and iHOP all in the same block for easy convenience.The only thing that I would have liked, would be access to wifi in my room. Although it was free in the lobby, bar, and iHOP, it would have been useful in my room.I also had requested a high floor, as this hotel is located on busy Kuhio Avenue, which has a lot of street traffic and noise. I will definately be back. Thanks for a great stay.

The front line staff are the tonesetters for any establishment. We were always greeted with friendly smiles and sense of welcome. The staff was always ready to assist with directions and offered transportation ideas. We stayed for 14 days and housekeeping terrific. I would definitely go back to this hotel and would recommend. The only disappointment was the view from our room was bad and the tub was small if you needed one. Aloha

We have been faithfully staying at the Malia for many years, as the kamaaina rate has been very affordable. We were not able to get that rate two times this year, and had to bite the bullet to pay a much higher rate. ON TOP OF THAT, my wife and I paid for the room, but when my daughter joined us, making the guest count now three people, WE HAD TO PAY AN EXTRA $30.00 per night for our daughter. This makes it a very expensive way to wash an extra towel, or change a sheet at the end of the stay, and is hard for us to justify that additional expense. Maybe we will be able to stay at a 5-star hotel with a kamaaina rate for the same price in the future. THINK ABOUT IT!

This was our second trip to Waikiki; both times we stayed at Ohana Waikiki Malia. This year was as enjoyable as the first. The outdoor jacuzzi & small pool were a great way to relax after a long day of sightseeing / shopping. The bulletins posted in the elevator were helpful in alerting us of building upgrades that would occur during our stay & helped us to avoid any unnecessary surprises. The reception desk & security staff were very friendly and helpful. The tour appointment desk receptionists were very knowlegeable about the various tours available.
user_name:
Dan G
Salt Lake City, Utah, USA

review_body: My wife and i stayed for 7 nights and enjoyed every moment. The reception and staff were very helpful in particular Pam and Troy. The location was excellent and very handy to all forms of transport. We are certainly coming back to stay here and are looking forward to this around the same time next year 2013. We found the room on the 10th floor was more than adequate.The hotel is a short walk to the beach at Waikiki and the area abounds in great shopping. A magic trip.We had initially travelled to Oahu to attend our sons wedding on Maui so it was a bonus to spend the extra week in Honolulu. Liked the complimentary room available to tidy up on the day you are booking out, especially if you have a late night flight and want to lunch or do a little more shopping.

I recently stayed at the Malia for a week and I have only praises. I did not have a car but friends had rented and the staff was very helpful and accommodating. The location is most convenient easy to walk or catch the trolley just about anywhere. Also Melanie who works for the tour company was fantastic. She took the time to help with tour selection, bus routes, and always had a smile, I miss her. Also Pam at the front desk was very helpful. Mahalo for a great week with friends and memories.

We stayed at Ohana Wakiki Malia for 4 nights. My first priority is cleanliness and I found the room to be very clean. The location is great - just a five minute walk to Waikiki Beach, the International Marketplace. ABC stores - 2 within one block of the hotel. The front desk was always helpful and friendly. The room was on the small side - but we didnt' spend much time there except to sleep, so that wasn't a problem. Found a great diner for breakfast - Seaside Bar and Grill. It's across the street and down a block. Breakfast was $3.95 for 2 pancakes, 2 eggs and 2 bacon strips. The coconut syrup costs an extra $1.00 - but worth it for the pancakes. As mentioned by other reviewers, the parking is tricky. The parking tower is very tight. Overall, a great trip! Would definitely stay here again on future trips to Oahu.

We stayed here 3 nights. We stayed on the street side which was very loud but we had a suite so we were able to sleep in the suite side on the sofas and get a descent night's sleep. You could not ask for a much better location. It is only a couple of blocks to most anything in Waikiki. The parking is tricky and I would not recommend a large car. Even with a small car you need to be careful.

We stayed at the Ohana Waikiki Malia for 10 nights in August 2012. We were pleasantly surprised that we were given a high floor ocean facing room at check-in. After exploring the hotel, I would not have been happy with a lower floor, or a room on the other side of the building that faced the neighboring hotel. We came into this trip with modest expectations having stayed at the Sheraton Resort on our last trip to Waikiki, but we found this hotel adequate given our luck in getting a good room. If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel and get a good price, this hotel is definitely worth a look. You can tell that the Ohana Malia is an older building that has been upgraded in a piecemeal fashion, and there's no hiding the lipstick on the pig with ice machines on only 2 floors and three different sets of elevators that only go to select floors. Here is a list of the pros and cons of the hotel that we found during our stay:Pros:- Good hotel location only a 5 minute walk to the beach and in the heart of Waikiki shopping and dining.- Good housekeeping and friendly staff- Pleasant view from our room- Rooms were furnished in keeping with a 3 star hotel- Excellent price for a Waikiki central hotelCons:- Poor amenities with no on-site gym, a minuscule plunge pool, and no comfortable common areas- Scary $20 parking garage if you rent a large vehicle or are not a good driver- Archaic elevator system that requires you to go down to the lobby and get in a different elevator to get to the parking and/or laundry room- Over half of the rooms in the hotel have a view directly into a neighboring building 40 feet away.- Lots of noisy Waikiki bars nearby, and a bar/club in the base of the hotel (could be a pro too I suppose, but not if you value quiet while you sleep)- Clearly a hotel that has been upgraded from a 2.5 star to a 3 star, but still has the bones of a 2.5 star

Location was perfect, your right in the middle of Waikiki and can walk to everything, staff was cordial and accomodating, rooms were clean and well maintained, overall a very good experience.There is no fitness center but does have a jacuzzi and pool, although pool is a tad bit small. then again everything in Waikiki has to be smaller because of lack of space.

Looking for a lower cost option in the Waikiki area, we booked 6 nights at the Ohana Waikiki Malia through Donna Bender, who is an Outrigger Ohana Hospitality Specialist. We had a nice suite of rooms with kitchenette and twin day beds in addition to the bedroom. Tons of eating places and shopping within blocks, a main bus/trolley line at our door, and the beach only two long blocks away made this a great location. No great view from our room, but the price was worth it! Front desk staff were great. A parking space in the limited garage is not guaranteed but we were able to get one the two nights we rented a car.

First impression ( lobby) .......... clean and welcoming!My husband and I continually return to this particular hotel. It is walking distance to food and entertainment, there's a pizza joint that's not to bad down stairs along with an ihop.Front desk associate have so much aloha and smiles. No bad experience from our many stays.Security is 100%, on high volumes a room key is mandatory to go up and down in elevators as well as in the lobby.Swimming pool is very small so for those looking to have pool time, not the place to go.The only thing we would like to see improved is their rooms, although they are spacious the larger older room with two bedroom areas needs immediate attention.Hope this helps a lot of you looking for a good nights in Hawaii!Mahalo!

We had a 4 day stopover in Honolulu on our way to Canada in August 2012. This is a great hotel for anyone looking for reasonably priced accommodation. The suite was clean andcomfortable with a kitchenette where we could prepare meals. It is just a short walk to the main shopping strip and another block to the beach. There is an IHOP diner and a bar next door and three ABC stores within 1 block of the hotel (one diagonally across the street from the hotel) where supplies could be purchased. The staff weree very helpful. The only thing I would like to see is a kettle to boil water for Tea.

We stayed twice during July, 2012. No useful restaurant in-house, but plenty in the neighborhood, and it's just one block back from the entire Waikiki "strip." Rooms are clean and functional, staff are excellent. I'd want something fancier if I planned to spend lots of time in my room, but that's not the point of visiting Hawaii.

My partner and I spent six nights here in early August 2012. I was under no illusion - I knew the pool was small and basic, but as first time visitors to Hawaii I knew we'd be out and about most of the time and not wasting time in the hotel - all I wanted was a nice, clean room in a good location at a decent price (via Expedia) and that is what I got! The location was fine - walking distance to everything (I didn't notice the problems with pimps & hookers that another reviewer refers to!), the reception staff were all friendly and helpful with taxis and the like, as were the activty desk staff. Free wi-fi in the lobby which is handy. We arrived after an overnight flight long before check in time, of course our room wasn't ready but they offered an upgrade to an ocean view room for an extra $20 per night, which we gladly took....made our first day much more bearable. Overall, I'd definately stay here again.

Overall, our stay at this hotel was nice. The staff was friendly and the location is good. However, on our second night, we chose to walk 30 minutes to our car rather than park in hotel garage. The garage has only ONE ramp so you have to hope to not get hit by oncoming traffic. Also, the ramps are terrible. They are so narrow that there are marks all along them from where cars have scraped along the walls trying to make the turns. I parked on one of the upper levels and when I left, my rental car actual scraped the ground when I turned one of the corners. I got out of the car to see if there was damage and there was a dent along the bottom of the car. I then looked at the ground and could see that many other cars had apparently done the same thing.Since the hotel does not manage the garage, I was put in contact with the garage manager who told me that they were not responsible for the damages OR for the state of structure itself. When I pointed out that one of the employees at the garage told me that he does not park on the upper levels because of this issue, I was simply told, "Not EVERYONE has this issue". The manager refused to help me and would not even refund the $20 fee for the one night I used the facility.

the Malia is a great property, budget price range but nice rooms and very clean and comfortable. great to have an IHOP downstairs too, the kitchenette rooms are a great way to help keep the food bill downgreat staff !

They have finally added a pool to the Malia, so we stayed there. dependable Ohana property; cheerful helpful staff. The pool is basically a plunge pool and also has a hot tub. No lounge chairs to hang out during the day but great if you want to just cool down before dinner. If you need to hang at a pool all day; you can use the nice one at the Waikiki West , a sister property, 1 block down. Room size average; toiletries OK,Nice to have real glasses and real coffe cups.Nothing outstandingly bad.

Booked this hotel for a 10 day family vacation in February. As the trip got closer I started reading reviews in early July and started to worry. We were very pleasantly surprise how nice the staff and the facilities were . This is an older property about 10 minute walk from the beach. Swimming pool is a small lap pool and the spa was good. Nice small patio area with bar service and some bar food (nachos, chip n salsa, taco's, pizza). We stayed in the older area of the hotel and the room are a 7 out of 10 (Clean) and no problems with the elevator as far as the wait. We book a 1bedroom room for adult privacy and had 2 singles that were sofa's in the living room. Also traveled with my folk and they were able to book a nice handicap room, with wheelchair accessiblility . this room had a queen size bed and a sofa folding bed in the living room.Attached to the property is a I-hop restaurant.A nice pizza place down the street (2blks) was reasonable- 'Serino's' I think was the name. the one attached to the hotel was very pricey. Also a nice little bakery next door to the pizzeria.Adults.....plz pack your alcohol within you luggage, cause you'll pay plenty over in Waikiki. We ran out and went to Walmart , 1blk from the Ala Moana shopping center. Walmart had mixers, sodas, shirts, beach towels and small souvenirs and decent prices.Use the free pink trolley shuttle to travel to Walmartif your in Waikiki on a Friday night in the summer there are fireworks at 7:45pm at the Hilton Village beach.Very nice property for a reasonable Hawaiian family vacation without breaking the bank.

I was surprised to feel so unwelcome at the reception desk. I was expecting more in the land of aloha! Felt rushed and the guy( I guess this employee was not worth remembering) did not even directing us to where exactly where to find our room. Beautiful lobby, though. Pool/ jacuzzi relatively small. Not much to do over here. Didn't know where to find the icemaker or late night vending machines?no info from your workers! Took us awhile how to properly operate the elevator. Did I mention it had nice decor? There is a bar called Rivals in it. Did not go there. Went across the street instead. Amazing shopping complex next door! There is an activities desk. I did not see parking; just an unloading area at entrance. I suggest staying in a five star resort to get the royal treatment. Expected more than this! Stayed in a room with two beds. Need to make sure you close bathroom door in order to be able to bathe. No microwave. Small hidden fridge. No ice trays. Good luck finding ice because I couldn' t find machine!

We chose the location because it was close to the apartment my friend's son was renting. We were pleased to find that it was also close to beach, shopping, restaurants, and the tourist scene you would expect from Waikiki. What we did not expect were the hookers and pimps that hang out at night on Kuhio Dr in front of the hotel and in both blocks on either side of the hotel. Next block over on Kalakaua was much more upscale. Opt for one block closer to the beach if your price point allows. The room was OK for the time that we spent there. The parking garage was ridiculous...the absolute worst I have ever experienced in the entire world. If you are renting a car, go somewhere else. Too scary, dangerous and risky. We could not get the Internet to work. Finally they sent a repairman to our room at about 10:00 pm to fix it the night before we left so we could check on our flight arrangements. Elevators took forever. Don't think I would ever stay there again.

Pros: The hotel is in a very good location. Walking distance to the beach, the strip and alot of restaurants. There's a bar downstairs with a handsome bartender - Eric. There is also the Slice of Waikiki-very good pizza, very nice employees. The hotel provides daily maid service. SOME housekeepers were outstanding. Loved coming into newly made beds.Cons:Horrible, I mean HORRIBLE customer service! Front desk personnels were rude. They talk to you like you don't understand English! Some raises their voice on you! Parking employees and some securities were also rude. I swear, just cause I look young doesn't mean you can treat me like you're my mother. The standard rooms did not have microwaves. We stayed there for 11 days and asked for one but hotel manager said they can't provide us one due to electrical issues. We asked if we could just check out and find another hotel with microwave but we're told most hotels in Hawaii have the same problem. (Aqua Island Colony down Seaside Ave has a microwave AND a little kitchenette in their standard rooms!! Even a lanai more than twice as big!!)When we arrived (and throughout the stay) .. The toilet bowl was so sticky. We never figured out what it was. I had to roll toilet paper around the seat everytime I had to use it. Lanai is only enough for one chair. Pool is sooo small. Parking garage is really small compare to the other ones around the area. And did I mention.. One of the ladies was RUDE.Security- we liked how elevator is keyed entrance, but if you have fam or friends visiting you at night.. This is not the hotel for you. A friend of mine was literally kicked out by a security because she wasn't registered. Which part of visiting did you not understand? They did not even let her in at all! She lives in Hawaii! If my roommate didn't have our car rental, I would have drove to her instead. Overall- we weren't happy with our stay. Never going back here just to be treated like crap. I wish I stayed somewhere else. 11 days of vacay ruined by this stay.

very friendly staff, helpfull, and clean room. most hotels in Waikiki are old and this one was but they did recently update this hotel. we did not use or even see the pool we were there for a short time. its not your big resort on the beach, but the location is good and within walking distance topretty much everything. the beach was a quick 10 min walk. would definitly stay there again. one downfall, no fitness center

I'm very happy that we chose Ohana Malia for our annual trip to Hawaii. We stayed there for 3 nights before moving to a condo in Kahala. The room was clean and updated and the hotel staff was friendly. It was an excellent deal @ $99.00 - AAA rate. It was a lot quieter there than staying @ the Aqua Waikiki Wave where we had stayed a couple of times. The location is very central - close to the beach, Royal Hawaiian shopping center, restaurants... It is a block and half to the VERY popular Marukame restaurant - a tempura/udon chain from Japan. Will definitely stay there again next time.

We had a nice (but brief stay) at this hotel in Waikiki. It's in the middle to the tourist area, so access to amenities was quite easy. We had a room in the older building (still clean and spacious) and had easy access to the parkade (no need to use the elevators - I just made sure that I parked the car on the same level as our room - convenient). Breakfast was not part of the hotel's amenities (although inexpensive places to eat were nearby - read McDonald's and International Market). Our stay allowed us free access to the Pink Trolley lines - so we can move around Waikiki area without having to use our rental car.We had a room facing away from the main road (Kuhio) - so the room was relatively quiet when the patio door was open. At night, we would use the AC which was extremely quiet and efficient. There is a very small pool and hot tub (we did not use any) - both were clean and well kept.Just beware of the really really tight access to the parkade - you almost need someone to spot you when you come in or out of the parkade.We'll definitely use this hotel again when we return to Waikiki. Great value for the money.

Whenever I need to visit Oahu I always book a room here. The room is large, clean, and nice. The staff is great and the location is perfect. They have a computer in the lobby area for guest to use. There is parking onsite that is a little tight but a friendly attendant will help guide your car! The only thing about the hotel that bothers me is the elevator. When coming in from the parking garage it will automatically take you to the lobby before going up to your floor. When tring to go to the parking you will need to go all the way to the lobby and then sometimes change elevators. This wouldn't be a problem but the elevators are very slow and it seems that sometimes only 1 was working.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our second trip to Honolulu. I had a budget I wanted to work within and I knew we wanted to be in the general area of Waikiki Beach and the International Market Place since that area had all the things we liked to do when we weren't off exporing the island. I ended up doing a blind bid on Priceline and was able to pay a little under $100 per night for the hotel stay. We only had to walk a few blocks to get to the beach so the location was perfect. We had a rental car so we parked on site at the hotel. I wouldn't suggest staying here if you rent a large car, the parking garage is so small that every turn coming in and out was scary. Fortunately we had a midsize car. At check in I asked about upgrading our room, and was told that we could pay $20 per night to upgrade to a city view, higher floor room. Knowing how the street noise can be loud, especially at night when you are trying to sleep, we decided to upgrade. We got a top floor (18th) room and were so happily surprised to see we had fantastic ocean views with a small balcony (room for one chair). Although we asked for a room with two beds because our 21 year old son came with us, I wasn't expecting two double beds, but they proved to be very comfortable and very soft. After a quick call down to housekeeping for some extra pillows and towels, we headed out to the beach. We stopped by the front desk to pick up some beach towels they loan you, and I learned that when you stay at an Ohana hotel, your room key allows you to ride free on the Pink Trolley Line from the DFS mall around the Waikiki area all the way down to the Ala Moana Mall. This was a nice benefit to stay at this hotel. Although I would have liked a larger swimming pool, we ended up just enjoying the beach often since we were so close. They even have a small laundry room to wash your clothes. They gave us change at the front desk and we sat in the laundry room enjoying a beer while we washed up our clothes wihin an hours time. We travel light, so we only bring back packs, so being able to wash our few clothes is important. We also appreciated the independent travel agent in the hotel lobby who referred us to another independent company a few blocks away when she didn't have any discounts for Germain's Lua. We ended up saving almost $60 for three tickets to the highly rated lua. Overall the room was clean, comfortable, had coffee and refrigerator, great views and quiet A/C for a great price in a great location. Will definately come back!

Pros: Convenient location, about a 5-10 minute walk from International market, and 10 minute walk to the beach. Rooms were clean and pretty new. Had a few nice touches that weren't expected, like having plumeria & orchid flowers to pin in your hair at the front office. Cons: Elevator system is frustrating. It is really odd and inconvenient (you have to swipe your key card, as other reviewers have described) and there are some elevators which only go to the rooms, and the others which go to garage and rooms. Weekend nights saw security asking for key cards. Have to "check out" beach towels from the front desk, which made getting towels less convenient. Some room components, like the curtains, felt a little cheap, but this is a value hotel you choose for clean, convenience. Swimming pool felt like it was located in the back alley, but being so close to the beach, who wants to swim in a pool anyway, and there are the other pools at the sister hotels (Ohana East & Ohana West) which are maybe 5-10 mins walk away.Parking $20 per day, going rate for the area, parking garage is pretty scary to drive around. Liked, it, but I'd be interested in checking out other hotels in the area with a less annoying elevator and less scary parking next time.

this hotel deserves five stars! Clean, child friendly, with excellent maid and bell hop service. Staff was knowledgable, helpful and curteous. An IHOP in the hotel provided excellent service, food was good.I would definately stay here again. After checking out and leaving our bags with the bellhops we were gone 6 hours. When we came to claim our bags we were given another room free of charge to freshen up in! The only drawback is the pool and jacuzzi hours were not as late as I would have like to seen. But truly worth the sacrifice.

Large, clean room (except for the mold on the A/C return vent) with small frig. & comfortable bed. Ice only on certain floors - somewhat inconvenient. All staff very friendly & helpful. Good location close enough to stores, restaurants & International Marketplace & safe even when returning alone at night! Don't know where previous reviewer encountered prostitutes!?!?! Would be nice to have microwave & Wi-fi in rooms! Will definitely stay here again!

We stayed at the Ohana Waikiki Malia for 3 days in May. Overall, the value was good due to the price. Room was clean with a nice TV and mini fridge. Staff were friendly. Lanais were very small and bed was kind of hard. Also, the location was not the greatest, felt like we walked a awhile to everywhere we wanted to be... Overall though, you can't beat the value for the price. If I were looking for another hotel stay not beachfront, I would stay here again.

stayed for 3 nights. nice small room. clean no problems there. Check in and out quick and without any problems.The parking is a completely different story,Oh my god....I lived in France for some years, I am used to small and badly planned parking. But this was pretty much the smallest most stupidly planned parking garage I have ever been in.If you plan on getting a full size car/suv go somewhere else.they make you pay a whopping 30$ a day if you don't stay there and a still ridiculous 20$ if you stay there.Expensive and bad is a bit to much.On the plus side, no resort fees and really very helpful employees

I'm not sure how this hotel received a 3 star rating, but it is FAR from that! The room was not very clean, if you get the Kitchenette room the beds are like sleeping on cardboard and the room is NOT remodeled, however the remodeled rooms are not much better (we stayed in one of those too!).The evening staff is extremely rude and if you are going with other friends or family staying in another hotel forget about inviting them to come up to your room! There is a rude security guard that watches the elevator and unless you have a room key and are registered to the room, you won't get in! Hotel is noisy, there will be no sleeping in! The city parking garage for the buses is right there...backup alarms ALL morning long!Neiborhood is NOT the best place at night either, unless your into prostitutes and drug dealers offering you services every time you walk back to your room!My home bathtub is bigger than their pool!!! Not that you could sunbath anyway...it gets no sun at all!Pay a few extra dollars and stay somewhere else! It's not worth ruining your vacation over!

Stayed 3 nights at the Waikiki Malia and wished I stayed longer. The hotel is remarkably clean due to being recently renovated. The room itself were spacious for 2, well furnished, and very comfortable. The rooms had a fridge, granite countertops, new faucets, new handheld adjustable shower head, flat screen tv, small balcony, digital exact temp thermostats, free in room safe, iron and board, dual nightstand, and plenty of pillows. Everything was impressively clean from bathroom to carpet to windows. The elevators were only accessible with a room key, and ice was on every floor. I always saw 3 or more staff members at the front desk every time I walked past. The negatives would be the small pool and parking charge, but it seems like every hotel charges for parking these days and they allow you to use the pools at their sister hotels Ohana East and West. The bathroom is a tad bit cramped also. Location was a few blocks from the beach, but definitely walkable. Very close to everything else in Waikiki including grocery store, restaurants, and shopping. Highly recommended to anyone looking for a good value and clean hotel.

Our stay in the Malia was very nice. The hotel was clean and quiet. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We were able to book through their military liason and save on our room and parking, I highly recommend looking into that if you are military. The parking garage was clean and not smelly(unlike others in waikiki). The parking attendants were also helpful and pleasant. The ramps up and down were steep but after the first couple of trips in and out it didn't seem so bad. I was especially glad to see that the pictures that the hotel had on its site accurately depicted the room that we got.

Ohana Malia Hotel is modern , new , and clean. Good sized room with a tiny balcony , which is handy to dry clothes. Good Service and courteous staff. That said , sadly there's no wifi in the room (only lobby), no free water, further walk from beach (couple of blocks walk), no free parking ($20 a night), and we could not borrow a scale. There is however a small lap pool and Jacuzzi on the first floor. But if you are concerned on the weight of your luggage, you can buy a hand held scale at ABC for only $6. Theres a store across the street which sells 8shirts (good quality) for $20. Also there is an I Hop restaurant downstairs, Good Pizza for take out just outside.

Just got back from Hawaii and stayed at this hotel. Overal had a good experience. We did not stay on the removated tower as we needed a seperate room suite as we are travelling with a noisy sleeping toddler. The hotel is in the middle of Waikiki, so I would not really recommend a car unless you are planning to travel to the North Shore. Parking isnt as bad as everyone claims, just make sure your rental in under 6 feet tall, we had a jeep wrangler and it fit. Just make sure you back into your space and you'll be fine leaving. Another tip, print out the U of H Rainbow Warriors fan rate to get a 50% discount on parking and cheaper room rate on the new tower, you should also get a free beach bag too. Hope this helps, until next time Hawaii!

There is only 1 entrance/exit to the carpark and it is this 1 single-lane, steep ramp with sharp turning curves! This means that when you are exiting the building using the ramp, there better not be any cars on the main road turning in! Either the incoming car has to back up into the main road (dangerous!) or the outgoing car got to back up along the steep ramp (also dangerous!). And you got to pay $20 every night for parking here!Rooms were clean and tidy. Well-located in Waikiki.

For the price if you compare the hotels aroud you get for what you paid. 15 minutes walk to Waikiki beach. Shopping and restaurants all aroud. The place is clean but noisy even late at night. Parking is terrible in this area and very expensive. The pool is stock between buildings so no sun. But will all that, for a far price in a fair hotel in Honolulu, I will recommand the Ohana Waikiki Malia.

This is a very nice hotel for the money and is in a good location. It is in Waikiki but not on the beach but a couple block walk to the beach with lots of restaurants and shops nearby like Ocean Walk and Hard Rock and there is a bus stop out front of building. The rooms are nice they are average size and come with a small refrigerator you can use and a safe and are clean the workers are very nice and helpful A+. The down side is the pool is small and not in the sun if you want a pool not the place. Other wise I would stay here again.

All I want to mention is the fact that the PM manager, Les, really lives up to his name "Less". We prepaid through Orbitz and upon arriving to the property attempted to park in their parking area. I could only get to the 1st level of parking. There was no way of getting any higher than that due to the low ceiling of the parking structure. When I let the manager know about the parking situation all the problems started. Les did very little to remedy the issue! At one point Les made me feel like it was my problem because I had a vehicle that was too big and that I should of mentioned that I had a larger vehicle when booking our trip... I just about lost it when I heard that! I really need not get into any more details of the rest. At this point I did not want to even stay at this POORLY managed property. We went back and forth with all of this for a little over an hour. We ended up being relocated across the street to the WAY BETTER MANAGED Courtyard By Marriott. When checking in over there Mr. Fujimoto took care of us. We explained the situation to him. With no hesitation he apologized(although not his fault) and had room keys in our hands within minutes! Outstanding! Our poor children and my wife could FINALLY rest! One of the things that really stood out was the fact Mr.Fujimoto is most probably less than half the age of Les... I honestly expected a lot more from Les! I am going to write the GM of the Ohana Waikiki Malia and ask what happened there? Is this how they treat all their prepaid guests? Just how much business is being turned away due to this kind of unacceptable guest treatment? How do they stay in business with this type guest treatment? I mean, clearly upper management at Ohana Waikiki Malia is not aware of this. I am sure the Ohana Waikiki Malia is a great property but with unbecoming guest treatment that my wife and I experienced from Les is really taking away the true meaning of the "Aloha Spirit".

We enjoyed our stay at the Ohana Wiakiki Malia. Nice property located within a 10 minute walk to the beach and lots of places to eat nearby. This is not a full service hotel, so don't expect to find room service and valet parking. The hotel is older, but well kept and the staff are very friendly and accomodating. Housekeeping staff were fantastic and did great job, we stayed for 7 days and the room was cleaned promptly each day. We locked ourselves out of the in room safe and the security staff were very prompt in helping us out (but only after checking our ID). Getting to the parkade is tricky and space is limited, so if you're renting a car opt for a compact or midsize car. The hotel recently added a hot tub and a pool, the pool is tiny (if you're the type that wants to sit by the pool all day, you'll be disappointed). If you are looking for a great property at a fair price consider this property.

I booked this hotel based on the description and pictures on the internet. The room I got was not even close, in fact it is one of the worst rooms I have ever stayed in. It was on the 10th floor of the Luana wing, basically it was as if they decided to add 4 additional rooms on the roof. No balcony the sliding door led out onto the roof. The furniture was very poor quality, old and very scuffed up the carpet was stained. The room was extremely ran down and its location made our stay horrible. Also don't stay here if you like to lounge by the pool as part of your vacation, it also is not the least bit inviting

Have just gotten back from my third time staying at the Ohana Waikiki Malia.I just love this hotel. You cannot beat the price, location and just general greatness.The hotel is clean, staff friendly and helpful.I was a bit concerned as they have added a sports bar and I thought it might be loud or attract a different clientale, but didnt really notice much of a change. 1 night it was a bit loud, but I think that wasnt from the sports bar, just general yahoos on Kuhio.Tip- make sure you ask for a room on a higher floor as Kuhio can be a bit rowdy and a room in the Malia tower as they have been renovated and are just lovely

We chose this hotel because it offered a good bedding option for our family. Our 2 teenage girls don't like to share a bed and the Malia offers one bedroom suites with a living room that has day beds which convert into 2 single beds. The kitchenette was a bonus. This worked really well for our needs, and we thoroughly enjoyed our 10 day stay.We found the hotel staff to be really helpful, and all the facilities were good. The location is great with lots of dining and shopping choices nearby. Make sure you try Slice of Waikiki at the hotel. You can get a huge slice of pizza and a drink for a good price, and it is really tasty.Do beware of the parkade though. It is really tight for an average size car, and the exit ramps are particularly scary.

After staying a few nights at the Ohana Waikiki West, we moved over to the Ohana Waikiki Malia. This is another great hotel to stay at if you are on a budget! My wife and I stayed here for three days while in town and found it to be all that we needed. The room and hotel in general were very clean and quiet. Staff was very friendly and helpful! Our room had a mini fridge and a small lanai! We were on the 16th floor and the view was nice (just be careful not to go out on the lanai without either leaving the door open or someone else being in the room; the door may lock itself and you would be stuck!) Some of the pluses include free access to the pink trolley, updated decor, in room internet (hint: bring your wireless router to have an instant wireless connection in your room) and the service. I would definitely recommend to the budget conscious! And keep in mind, you are probably not in Hawaii to be in your hotel/room, get out there and enjoy paradise!

i stayed at the Ohana Waikiki Malia last week for 3 nights and was more than satisfied. it is one of the Outrigger group's boutique hotels and offers no-frills accommodation. it is not the Four Seasons or the Sheraton, so don't complain about full-service. they have no room-service for the fact that they don't have an in-house restaurant, however, the surrounding areas are full of restaurants of every kind. the location of the hotel is in the center of almost everything in Waikiki Beach. the beach is a 10-minute walk and the shopping areas are just about a few blocks away. if you're gay, there are about 3-4 gay bars within a block or two. the staff are courteous and warm. the bedrooms are well appointed, clean and depending how high is your floor - considerably quiet. do not expect total quietness because the hotel is located in a busy traffic area. if you want quiet, go to the Turtle Beach area. even the nearby Sheraton or Hyatt is quite noisy. the balconies in the Malia Tower are quite smaller in scale but it will accommodate a couple of chairs if you want to breathe some fresh air. the taller tower was just recently remodeled and the beds are still firm. don't complain about mustiness because you are in a tropical island where the humidity can get high at any given hour/day. the bedrooms are always tidied up on a regular basis and the bathroom amenities are always replaced. restaurants are within walking distance in every category. the International Market Place is just a couple of blocks down if you want free hula entertainment, fast food and souvenir shopping. high-end shopping is in every corner, including the Royal Hawaiian Center. the Ala Moana shopping centre is just a pink trolley away (free). if you're quite adventurous and have good knee strength, Waikiki Beach is walkable and is more fun. if you need to rent a car, just one day will be good to tour the whole island. overall, this hotel is great for its price and value. i will stay there again on my next visit. i will also recommend it to my friends/family.

We are going to stay at the hotel for 10 days and it had been wonderful until we got woke up tonight by the parking garage guy who asked us to go downstair to pay our $20 parking immediately at 10:30 pm at night. He said that he will charge us $30 more if we don't go down there to pay right away. We were told that it can be charged to our hotel room when we first checked in ( and they have our credit card too). We called the manager and complaint - he just said that we will take care of it tomorrow. The parking at this hotel is rid off for $20 per night when the public parking is $8 per night down the street. We only parked at the hotel first night. Having some parking guy called you to wake you up at 10:30 pm for $20 is a joke when we already pre-pay our 10 days hotel in advance. They can't even figure out how long your car in there. In some way, I am glad that we take care of it right way. Otherwise, we will not know how bad their parking management is -- they can't get the fee straight. I don't want to go home and get a $200 dollar bills for parking -- the parking that we never park. When I told the guy that he just woke me up, he was not even sorry and just told me it's only 10:30 pm not 11:00 pm. When I asked him why he can't call us earlier to ask us to pay, he said that he is doing his job. The hotel is in the good location but it has a funny smell. We heard some noise almost every night. The consumer serivce is bad. We have never had anybody from hotel to call us at 10:30 pm for $20. The worst consumer service ever. Will never stay here again.

My fiancè and I stayed here for the Pro Bowl and it was great! The rooms were clean and had all the amenities we needed. The IHOP next door is over priced but just walk a block towards the beach and go to a local restaurant - much cheaper. The hotel is in a great location - everything is within walking distance. The pool is the only downside but they don't hype it up.

I just returned from Oahu, Hawaii. I was there 5 days. My stay could not have been more perfect. The weather, the people, and the accommodations. The hotel that I stayed was the Ohana Waikiki Malia which is an Outrigger property. The customer service was over the top. Ohana means family, and that is exactly what you feel like when you stay there. In fact, they recently renovated the property. And the best part about staying at any Outrigger property, you will not be charged resort fees...ever! You cannot go wrong by staying at any of the Outrigger properties. on a scale of 1 - 10, I give the Ohana Waikiki Malia a '10'.

This hotel was a very enjoyable experience! It was clean, well furnished, accessible to most everything we needed, and affordable.Our flight was delayed by one day and the hotel personnel were very gracious about it. Upon checkout, they agreed to hold our luggage a few hours after checkout to accommodate our flight schedule.The hotel is designed for the comfort of the guests. It appears to be older, but is updated and well arranged. Our "room" was a suite with a kitchen and bath separating the two sleeping areas, and a balcony. There is an I-Hop within the hotel and many dining and shopping opportunities nearby.The staff was exceptional. They made us feel that we were special and wanted!There are many things to do around Honolulu (including "gawking" as we walked through the lobbies of the really luxurious nearby hotels!) We visited Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head, went snorkeling and enjoyed beach sunsets and seemingly endless displays of double rainbows each day.Rental cars are very expensive, but the hotels have free trolleys (just show your room card) to dining and shopping. The bus system is well organized..a schedule is posted, and you can go most anywhere on one.The nearby malls are worth the trip, and such food!!! Lovely island. Beautiful beaches. Lovely Hotel. I'd definitely stay there again..

The hotel has a great location for bus, beach, restaurants, etc. But it is very dated (or least the wing we were in was.) First room offerred had a moldy odor. Second one was better but mold was visible on the carpeted baseboard. The carpet itself needed a cleaning - better still replacement. Furniture was fine, though.

My wife and I went to Waikiki Malia for our honeymoon. The room was very clean. The staff gave us excellent information throughout our trip. Several restaurants were located close to the hotel. The Bus, that goes through Oahu, stops across the street from the hotel. ABC is less than a block away.

My significant other and I had spend a nice quiet overnighter at this hotel. It was a short,but well rested way to spend Christmas Eve. This is actually a repeat visit for me at this hotel. I've stayed here about a year ago for Thanksgiving and it was a very pleasant first time stay here. The staff was alsways very accomodating and "Ohana-like". I will definately be booking another reservation here soon.

I'm going with 5 stars for the great staff and outstanding housekeeping. My 17th floor room in the main building (Malia Tower) was reasonably quiet and as comfortable as could be. All the "standard" rooms are in the Malia Tower and all have been renovated. But if you pay more for a 1 bedroom unit, you'll be in the infamous unrenovated Luana Wing - don't!I have to agree with the previous reviewers about the lack of TV channels. As you can see from my profile, I have traveled around the world to many continents and have never ever stayed in a hotel with fewer TV channels, at least not in this century. Even in countries like Cambodia, Thailand and Laos, I could receive CNN and other cable news channels. I have stayed in many other budget hotels in Waikiki and had no complaints about the TV channel lineup either. This is the only hotel where there is no CNN (no, HLN is not CNN), no MSNBC, no CNBC, no Weather Channel, etc. etc. At home these channels are part of my "basic" cable service so I don't understand why Ohana accepts anything less.The other issue is the crazy elevator system. In the Malia Tower, only one of three elevators stops at floors 2-5. There are no independent call buttons, however. So if you're going down to the 5th floor to use the guest laundry, for example, the odds are 2 to 1 that the elevator you called won't be the one that stops on these lower floors. Many guests seem hopelessly confused by this arrangement which could be rectified if Ohana would install a separate call system for the elevator that services the garage and laundry floors. Anyway, despite these minor issues, I hope to return to the Waikiki Malia the next time I'm in Honolulu.

We are regular visitors to Waikiki and have stayed at the Malia quite a few times in the last two years. For the price, we are very impressed with everything about the hotel, including the friendly, helpful staff, super-clean rooms, free Internet and excellent location. We are returning to Waikiki in February for two weeks and this time have chosen not to stay at the Malia for one reason only: the extremely limited number of TV channels. We do not stay out late at night and enjoy relaxing in the room, however have found on our past visits that there is so little to watch on TV that we had to choose another hotel for our next visit. We noticed that you mentioned you would be improving your TV channel selection in the future. We will be very happy to return when this has been done.

Just returned from my first stay at the Ohana Waikiki Malia and I couldn't be more pleased. The staff was friendly, always saying hello whenever we returned to the hotel, and the room was lovely and always cleaned impeccably. I requested a renovated room ahead of time and they accomodated me, no problem. Location is great, some street noise from Kuhio (which our room overlooked) but nothing that running the fan didn't take care of. We really lucked out and got quiet neighbors for all but one night of our stay too. I *do* have to echo the warnings about the parking garage. Yikes! Be mindful of it if you are renting a car and especially if you get an SUV (take my advice: don't! Get a compact). But the folks in the garage were super sweet and it was a pleasure to see them every day as well. Will definitely stay here again!

I have had the pleasure of returning 6 times through the years to the Ohana Waikiki Malia. This year, with renovations complete, my stay was excellent. The installed internet in the rooms, the new lap pool and hot tub are very welcome additions. Familiar faced staff treated me with friendly, respectful, attentive service. Management were very generous and assistive to my needs as a severely disabled traveler. The handicapped acessable room has a large, sparkling clean roll in shower with hand held showering. It's perfect for those that need caregiver assistant. I plan on returning the the aloha, and ohana (family) spirit of the beautiful island of Oahu, and the wonderful Ohana Waikiki Malia as often as possible. Mahalo!

This hotel is located at the center district of Waikiki. Good location for shopping but too noisy for sleep. We couldn't get sleep till very late night, and frequently be waked by all kinds of loud noisy. I wish we could stay at a much quiet place for our vacation.The $20/day parking is also a challenge for your brave and driving skill. The ramp is really narrow, steep with sharp turns. you have to be very careful when in and out of the garage. I can guess how many accidents by looking the scratches on the wall. My wife pray to the God every time we drove through the ramps.

We vacation in Waikiki almost yearly and have been staying at the Malia for at least the last 15 years, possibly more. That staff have been consistently personable and professional from Sherry and Kristy, who we first meet about 16 years ago to Alvina, Troy, Peter, and the other young fellow whose name I don't remember who work there now. The Ohana Waikiki Malia is conveniently located to bus stops, restaurants, and Kalakaua Avenue stores and not far from the beach. It's not a high luxury hotel so it is perfect for people like us who spend most of the day out and around town and return at night to sleep and who like to stay atleast two weeks there at a time. We would have to limit our stay to a week if we stayed at the more expensive hotels. Perhaps what also works for us is that because we stay there so often, some of the front desk staff have gotten to know us and we consider them our friends. One last note: In every other city we stay in a Marriott and are Marriott reward members that could benefit from a two week stay per year at a Marriott in Waikiki but we choose to stay at the Ohana Waikiki Malia.
user_name:
Eru A
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: Since we don't spend much time in a Hotel, this was perfect. We were in room 904 which was has a separate bedroom, but only one TV. The staff were very friendly, we asked for some extra Outriggers discount books so the 4 of us could enjoy a reasonable breakfast elsewhere. We were also able to find a parking garage not to far away, but again we stay gone alot so it worked cheaper for us. I would suggest paying their $20 fee if you going to use their shuttle or walking to most everything.

After travelling around the world, this was a very poor place (especially by American standards). Do not take a family room with kitchen (small, ugly, noisy). Lots of noise : Harley (motorcycle) shop across the street and the street noise, parking noise on the other side, A/C so noisy, and the sound of the toilet flushing/shower running down the pipes from the room above. And they were doing big noisy work on the building. Guess where the new tiny "swimming" pool and hot tub will be... between the 40 meter high concret wall (no windows) of the shopping mall and the 4-level parking garage. We wanted to run away after one night. Fortunately, the reception offered to move us without extra charge to the Ohana West, which is better.

Stayed here one night. The staff at reception were very friendly and helpful from beginning to end. The room, though basic, was clean and the bed very comfortable. This hotel is on a busy street so I would advise getting a room higher up to minimize traffic noise. I stayed in room 930 which was corner room that had a tiny balcony but a view of the canal which most of the rooms would not have. The television cable channels are limited so I recommend this hotel for people who want to be on the move but who want a centrally located hotel and one of the least expensive in Waikiki. For those really on a tight budget an added advantage (if you have minimal luggage) is that the local bus from the airport stops outside the hotel. The cost is $2.50 one way compared to $15.50 for the shuttle. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and convenience stores within a couple of minutes of the front door of the hotel.

First of all, after booking this hotel I knew it was not going to be great but I was still not prepared for the disappointment or shock. AAA has it correct when it says 2-star because I can give no fathomable explanation for how travel sites are rating this location as a 3-star hotel. The only positives about this hotel that I can mention is it only two blocks from Waikiki Beach, we got a great rate on the room, and the air conditioner drowns out all the street noise.At arrival, there is no noticeable entrance to park your car to unload and check-in. It wasn't until the next day that I noticed you drive onto the sidewalk area when you check-in. The parking garage is trecherous with a single, steep entry/exit ramp that only allows a single car regardless of direction of travel. We had a standard sized car and could barely fit in the parking spaces. There is only one elevator from the garage and you have to go to the lobby prior to being able to go to your room. Going back to the garage is also a chore since, once again, you go to the lobby, then only one elevator goes to the garage but it takes you through the unrenovated wing and then climb three stairs, and open a door before you're back at the garage.If that's not bad enough, we get to the room and our internet is not working. I call the front desk for assistance and they refer me to an 800 number. I asked for them to send someone up or move me to room with working internet and they refuse, saying that the internet is contracted through another company. Of course the first thing on my list of vacation plans is to call tech support to walk me through a problem that I didn't create. Luckily I know enough to reset the room modem but I still had to pull the dresser away from the wall to reach it. Great customer service!The beds were lumpy and the pillows felt like they were made of foam. The room also had a musty smell but at least the bathroom was remodeled. The maid was friendly but it was hit or miss with other employees. Some were friendly and polite, but others acted like they were bothered when questions were asked. My recommendation would be to avoid this hotel unless you are looking for 1- to 2- star because there is no way this is a 3-star hotel.

We got stuck with this hotel after winning it on priceline. The rooms are tiny and the walls are paper thin. The parking garage is so tight, I've never see anything else like it. The hotel is like a Motel 6 that's been slightly remodeled. The pool is such a joke. I'll never stay here again. The only reason I gave it two stars is because it is close to food and the beach.

We apparently were put into one of the renovated rooms and it was lovely. The room was nicely furnished and very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was excellent.l We booked the AAA rate and it was a bargain compared to other hotels in the area. I highly recommend this hotel, but considering the other recent reviews would make sure that I was put in a renovated room. There is a spa,but the pool is very small. You can use the pool, however, in one of the sister hotels down the street.

My husband and I stayed in the Ohana Waikiki Malia for two nights at the end of our Hawaiian vacation. Before booking, we turned to tripadvisor (like always) and, given all the good reviews, we were pretty confident in our selection. Our confirmed reservation was for a king sized bed on floors "14-18." Upon arrival, the front desk tells us that they do not have any king beds available, and that it is Ohana's policy not to guarantee specific bed sizes. We were offered either a queen or two twins. We took the queen, and weren't at all concerned, so what if we didn't get a king we thought. Big mistake. Apparently this hotel has both newly renovated rooms and nonrenovated rooms. We were put into one of the nonrenovated rooms on the 10th floor. We got off the elevator, and spent a good 10 mins searching for our room. There was a sign with our room number on it, but when you opened the door it lead to a stairwell. After a bit of trial and error, we realized you had to go through the stairwell,. into a second stairwell, and up a few steps into an older building that really is more of a motel than a hotel. All of the rooms open on to a main outdoor walkway, like you'd see at most motels, and they all share one balcony on the back...meaning that any of your neighbors can walk right up to the sliding glass door of your room. The rooms look like they were last updated in the 70s, smelled of must and mold and had mysterious stains on the carpet and curtains.When we went to the front desk to see if we could move rooms, or upgrade if necessary, we were told that the renovated rooms were rented at the same rate as the one we had, and that they'd gladly move us for no charge except that they had literally just rented the last renovated room. They couldn't seem to answer the question of why we were put in a non-renovated room when we checked in, especially since our reservation specifically confirmed that we'd be on floors 14-18 (the non renovated rooms are only on the first 10 floors).We asked about a reduced rate, or partial refund and were denied. The best they could do was put us on the waiting list for a new room the next day. Luckily, a room opened and we spent the second night in a MUCH nicer room. The renovated rooms are really nice, and I can understand why they get such great reviews here. And aside from the fact that we were put into a crappy room, the staff was all really nice and helpful, so I guess the place has potential.But I can't give it any higher than 2 stars because having seen the difference between renovated and unrenovated rooms, I find it unconscionable that they are apparently rented out at the same price. I've stayed in hostels that were nicer than the unrenovated rooms at this place!

I was traveling for business and wasn't going to get much free time, so this hotel was a perfect choice. It is incredibly clean and well-kept and really well located in the heart of Waikiki, just a few blocks from the beach. My 16th floor room was very large and had a peek-a-boo view of the ocean. The bed was very comfortable and everything in the room was modern and well-kept.

We stayed here from Sept 19th 2011 for 4 nights. Our room was spacious and modern as was the bathroom. We had the rate that included breakfast (incl. gratuity) at the IHOP next to the hotel. As soon as the waitress noticed the green breakfast coupon her happy attitude changed! The breakfast is a "set breakfast" that includes eggs, 1 piece bacon, 1 piece of sausage and two pancakes and tea or coffee (a couple of times we were allowed a substitution of toast for the pancakes and hashbrowns for the meat but it depends on the waitress!). As you can get a good breakfast for $3.99 outside the hotel I would recommend going for the hotel only rate. Beach towels are offered at the front desk - the beach is a leisurely 10 minute walk away. You can use your room key to access the "pink Waikiki trolley" behind the hotel free of charge (ideal for the Ala Moana shopping centre). Coffee in the room is awful but there are many coffee houses around. As we had a late flight we were able to store our luggage and use the hotel's hospitality room (15 mins per person) to freshen up before travelling home. All-in-all a great hotel that's safe, in a good location with pleasant, accommodating staff at a very reasonable price.

We loved gthis hotel. When we arrived, we were greeted warmly and advised that $10.00 would be knocked off our already reasonable daily rate because we would be staying a few floors down from the one we booked. Already we're off to a good start. The room was spacious, clean and had a little balcony overlooking the city. It is on a strip with lots of restaurants and close to the shopping area by the beach. We made the mistake of eating breakfast in the IHOP attached to the hotel the first morning (very pricey and you can't get toast with your eggs, just pancakes. What's up with that ??). Fool us once. We walked around and discovered several reasonably priced and good places for breakfast for the remainder of our stay. There is a Mcdonald's a couple of blocks away for a quick start to your day as well. The hotel does not have its own pool, but guests have the option of using two other hotel pools closer to the beach. We checked them out and both were very nice. Just beware of the time share sales agents in these hotels who will call you over on some guise or other just to give you the spiel on vacation time shares. They can be quite persistent and it's hard to get away without being downright rude. There is a shuttle service every hour to the airport from the lobby of the hotel. The desk staff were efficient and extremely personable. Overall, a good experience for our first trip to Hawai'i.

This is a well positioned hotel, about a block back from the main street of Waikiki. The rooms are neat and tidy, beds comfy and the little fridge is handy. There is a good coin operated laundry, the staff are friendly and helpful. The biggest plus is the Waikiki trolley pass you get for free, saves you a bundle, and saves your legs a bit too.The bathrooms are a little cramped, but the showers are nice and they have a bath in them, so again, all that you need is there.its not the fanciest hotel, but its nice and what you save on accomodation costs, you can spend on seeing more of Oahu. or shopping ;-)

We stayed 4 nights. Nice lobby and rooms, very secure at night. No one is allowed up the elevator without showing room key to security. Trolley was easily caught behind hotel at DFS. Prime location for night life, as all clubs and bars/restaurants are within walking distance. Clean rooms, service was good, and the price was right. The IHOP was wayyy expensive, so we did not eat there. No pool or room service but still good value. I recommend for a Waikiki Weekend.

Clean rooms at a reasonable price in the heart of Waikiki. You're only a short walk from the beach and literally surrounded by dining, drinking and shopping choices. The staff was friendly and always helpful. We are a local family and we spent 2 nights there w/ 3 other families and had a blast. I recommend this hotel to both locals looking for a “staycation” or the tourist from out of town.

Stayed April 23 to 29 and found the location very convenient to the beach, shopping, and the mall (via Pink Trolley around the corner using room key to get on for free). If you're going to the mall, make sure you take the Express bus else you'll be looping around picking up others first before heading out there. Loved the food court at the Ala Moana mall and picking up juice and milk at Foodland on the lowest level. We stayed on the 11th floor and didn`t hear a lot of noise other than on the Friday night. Getting in and out of the parking garage is very tricky: steep and sharp curves. I would recommend parking a block or two away at one of the public parking lots which charge from $5 to $10 for a 12 hour period on Kuhio Avenue. Front desk staff were pleasant: need to sign out beach towels so make sure they acknowledge that you`ve brought them back else you`ll be paying for them. Stored our luggage until 6 pm and even offered us the use of a freshup room with shower (ran out of time otherwise would have been nice). Will definitely go back (don`t bother going to the IHOP downstairs for food: expensive for what you get).Beach at Hilton Hawaiian was the nicest beach, with paddleboat, kayak, umbrella and chair rentals for a reasonable price (I think it was $20 for 4 hours or $30 for the day until 5 pm). Ate at the Rainbow Drive-in (about 10 minutes away by car) several times: nothing fancy but huge portions. Safeway was also about 10 minutes away. Tried Waiola and Matsumoto shaved ice; Dole Pineapple plantation dole whip: kids loved it. Leonard`s bakery had a huge lineup. So did Giovanni`s shrimp truck but service was fast (use coupon from tourist brochures to get a free soda can).

Pros: Staff is friendly. Rooms are clean. Nice to have a fridge to keep drinks cold. Hotel key card gives you free use of the pink line trolley, which is great to go to the zoo and the mall. Cons: Parking lot is kind of crazy with steep ramps and tight spots. Parking is expensive at $20 a night. No swimming pool at this hotel, they say you can use the sister hotel swimming pool... but who really wants to walk a few blocks away. Even though there are 4 elevators, they are slow.

Overall, this was a nice hotel for a reasonable price. The rooms are good size and have a nice counter space. Ethernet connection in room was also nice. Breakfast deal is misleading, however. When I booked, I booked the room for two adults and two kids and given the option of $30/day for breakfast which I took. However, when I arrived I was only given breakfast tickets for two and told that's all it was. Breakfast was at the IHOP but you could only order a basic breakfast. So do the math. Also caution to those who think pool is important. The use of the pool is at sister hotels approximately 1/4 mile away -- a long walk for a quick dip.

Staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about the hotel and the waikiki area. We got a package deal which included a car rental and access to a Waikiki trolley. Our package also included half off of parking, only $10 per day. The AC worked well and our room had free internet. The room was a little noisy as we could hear the street below, but Waikiki is a busy place.

I spent an extended weekend at the Ohana Waikiki Malia in November 2010, paying $70 per night plus tax through Priceline.I had had a horrible weekend stay not long before at the Ohana Waikiki West. Although both properties are owned by the Ohana company, the two are like night and day. While the room I got at Ohana Waikiki West was filthy and filled with noise from guests in an adjacent room, the room I had at Ohana Waikiki Malia was spotless and perfectly quiet (it probably helped that the room was adjacent to the waiting area of the elevator landing on my floor, so there was no neighboring hotel room on that side of my Ohana Malia room).Bed was very comfortable. Staff were efficient and professional.Lobby is rather small and plain, and sometimes a bit crowded with guests waiting for taxis.I would be happy to return, even if paying regular rates.
Very centrally located, right next to Duty Free Shop, within walking distance to the beach. Hotel was recently remodelled. Very friendly and helpful staff. Will come back again!

We spent a very pleasant 10 nights here in May. While the hotel does not offer many facilities, you can use the pool & deck at the Ohana Waikiki West, although the beach is not far off. We had requested a room with a king size bed but were advised on checking in that there was none available for the first night but we could be moved the next day by the staff if we would leave our luggage ready to go. The photo only shows part of the room, the closet with the safe and the decent sized, well appointed, bathroom are not in the frame.There is an IHOP restaurant in the building with a Whalers General Store and an ABC store across the street. Staying at an Ohana Hotel gets you free rides on the Pink Line of the Waikiki Trolley, which seems undeservedly very popular. There are many restaurants within a few blocks and shopping areas abound. The main reason to stay here is that you get more than you pay for. The rooms compare with any you would find at a high-end property but at a relatively bargain rate. Good location, quite close to the beach, our room had been recently refurbished, and pleasant, helpful staff. I would certainly stay here again.

Our hotel room was spacious and clean. The front desk staff was very friendly and hospitable. I loved the view from our hotel balcony. I definitely recommend this hotel. It is very affordable and is in the heart of Waikiki.

The room and hotel was nice. Walking distance from the beach and main street in Waikiki. The front-desk staff did not seem knowledgable or have recommendations about restaurants, activities, etc. In fact, they referred me to the activities desk at the Marriott Courtyard across the street.

Good location and nice room for the price. We booked some standard rooms and a 1-bedroom suite (to use as the meeting area). The standard rooms were renovated and the 1-bedroom suite we very old. Luckily, we went downstairs and they let us change the suite to just a standard room, which was enough for us. I like that each room had a small refrigerator for us to store drinks and a small balcony that looks onto the street. The only other down side was the tight parking garage. Luckily we had small cars, but I can't imagine if someone rented a large SUV or van and tried to drive up to the garage.

good service, the room was very big, though no luxury at all. so if you re looking for a room to accomodate your family, this is a goood one.recomended for families included kitchenette and refrigerator,good location

We were so surprised that our room was so great for under $100! Very clean, lots of room and the staff was helpful and friendly. Great, central location on Waikiki. And having free access to the pink trolley was an added bonus. And parking is only $10 for kamaaina rate instead of $20. Will definitely recommend it to friends.

The Malia is a nice little hotel with basic functions for the traveller that doesn't need a lot. It's location is ideal for the The Bus and the Waikiki Trolley and is only a few blocks from the beach. If you are like me and don't spend much time in your hotel, the Malia is a good option. I just needed a place to sleep, wash, and store my clothes that wasn't a total dive. I liked how you needed a key card to get use the elevator. They have a front desk and security men to make their presence known, but that extra bit of security made me feel good - especially since I am a solo female traveler. I was on the 14th floor and the street noise was still pretty loud. I'm the type to find the continuous sounds of the street to be relaxing, but if you need silence, then I'd avoid the city view option. Small complaints: 1. Most of the TV stations were either the 24hr loops of tourist stuff, 24hr news, or in Japanese. That was fine for most of the time, but sometimes I'd want to wind down at night with a good TV show, and I'd have just 3 options on most nights - something on CBS, PBS, and the news. It would have been nice to have more channels. 2. The cleaning staff would get to my room at odd times. Sometimes they'd knock as early as 9 and then other times they'd come as late as 2pm. I'd suggest putting your privacy tag on your door whenever you're in there to avoid random knocking when you're sleeping in or just trying to get out of your swimsuit to get ready for a little shopping. Just don't forget to take it off on the way out. 3. The internet was supposed to be high-speed, but it was very slow for me. I tried to watch Netflix because of complaint #1 and it would stop every 2 minutes and then take almost 10 minutes to reload. I would definitely stay at the Malia again. The hotel is not amazing enough to make me a loyal client, but I'd certainly suggest it to others and/or stay here again, especially if they had the $79/night deal again.

We booked 3 nights here to visit Waikiki. We were not disappointed. Our first night upon checking in however, we were told there were no king beds even though that is what we had requested, and they put us in what seemed like an older wing of the hotel and we were not impressed. The next day, they had a king room for us and we moved over and it was much more to our expectations. The beds were very comfortable, the rooms were standard size and very clean. It was also in a very good location, just a couple blocks from the shops and nightlife, so we were right in the middle of it so we did not need a car. We used the free Pink Line Shuttle our first night to get around, but really didn't need to. We did rent a car from down the street for a day to visit Pearl Harbor and the North Shore. Our only problem was the Internet was not working in the room, and after spending a half hour on the phone with a tech support person, I gave up - I did not want to waste time with it, so that was not good. All in all though, we very much enjoyed the Malia and especially Waikiki and Oahu. We would not hesitate to stay here again, and we hope to definitely get back to Hawaii some day!

Stayed at the Malia for one weekend after having stayed at the Ohana East previous weekend. The front desk staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. This is in contrast to the Ohana East where the front desk staff and the assistant manager were rude, unfriendly and uncaring. I would definitely stay at the Malia again, but never at the East.

My husband and I stayed at the Malia last weekend for three nights.
