The first night we woke up around 1:00 am from people making a huge ruckus in the room above us and they kept going for a long time.... In the morning we went to the front desk asking if we could be moved to another room in case the noise would continue for another night and the staff was very apologetic and moved us to a different floor right away. From then on it was very quiet around us, all we could hear was the road noise but that's hard to get away from in Waikiki... :) The front desk staff was very friendly and extremely helpful! The room was very nice and we had a very comfortable bed.The location is great, lots of restaurants around (IHOP is right next to hotel, we ate breakfast there 3 times in a row). Go to PF Chang's just a few minutes down Lewer St.! Great atmosphere and awesome food! Will stay at Malia again! Thank you!

My wife and I, and another couple just returned from a week in Oahu. We stayed at the Ohana Waikiki Malia, and I was so impressed, that I am doing something I never do, leaving a review. This hotel was suprisingly nice, for the price we paid. It is within walking distance to the beach, and you get free transportation on the Pink Line, with your room key. The staff was unbelievably nice, and friendly. On our last day, our flight did not leave until 9:15 p.m. The staff put our bags in a secure room, after we checked out at noon, so we could go spend our last day at the beach. They even let us use their beach towels. On top of that, they let us use a room when we got back from the beach, to get cleaned up, and change clothes. Very nice. The rooms are small, but very nice. There was even a small balcony on our room. I could her a little bit of noise, later at night, probably as the bars were letting out. We were on the 15th floor, so I would try to get a room up high, or in the rear of the hotel. Even so, we slept very well, and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is very close to many great places to eat, and shopping. We really enjoyed our stay. The staff though, in my opinion, is what makes this hotel great. Keep up the good work.

Having stayed at other Ohana hotels in Waikiki, we knew the expectations for this hotel. We wanted a budget hotel in Waikiki so went back to a Ohana hotel. Good deal at $79/night with free perks such as Pink trolley to Ala Moana Shopping Mall, free internet in room and in the lobby, in-room use of safe, and free 15 minute calls back to Mainland. Check in was fast and we were given a high floor with partial ocean view. Fearing the noise from the busy Kuhio street, we requested a room in the back section of the hotel facing Waikiki beach. It was quiet except for one incident of noisy guests returning to their rooms. Room was small, but clean and cozy. We slept well every night with the comfortable king-size bed. Front counter staff was very friendly and helpful. Short walk to BeachWalk shops and restaurants( and of course the beach). We would definitely stay here again if we decide not to have oceanview and beachfront at our doorsteps.

This was my second time staying at the Ohana Malia and was just as impressed.Hotel is spotlessly clean and staff friendly. The location in Waikiki is perfect, a bit off the main drag but not too far that you can't easily walk to everything. If you plan on sight seeing all the major buses run right past the hotel.The price is reasonable especially for Waikiki. Would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend it to my friends. The only downside is there is no pool on site. But with the beach a short 10 minute walk away you don't really miss it too much

This turned out to be a great choice for our family of four. For a very reasonable price (about $125 per night plus tax paid in advance) we got a modest suite with a living room with TV and two single beds plus a double bedroom. Simple kitchen facilities, a modest bathroom and a balcony. It may have been more motel standard than hotel but to be honest we were hardly in the room. We didn't use the pool at the neighbouring Ohana properties but we did get beach towels to use on the beach which is only two blocks and a 15 minute stroll away. We got free use of the Pink Trolley by showing a room key - make sure you get one for each member of your party.No breakfast provided but there's an IHOP on the premises. It was probably a bit expensive but there was a McDonalds a few yards away and some other local restaurants offering breakfast deals at around $3.99. For dinner there's a massive choice nearby but we used the food court in the Royal Hawaiian centre a few times.There are some questions in earlier reviews about street noise. Our room was on the 7th floor on the corner overlooking Kuhio Avenue and although I 'm reasonably sensitive to noise, we didn't have any problems although, clearly, the road is busy late into the evening. I guess rooms lower down the hotel may be different but my advice is to turn up the aircon to create some white noise to block it out.I expected the criticisms of the car park to be an exaggeration especially when you consider the generous size of the average American parking garage. However, it is definately a tight squeeze and would not be out of place in somewhere like Belgium. The up ramp is steep witha tight left hand turn - quite a worry when driving a rental. The turn into the upper floor is seriously sub-standard. Its not impossible though so take your time. There was an attendant on site all the time. I have no idea how some of teh larger SUVs got in there!Good place to rent a car is Dollar which is a few blocks up Kuhio. You coudl rent at 9am and return by 8pm to avoid teh need to incur overnight parking charges. Otherwise the City Bus is great if a bit slow. We used it to get to Pearl Harbour and Hanuma Bay without any problems and for only $2.50 each - get a transfer to use on the return journey.The City Bus and Pink Trolley go to Ala Moana Mall which has a serious food court and a massive choice of shops.Desk staff were really helpful and booked us a taxi to the Airport on the last day. Taxi costs about same as Shuttle for 4 people ($36).- a bit more with a tip. NB the City Bus would be cheapest but (officially) doesn't allow luggage that can't fit under the seats.All in all this was a great choice. No frills but clean and friendly. Not a premium location but well placed for shops rastaurants and transport links. Remember you're here to spend time on the beach not in the hotel. I couldn't fault it and would stay again in a heartbeat.

In a great location. Blocks from the Beach, Shopping, Eating. Around the corner catch the free trolley. Only complaint was someone smoking was coming in our room in the morning. I don't know why smokers can't read the signs posted every place. No pool but you have the ocean!! We ate breakfast at Mooses, and an Italian place across the street. The staf was very friendly and helpful for places to eat and shop. Great value for those that don't spend all day in their room. The hotel for me is a place to shower and sleep.
We stayed here one night because we didn't realize there wasn't pool. Great location, close to everything. It was clean, inexpensive and convenient.

I agree with many of the other reviewers -- A 3-star level for amenities/features.... but great staff and an outstanding value for its location. If you absolutely MUST be right on the beach or have immediate access to a swimming pool, this isn't the place to be. BUT if you want to save $$$ and don't mind walking (or taking a free trolley) a couple of blocks to the beach or walking 2-3 blocks to one of the other Ohana properties for the pool, this could be the place for you.We actually stayed here at the beginning and end of our trip... the first night was in a room with a connecting door (1407?) and found that the door was not well sound-insulated and let a fair amount of noise through. The last several nights were in a room (1427) that did not have a connecting door and was at the end of the hall -- making it very quiet overall.Pros:- Great price for the location- Clean and well-maintained. We had some trouble with the wired internet connection in our room and they immediately sent their technician up to our room to repair it.- The Waikiki Pink Line Trolley is VERY close by and they provide free access to this trolley by just showing your room keycard. For those that want to get around the local spots in Waikiki, this is a VERY cost effective bonus. We saved big $$ by not having to buy a multi-day trolley pass or have a rental car. The Pink trolley route forms a "figure 8" and the Malia is located near the center -- making it fairly easy to go either direction without too much hassle or delay.- Staff was VERY helpful... we could store our bags after check-out for no charge. And they even let us use one of the rooms to get cleaned up and changed before catching our flight -- more than 7 hours AFTER we had checked out.- Free wired internet in the rooms and free local calls as wellCons:- Not a 4 or 5 star property from an amenities point of view... but we were rarely there anyway. The room was cool, clean, and comfortable and it had a small fridge.... which was basically all we needed.- No pool directly on the property... but they have an agreement with other Ohana properties to allow free use of their pools -- so why pay the price for the higher-end properties when you can walk a couple of blocks and use their pools for less?- A few blocks to the pool... but you can walk it or use the free access to the trolley- The IHOP restaurant directly attached to the restaurant is very $$$ although convenient. We chose to go a 1 block down to a small bar that served great breakfasts starting at $3.95 and grabbed some GREAT steak meals to go from HI Steaks located in the Food Pantry only 4-5 blocks away.... plus there are other restaurants that will give you more experience/quality for your money.

Stayed here twice within the past 6 months. I live on Oahu and need to book a hotel when my woman comes from the mainland. No problems with the room, parking, or service. Room service is what you expect, there is a 24 hour parking attendant and so I have always parked simply and easily. In addition, kamaaina room rate with parking is an excellent deal, best I can find. The location is excellent, at Lewers and Kuhio. While it is not on Kalakaua, it is only a block away and we walk and trolley during most of the stay. This is a primo Waikiki location, which adds to the fun and value. Excellent eats, bars, and convenience stores right at our fingertips.

We stayed for two nights having stayed at an oceanfront hotel for a few nights earlier in the week. What a pleasant surprise. The staff were super friendly and the hotel was clean and comfortable. And what a difference in the price between this hotel which was three blocks from the sea and the oceanfront hotel we stayed in. The hotel does not have a pool but one is able to use the pools at the other two Ohana hotels. The hotel provides towels. If we go back we will definitely stay here again!

The Ohana Malia is truly a sensible choice for the practical traveler. The renovated rooms was nice and clean with a tropical motif and was easy on the budget... more money for shopping! It had all the amenities mentioned in their website. We stayed at the 14th floor supposedly with a seaview but that did not matter much since we were out most of the day. It was surprisingly quiet at night during our five-night stay. When we went back to the hotel each night, there would be a guard on duty just before elevators for security purposes, which was good! The hotel's location is just excellent! A Waikiki Trolley stop is just at the nearby DFS Galleria. ABC stores everywhere. Shops and restaurants all around and the beach is a nice 10-minute stroll along Kalakaua Ave. It was a truly wonderful experience for first time visitors like us! We hope to be back real soon!

The staff was super friendly and very helpful with tips on where to eat . They were very clean and it was very conveniently located. I was pleased with the price and location. I just wish they had pillowtop matresses or a chioce of beds,that is my only complaint.

Nice place - the rooms were well appointed and clean. I was on the 6th floor, facing south (I think). The bed was new and I slept like a rock. I liked the security setup of needing to swipe your room key in the elevator to get to the guest rooms - felt very safe there.I had little interaction with the staff other than checkin, but even then they were very friendly. The location cant be beat - its only a 5 minute walk to Kalakaua Ave and maybe 10-15 to Kuhio Beach Park. Lots of places to eat very close by (besides the iHop next door - very pricey).Even though the place was selected for me as it was an aircrew layover, I would definitely bring my wife and daughter and stay here on my own dime. Yes, there was street noise, but I sleep well with white noise. Plus, it was nice to sleep with the sliding lanai door open.

From entering until we left it was great all around!We've stayed here a couple of times before && each time its been the same.Wonderful employees with great hearts.We had some trouble with the AC when we got in && they sent maintenance up in less than 5 minutes. Location is great for everyone, eateries all around && nightlife(bars/clubs) only a block away. Shopping right nextdoor. My favorite part was that iHOP was right in the lobby.The thing i liked the least was that I couldn't stay longer!GREAT CHOICE FOR A HOTEL!
Great location and great price. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. I will be going back in July with the entire family.

The Malia is really only a three star hotel in terms of features and amenities, but it fully earns all three stars. We had a room facing Kuhio Ave, and there was quite a lot of street noise at night. Obviously there isn't too much the hotel can do about this, and it probably isn't any better at the other Waikiki hotels either, but it was a factor. We found customer service to be very good everywhere we went on Oahu, and the Malia was no exception, they have first rate, friendly staff. The rooms weren't fancy but they were clean, comfortable, and had the look of having been recently renovated.

Since we were only in town for two nights and not a week's vacation, the Ohana Malia worked just fine for us. Much of this hotel's clientele is composed of Japanese nationals, and as we arrived the night after the earthquake and tsunami, the staff was scrambling to accomodate people who were staying longer, and figure out who was cancelling their plans from Japan. In spite of this, the staff was pleasant and cheerful.I would characterize this hotel as a place to sleep. The lobby is small, the decor in our room straight out of the 70's, and there is no pool. It's not a place where you might want to just hang out. The location is good (if you like the Waikiki area), only about four or five easy blocks to the beach. Since Waikiki is a lot like Las Vegas, there was noise outside much of the night - our bedroom on the eighth floor seemed like it was on the first floor.The price for the room was reasonable considering the location. You could easily pay 2-3 times more at nearby hotels. Be advised though, that this is not a resort experience.

We stayed here 8 nights and enjoyed every minute. We have been to Waikiki 10 times now .... the Malia has been the best hotel for the money. During the tsunami the were very professional. There was always someone at the front desk to help you and always with a smile. Parking was a challenge ... so make sure you get a small car. I would highly recommend this hotel for all! Great Staff and Great house keeping, Great rooms you can't go wrong.

We stayed one night after flying back from Maui and not flying home until the next day. Great location, only a couple of blocks from beach and all of Wikiki's shoping and restaurants. Before traveling to Maui we stayed right on Wikiki Beach at a very expensive hotel. If I had to do over I would stay at the Ohana instead. Bigger room, only a couple blocks from the pricey hotel, no resort fee, and half the price. Great rate if you book hotel and car and parking is half the price. Cha Cha Cha restaurant is right around the corner. Delicious and huge nachos and $2.50 margaritas during happy hour. Also $1 tacos on Tuesday late night. Yum!

The pictures on the hotel's website are very misleading! We booked a room with two double beds. Our room was incredibly small, had a small bathroom, and had two TWIN beds instead of full/Queen beds (as shown on website). We booked an internet special that was $89 and included free parking. The hotel honored the rate but did not honor the free parking. We ended up spending $20 a day to park in a very tight parking garage! Very disappointing! Front desk staff was not very accomodating and acted like we weren't very important to them. I travel a lot for business and stay in many hotels and will NEVER stay in this hotel or recommend this hotel to anyone. Pay the extra money and stay elsewhere!

I stayed at this hotel with a mate and overall hotel was good value for our money. Clean room and comfy bed. Bathroom was a bit small but we only needed a place to sleep because we were out most of the time. Overall we had an enjoyable stay!!

This was the first time that I stayed at this hotel. I have been to hawaii numerous times and always stayed at the doubletree or hilton hotels. This hotel was just as good as the brand name hotels, I always felt that I had to stay at brand name hotels to get the quality I needed but this isnt the case with the Malia I absolutely love it and will stay again. The hotel was very clean and they just did remodeling. They dont have a pool but who cares the beach is a couple of blocks away with all the water you need. They provide towels you can take to the beach everyday. The staff was awesome the location is awesome and the bonus is their Pink free shuttle that takes you all the way down to the hilton and the ala moana shopping ctr and around waikiki, the money I saved on cabs was great. I want to take time out to thank the staff, So'otaga and Alvina for there kindness. Across the street is a italian restaurant called Spada that was great. They also have abc stores close to the hotel and right next door was IHOP. I am thinking of going back in April or May and I will stay at this hotel. Their rates are very good and you will not be disappointed like I said hawaii is my home away from home and I have stayed at many hotels like the hilton and doubletree and paid rates up to 250 per night which was riducolous I recommend this hotel and rate it 4 stars plus.

our room was comfortable. it came with hairdryer ,iron/board coffee/tea making small bar fridge, TV ,aircon,soap shampoo/conditioner and body lotion,free local calls plus free upto 15mins to the US. the heavy lined curtains kept the sun out in the early morning letting us to sleep in and relax.the staff were very pleasant and only to happy to help with any question.an additional bonus was the free trolley pass on the pink line.the hotel runs along the street behind the main so its a short walk to anywhere you would like to go in waikiki.if i were to travel back to waikiki i would stay there again.

The hotel, although a bit aged, has updated rooms (at least in the tower. I wouldn't recommend the more expensive "mini suites"), great toiletries and the in-room fridge is a huge help. The location is excellent, though it's not on the beach but for the price it's well worth it. Service was absolutely 5-star, and the room was cleaned spotless each day. If you bring a car, beware of the garage. Anything larger than a Camry will be very difficult to park and even more difficult to exit, but even at $20 a day it's not too bad and the security in both the garage and hotel are excellent. The few weak points, as others pointed out, were the beds. They are very hard and the doubles are not queens but actual doubles but by the fourth night I was getting used to them. Also the sliding glass doors are single pane and let in a lot of noise, especially at 3 am when the nearby bars close. However, these deficiencies were very minor and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Our room had a rancid smell that did not clear even when we kept all the doors open. We switched to another room for the last night and the odor was somewhat better, but the room was dirty. We wrote to Customer Service but never received a response. We would not stay here again.

Renovations? What renovations? We stayed for 7 days and it was another typicial out of date hotel in Waikiki. We rented a kitchenette suite, which is great when you have kids, fill the fridge with snacks and drinks and save in the restaurants later. The hotel might have been renovated but we didn't see it. Our room was out of date, loud at night ( Faced Royal Hawaiian Ave ) Asked for a Queen Bed Kitchenette with pull out couch, got a 2 single bed kitchenette with 2 single bed couch like kitchenette room, changed rooms to a Queen Bed Kitchenette with 2 single bed couch like bed. Rooms were old, black dust like mold on the ceiling from the A/C, Kitchenette was best part, cold fridges = COLD BEER, coffee maker, microwave and all the essentials ( Plates, cutlery, utensils, etc.)If you rent a car and need to park it at the hotel, $20.00 per day to park at the hotel a little steep for very tight parking and no space to move, IHOP downstairs definately helps with the late night hunger, no wireless in the rooms only in lobby. Wired Internet in rooms but no desk or table to sit at, extended wire to edge of couch. Location is great, next to Mcdonalds, ABC Stores, DFS Galleria and trolley transit. 10 mins or less walk from anything ( beach, market, restaurants, shopping ) Your not in Waikiki for the hotels....Please update and modernize this hotel ASAP and you will get my business again.

Apparently this hotel is in the midst of renovations. We managed to snag a renoed room and couldn't have been happier after the dump we stayed in our first night in Waikiki.I'd stayed here years ago when it was an Outrigger and it seems to be marketing itself more to the Japanese tourists these days but thats a good thing. They won't put up with substandard accommodations. If a hotel isn't in the Japanese guidebook, there's a reason for it. (and this one was in it)Clean! A Great shower, fridge, free coffee in the am in our room, and though the IHOP downstairs was a little frantic the day we visited, I can't think of a single big negative. The front desk staff are, for the most part, friendly and willing to assist.Our room was on a higher floor facing Kuhio - be warned that Kuhio is VERY noisy, especially on weekends. Even with the door shut and locked, we could hear the partiers screaming through the night. We were told on check-in that we could pay $20 for a city view room which would have (I assume) taken care of the noise problem, but I just put my ear plugs in.We booked online and got a rate of about 110.00 per night and based on what I saw at other hotels, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again - as long as it was in a renovated room.
The hotel was newly remodeled, good price for the location. The staff is very helpful. Within 2 blocks of upper class shopping!!!

Hotel was recommended to us by a friend who lives in Oahu. It was perfect for us, a retired couple. Warm welcome, and always a smile when we entered the building. The housekeeping lady was perfect. We stayed for a week, and we enjoyed returning each night from our walks or tours. We stayed on the 16th floor, and it was relatively quiet (we live on a farm.). We kept our patio door open a bit for fresh air. We didn't need a pool. We enjoyed our walks in the sunshine to the beach, especially sitting on the bench behind the army museum. The reception desk told me how to print my boarding pass for free on the computer downstairs. Otherwise, there is a fee for using that computer. We liked the free pink shuttle. "The Bus" was very accessible, & we used it to visit the punchbowl cemetery and the Arizona Memorial & Missouri. If we return to Honolulu, we will stay here, and we will use "TheBus" more! We ate breakfast at Denny's, and it was good. Enjoyed pineapple sorbet $2 at a small place near Trumps called Henry's. Yum. Good place to eat on the beach is Shorebird Beach Broiler. (Sunset special $14.95 all you can eat salad bar, and you grill your own sirloin steak.) This hotel has a great location, where you can access restaurants by walking. Also ABC's on every corner, where you can buy pineapple packets and put them in your refrigerator for snacking.
This hotel was great!! Staff was very pleasant and accommodating. Clean, good location Reasonable rates. Will definitely stay here again. Would recommend this hotel to friends. Judy

Hotel is in a good location for the value. They are only a few blocks from the beach and they have a free buss for guests that takes you around the city. The staff is very helpful and kind (or is this just Hawaiians). No it's this staff. The rooms are clean and well maintained. If I had only one suggestion it would be to put a chair on the balcony.

The rooms were beautiful and clean. We needed a couple of night's at the last minute. Ohana Waikiki Malia were so nice to us, we were not expecting a view of the ocean but we got one. We were having a wonderful time and didn't want anything to spoil it. It was our first time to Haiwaii. The I-Hop downstairs was convieniant, the pancakes were delicious we ate there everday. The location is in the middle of everything and walking distance to the beach is minutes. Laundry ficilities were available and very clean. The staff and concierge were very helpful. Thank You! We will definately stay again, we feel at home there. I'll definately tell my flying partners about Ohana Waikiki Malia. Debbie Kucera..United Flight Attendant.

We have stayed at many, many hotels across the U.S. and I have to say that the service at the Ohana Malia is , bar none, the best ever. The price is excellent, the rooms, housekeeping, location, and everything was top notch.The concierge service was top notch for arranging tours, sights, dining, shopping, etc. I agree with James Harper "Roy Rocks".

VERY friendkly, clean, well located, facilitydidn't realize they didn't have a pool -- my fault! (facilities available at ohana east and west hotels)nice small balconies, but no chairs on same to enjoy sun nor viewrates on web site can accommodate any price range and qualifying discount.waikiki shuttle (free pass from hotel) to ala moana shopping centre, plus the bus transit system stops in front of hotel with connections anywhere on the island!lots of food outlets in area and in the heart of the shopping area.

I just returned from a great holiday with my folks. Mom booked the hotel, and did she choose well! Great location, immaculately clean, and the staff was exceptional. Roy and everyone at the front desk were the best. I've never had someone call me by name in a hotel before! And there's a great desk for booking tours, which I highly recommend. Traffic in Honolulu is challenging. Skip renting a car, book a tour, and enjoy!Mahalo, Roy and all at the Ohana Waikiki Malia!

Reserved online for 90 dollars, just a few blocks from the beach. Right next to all the bars. Very good customer service, the front desk booked us a shuttle to the airport even though we didn't have reservations. Our room was clean and quite large for the price, nice little lanai overlooking the city.

Been to most of the 4-5 stars hotels in Waikiki but this hotel is one of my favorites simply because of the cleanliness and the friendliness of the staff. For the price I paid, I didn't expect a great view but surprisingly had the some ocean view and the the Hilton fireworks. My family had an amazing time. I would rather stay here. Can't wait to stay here again!

Great staff. Great management! Clean and modern. No need for bells and whistles, beach minutes away, restaurants minutes away (affordable and trendy).Safe location, walking to and from beach, shopping and dining.

Staff knew our name and always gave a friendly greeting. We found Malia to be a quality, secure,clean and quiet hotel in a most convenient location with spacious rooms at reasonable rates.We enjoyed the staff's friendly ideas and suggestions that enabled us to maximize our enjoyment of Ohau. They identified favorite Hawaiian performers, events, times and places for our pleasure Malia had special touches such as; daily fresh flowers for the ladies, free phone calling and free transportation on the Pink Line. Room amentities were complete and even included a desk, refrigerator, iron and board, hair dryer and coffee

Stayed here with my boyfriend for three nights during my first time on Oahu and then again for two nights after a few days in Kauai. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Location is great, two blocks from Waikiki Beach, plenty of shopping and restaurants. I felt very safe when I came in late at night with the security checking everyone for room keys. They provide beach towels. Clean room with a nice lanai (balcony) and simple but beautiful furniture. They have 24 hr parking for $18 behind the hotel. No pool but you can walk a few blocks if you want to another Ohana location (though why would you want to go to a pool when Waikiki in around the corner). No complaints! Will definitely stay here again on my next trip to Honolulu. Overall a great experience.
user_name:
Lita505
New York City, New York

review_body: This place is not fancy, but you can score some great deals on their website. We got a rate at least $20 less than comparable hotels in Waikiki. It was clean and they give a Kamaaina deal for parking (half price).

The people where friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The room was large, clean and had everything one needed inclusive of a working internet connection.The hotel is right on a bus stop with buses going in 20 or more directions. I like extra coffee .... I ask for it ... I got it. The little balcony ... which allowed me to open the door, feel the air and look over to the ocean, was great. I met a runner there from Switzerland, he is coming to the Malia for the past 12 years. The room had a good size fridge .... no micro or toasterif that was in place .... I move in tomorrow. UR, VT

I am a skeptical type, unless I can see, hear and feel tangible good thing then it will settled. I was treated as a family member at the Ohana Waikiki Malia for five nights, and I am grateful. The room was clean and tidy. The service was excellent. the location was very convenient. And above all the front desk staff members are willing to help whenever you need anything. In addition, I was given half hour free complimentary refreshment because my flight back to the main land was at night and I have already checked out lunchtime.Kudos to the Ohana Waikiki Malia staff members!

Just got back from the Ohana Waikiki Malia. I have stayed at other Ohana/Outrigger hotels and the Malia is on par with them. My room was clean and nicely decorated. We were on the 12th floor facing Kuhio so there was some street noise but not enough that we couldn't sleep and you eventually get used to it.Staff was friendly and when we had questions they did their best to help. Location was great, right in the middle of Waikiki but far enough away from the crowds.I would not hesitate to stay at the Malia again

I have stayed at this hotel before in the Suites, but not in the Towers. I do not like the suites at all, it is 'smelly' and not too nice. The Towers section is better and much cleaner, I would stay in the Towers again recommend this section, but not the Suites.Frequent Traveler

We stayed 4 night and found this property to be very good. Our decision to stay here was based on a special rate and was one of the nicer hotels we stayed at in Waikiki. Good location. Good service and very friendly staff. Good size rooms, very small bathroom, but the location and price made up for it. Coffee maker and mini fridge in the room. Limited tv channels. Free internet (high speed) Free 'entry' on the pink line shopping trolley to Ala Moana shopping mall. We will stay at the Ohana Waikiki Malia every time we visit Waikiki.
Friendly, professional front desk staff. The rooms was perfect and clean. I would highly recommend this hotel, the price is right. I will definitely stay here again!!!

This was our first trip to Hawaii and we booked this hotel on line not really knowing what we were going to get. We found the hotel to be absolutely wonderful. It was clean, well maintained, the staff was friendly and helpful and most of all the price was extremely affordable. I plan on re-visiting Hawaii and would highly reommend this hotel to anyone planning to go. Additionally, it is close (walking distance) to the beach and all kinds of shopping, restaurants, etc. Great Hotel!

i had a kitchenette but it had no microwave. lots of noise but this is a city afterall. staff was friendly , room was kept clean. 1 lamp in the living room didnt work and one was broken in the bedroom. sometimes i got towels in the kitchen and sometimes i didnot. selection of tv stations was terrible. ive stayed at all 4 Ohana hotels in waikiki...the east is the best for room quality , service and location. this was the best price , i tried it but dont think i'd return.

There is nothing I can say about this Hotel except that it is great! It is centrally located just a few blocks from the beach and right on the bus line. All who stay there can travel FREE on the Pink Line which takes you all over Waikiki beach area and out to Ala Moana Mall. Also, you can hotel beach towels at no cost, so you don't have to lose valuable luggage space. The housekeeping people are wonderful and do everything they can to make your stay there a very pleasant experience. The online pictures are all correct - not doctored as some hotels have done ... what you see is what you get.

Our trip was essentially a week in Kauai, but due to flight times and traveling with parents, we decided to stay one night before Kauai, and a night after our week there. On both nights we were greeted politely, and given rooms in the tower with interior hallways (they have a building with exterior hallways, which I suspect is the older section). The tower we stayed in was newly rennovated and if you look at the pictures on their website, it looks EXACTLY as it is depicted. The counter tops in the bathroom and the little reception area is granite. There was a small coffee pot and a small refrigerator for our use. Computer ethernet was free without hassles of using their password to get on. Our first night there we were on the street side, but the downside of being in the middle of Waikiki is the street noise on a Friday night. We were exhausted by the end of the day, so once we fell asleep, it wasn't a problem. The beds are very comfortable. We had time to walk Waikiki, see most within walking distance and sample a restaurant down the street. It was raining hard when we checked in, and they provided umbrellas for us upon request. My Dad is retired from the Military and we were given a 50% discount on the parking, from $18 to $9, once he showed us his card. The parking garage was an interesting joy ride going up or down since it was on a very steep grade, and very hard to maneuver due to small spaces. My only complaint was the impersonal female desk clerk when we checked out. I wanted to make sure the parking was charged correctly, and she gave me a strange look. Then she proceeded to check us out without making further eye contact. On our return trip back, we were given the same warm reception both at the beginning and the at check out. This time we had a distant ocean view, the noise level was about the same. Oh, one last thing. We had decided on our second night to take the breakfast package for the attached IHOP - an additional $20 per room. The wait was long, and we were not given a choice from the menu: eggs, pancakes or toast, sausage or bacon and coffee. Juice is an additional charge and there are no substitutions. A better deal was the restaurant down the street where we could have gotten the same breakfast for $3.99. We had sampled their dinner special (steak and fish) for $9.99, and it was decent. I would have rather sampled their breakfast there instead. The food at IHOP was good and the waitress we had tried to please. Overall, we would stay there again any time we stop on Oahu! We even loved the little touch of giving a small beach bag - which we did use to carry all of our suntan products to the beach!

I got this hotel on special hence why I stayed there. We had a room facing toward the street on the 5th floor and you could hear the noise so loud that you could barely get to sleep. We were upgraded which was a plus but we had 2 single beds in the bedroom and 2 in the living room. Things were out dated I mean the tv was older than I am and I am rocking the big 30...lol Staff were friendly, only stayed 2 nights. So if you are staying for a couple of nights on a budget then this would be great otherwise, find something else! The noise level is not worth the money being paid.

Bad service, the person that helped us at check in seemed stoned. Room was dirty, hair on the shower wall, cigarette burns on the sheet covers. Oh and you can forget about calling ahead to get simple questions answered. I asked how much parking was they told me $14 a day, I also asked if they had wireless internet, they say yes we do. Well when I showed up I was charged $18 for parking and wireless internet is only in the lobby. Also when I asked the on the phone if a late check out was possible they told me yes if the room isn't booked for that day. Well come to find out again they want $10 per hour per room just to keep your luggage in there. So please be advised if you do go to this hotel don't call just assume the worst. Sleep wise it was noisy and I was in room 605.

I was there on business but took a couple of personal days before meetings, business hotel was at Hyatt Regency and I stayed at Ohana Malia for the personal days. Once we moved to Hyatt - I would have rather stayed at Malia. The staff were friendlier, nicer - they gave us a free beach bag when we checked in, helped us with directions etc. Hyatt staff were rude, not helpful and acted like they were being bothered by us. Next time we will stay at Ohana the entire time regardless of company paying or not! Also, internet was FREE and we had to pay at Hyatt!!

When I arrived on Oahu, I took a city bus to Lewars and Kuhio, across the street from the Malia. It was $2.50 for an adult. You need to have a small carryon suitcase that fits under your seat, otherwise you need to take a shuttle bus service.  I stayed at the ohana Malia for one night before moving to a larger hotel for a high school reunion. This hotel is located in the middle of Waikiki. It is an easy walk to the newly developed Beachwalk, as well as close to the old International Market Place. My room was ready when I checked in at 1pm. My room was very clean and modern, newly renovated. There was a small balcony, two chairs and a table, a desk with a big flat screen TV, as well as an iron and ironing board and a safe in the closet. They also provided a small cofffee maker and coffee and tea plus a small refridgerator to store food/drinks. the internet connection was free.I picked up my beach towel at reception and headed out the door to one of the sister hotels with a pool. It was only a 3 block walk. After spending the afternoon at the pool and having a maitai at the pool bar, I walked back to the Malia, stopping for a plate lunch of Terriaki steak to bring back to my room. Since i was tired from the flight, I took a shower, ( hot water, strong shower, nice soaps and shampoo), ate my plate lunch, watched a bit of TV, (many chanels),and called it a night at 8pm.The Ohana Malia is a place I can recommend for anyone. It is clean, recently remodeled, has friendly staff and is in the middle of Waikiki, making it easy to walk everywhere. If you prefer, you can also ride the pink Waikiki shuttle for free, just show them your room key.

Unfortunately, only stayed one night for a stop over before returning to Australia. Would recommend this hotel. Friendly helpful staff and clean neat rooms, Basic in room facilities, but great for the price. Would go back if we visited Honolullu again.

I travel for business to Hawaii for business several times a year and my company provides the room and transportation. This trip was on us and the $79/Standard room rate that we got here was well worth it. The hotel is in a perfect location - right in the heart of Waikiki. We had the use of 3 pools from sister hotels since this location doesn't have one. We swam in the ocean - since that is why we went there! Plenty of places to eat - we also had a few snacks on hand in our rooms refrigertor. The room was very comfortable and met our needs perfectly. The beds are very comfortable, flat screen TV very cleen! The front desk clerk Roy, who checked us in seemed to always be there. He was so helpful and very sweet. All the employees were very friendly and nice - always a warm smile and Aloha for us. We are a little adventureous, so we took the city bus to/from the airport (bus #20) dropped us off a few steps from the hotels' front door - and only cost our family of 4 $7.50 - that beats the $40 a car service/taxi will charge you) We also took the bus out to Pearl Harbor - that bus stop is right across the street from the hotel and a number of buses will take you there!! We will return to this location. Aloha and Mahalo :)

We (my husband, granddaughter 11, grandson 4) throughly enjoyed our stay. I was a bit hesitate when I read some of the reviews about the Ohana Waikiki Malia, but praise God our room was newly renovated and well designed; I liked the 1/3 size balcony which allowed us to step out and take in the view, but inside the room the other 2/3 created an alcove for a table and chairs. The smaller balcony provided a very spacious room for the four of us. Another GREAT feature the hotel provided pink line trolley service on two of the main streets of Waikiki and into Ala Moana Shopping Center. With a 4 yr old this came in handy and enabled us to visit the Waikiki Aquarium and Honolulu Zoo.

Stopped 9 nights,good hotel in great location, hotel clean with room done every day, friendly staff who help with any enquiry/problem. close to transport (free bus trolley travel with room key), centre of Waikiki. free internet access in room, recommend stopping there.

We arrived late at night and although they had no record of our reservation we had made online at a special price, they took care of us quite efficiently. The room was great, roomy, clean with a refrigerator and free wired (they supply wire) internet. We had an ocean view room on the 17th floor. (The elevators can be very slow during peak times). The hotel is around the corner from the high end shopping and 15 minutes to Waikiki beach. We chose to go to a less populated beach on the other side of the island. There is no pool on this site, but they do furnish beach towels at the front desk and a flower for your hair in the morning. There is an iHop restaurant above the lobby and parking is reasonable ($18. per day). The area was a little sad at night with the street walkers parading the block in front of the hotel.

After living in Honolulu from 1967-1970 and coming back three times in the past ten years (and staying in 3 different hotels) my husband and I would definitely stay here again. The location was perfect, the price fantastic and the hotel beyond clean! The room was a mini suite and all for $79 per night! The only problem is the parking garage, not is it $18 per night it's a driving nightmare. Definitely not designed for anything larger than a compact car!

We have stayed there more than once. In the past, it was only once that the room was so-so. This time, the hotel had been renovated and the room was fantastic. The cleanliness and the service was outstanding. The front desk staff were incredible, friendly and helpfull. we wish to thank them all. The location was perfect.

My wife and I just stayed over the Labor Day weekend and we enjoyed our stay. The rates are good for kamaaina and the rooms were great. Not overly noisy being on Kuhio but just right in many ways. However, upon checkout I did not realize when booking my reservation that I had booked a kamaaina rate without the free parking. Apparently there is a kamaaina rate with free parking and a kamaaina rate without free parking. I was unaware of this. I assumed that any kamaaina booking automatically included the free parking. Not to go on and on but be aware of this as I was not. I would like to specifically thank Alvinia, who I believe was the front desk mgr, for helping me to resolve this issue. Mahalo nui.

For the price, this hotel is amazing. The rooms are newly remodeled and was big enough for two though the bathroom is painfully small. The staff is friendly and was always willing to help out. though the sheets on the bed were not changed at any time during our 10 day stay there. I'm sure that they would have been if we had asked, however. It is in easy walking distance to just about everything in Waikiki. Parking is a nightmare, though. The garage is tiny and the ramps are a VERY tight fit. While there is wired internet connection in the room, there is no Wi-Fi in rooms.

The Ohana Malia doesn't try to be something it is not. This is a great value for the money, extremely clean since the remodel, the staff is friendly and the location is in walking distance to everything in Waikiki. If you want a high-end touristy hotel right on the beach, go spend another $100-$200 more dollars a night and stay there. For a value-based traveler not into spending on the tourist scene, this is a great hotel. It's perfect for a few days to have a base in Waikiki while you go enjoy the amenities of the other resorts nearby. Yeah, the rooms are a bit noisy in the morning due to the thin windows, but easily overlooked with the air conditioning fan on. The best inexpensive, and local, bars and restaurants are within 5-10 minutes walking along Kuhio Ave. The high-end shopping and beach are 1-2 blocks away (just 5 minute walk).

I read an article about this hotel in the SF Chronicle about good summer deals and booked it for the first half of our trip. This hotel has been beautiful remodeled and the rooms were fantastic. We were near the street, so it was a bit noisy the first night, but that's because we wanted to leave the windows open instead of turning on the AC. The location was perfect, right in the heart of everything, and the staff were so warm and welcoming. For the second half of our trip, friends of ours made reseavations at a fancy hotel down the street, the old "W" hotel. But I have to say that I actually much preferred this hotel. It was a better location, comfortable and spacious room, and a fraction of the cost!

Hi All,I had an 8 hour layover in Hawaii and decided to kayak at Waikiki (awesome-ness!) and when I got back to the airport, I found out they overbooked my flight. They comp'd me but I had to find my own hotel. Basically, I had one night to ball in Hawaii and I wanted to do a nice hotel and not stay in a hostel or anything but I didn't want to spend a fortune on a hotel. I ended up spending like 3 hrs at the airport trying to find the cheapest, nicest hotel which was closest to Waikiki beach. This was it. I found a good rate for like $70 something and with the taxes, it was a little under $100. I booked it for the same day (and they totally accomodated and didn't give me any fuss) got there and it was SO nice. Everything was clean and I had a small terrace overlooking the city (gorgeous). Also, when I checked out the next day (check out is at noon--I didn't even know hotels had that late of a checkout), I could keep my luggage with them while I went and parasailed & surfed. I wasn't even staying the next night! And they didn't charge me a dime for this. Furthermore, when I got back from surfing, I looked like a train-wreck and the staff let me use a "hospitality room" where I could shower and change before my flight at 10 pm. WHO DOES THIS?! It was like kindness out of their hearts. When I go back to Hawaii and do it the right way, I'll def be staying at this hotel!! Oh yeah, and the staff helped me get to the airport in the least amount of time so I wouldn't miss my flight.

We stayed at this hotel 5 years ago and found it to be acceptaible considering the amount of time you spend in the room. We just got back from our stay and the room was damp and smelled like mildew. We turned the air down thinking it would dry it out and the smell would go away but it stayed that way. The noise from the outside radiated in our room also. We could hear people talking out side and we were on the 5th floor. Will NEVER stay there again and will not recommend to anyone I know despite the location being very central. Disappointed to say the least!

Great Location. recently remodeled rooms . Parking can be a problem if you arrive late. Valet parking is $30.00 self park is $18.00 if you arrive late and can't find a parking stall, they will valet your car at no additional charge. since they have to double park it. The bad thing is instead of retrieving car the next day they had you the keys and tell you what floor its on. The good thing is the parking garage is small if enough to hunt it down. Location again is great. IHOP downstairs in lobby and other food and shopping right across the street on Lewer's street. Great location and cost was great if you just need a place to shower and sleep.free high speed internet in lobby only.

Beyond the low rates and exceptional service, the staff at the Malia hosted us with the utmost care and respect. Reasonable parking rates, solid location, and an extremely helpful staff combine to make a truly enjoyable experience. Highly recommended for locals searching for a waikiki getaway. Lastly, the hotel is safe and within a convenient walking distance of Kalakaua ave.

Stay here! Great rooms, Great Service, Great Location (1 1/2 block from Waikiki Beach)Staff goes out of their way to be friendly and helpful. They are laughing and smiling even when they pick up the phone for questions. Nice new rooms, very clean. We had city side so its a little noisy even on the 14th floor but with the air on no prob sleeping at all.Clean, friendly and we got the summer value price of $79=$90 after fees and tax per night. No one even comes close to this in Honolulu on Waikiki. I was skeptical booking based on the couple of crappy reviews I read before booking but I am glad we came here. This was so awesome and easy and friendly. They put their effort into making the visit great for everyone. No pool on site but just a breeze to use any of three sister Ohana hotel pools within easy walking distance of 2 -3 blocks. This is the place I will return to for the value, rooms and people! Enjoy

In terms of room cleanliness and service staff helpfulness and friendliness, I give both thumbs up. My overall experience staying in the hotel was great. I think one must be aware of what are the available amenities provided by the hotel first, before doing the booking.I will tell prospective bookers that:1. The hotel's carpark is limited and cramped, although the carparking attendant is doing their level best to make the overall experience as pleasant as possible, given the physical contraints imposed by the carpark design and space. They do valet parking to minimise inconvenience.2. There is no swimming pool situated at the hotel, but hotel guests can make use of pools from its sister hotel (Ohana East or West). Just need to have a 5 minutes walk to enjoy the pool.3. There is no gym, but Waikiki is great for outdoor activities and jogging, so its not a big deal.4. There is no restaurant although there is an IHOP just next to it, as well as many other eateries situated nearby along Waikiki.5. The "high-speed" in-room wired broadband is free to hotel guests, but the speed is dependent on the number of users, i.e. the more users there are, the slower the connection speed will be. But one can still access the internet. Besides that, there is free WiFi access at the lobby for hotel guests to use.6. The hotel provides 15 minutes free outgoing calls to anywhere in CONUS (inclusive of Hawaii) and Canada, which I thought is great.7. There is adequate security at the hotel, especially in the late hours. A security guard will check for hotel guests' key card to validate, and the lifts to the hotel rooms require the key card to activate and use.8. The lifts can be a tad slow (in terms of waiting time) at times, especially if there are a lot of guests staying at the hotel. They are probably the most abused and used equipment in the hotel.All in all, I am glad to have stayed at the Ohana Malia. Yes, its not a 4 star hotel but it provides a clean and friendly place to stay. I will certainly go back to the Ohana Malia to stay again when I next visit Hawaii.

A friendly welcome and a clean and tidy room. We had a huge king size bed (super soft sheets), desk, table and chairs, kitchenette with tea coffee and fridge. Bathroom included bath, great shower. Staff friendly and helpful. IHOP downstairs always seemed popular although we didn't use it. Short 1 block walk to main Waikiki street. Hotel is on the Pink line (that goes to Ala Moana Mall) trolley route (stops just outside, as does the free shuttle to Hilo Hatties) and the bonus is that your room key is your free pass on the trolley - saving you $2 each per trip. Two easy blocks to the beach, plenty of restaurants, many ABC stores, Starbucks etc nearby. Free internet in the room. Theres no pool (who needs it when you have the fabulous beach) and beach towels are provided for use by front desk- free. We live on a farm so the street noise was a bit much for us in our first room on, so we asked if we could move further from the street - no problem at all - the staff moved our bags for us while we were out and the move was perfect. We got engaged while there and think we may well be honeymooning back at this hotel.

I thought thise would be a great place considering it had been newly remodeled. Well, if you want the newly remodeled wing youʻll be paying out of your ears. It was noisy. Very dated. No wifi. I could hear the people in the next room. It was an awful experience. The hotelshould be ashamed. They should call it, "ROACHʻtel".

I would not recommend this hotel for a business or leisure traveler who travels often. The rooms are noisy--I could hear the street-life, the guy snoring next door, and a dripping/running toilet. I received a tiny room with two single beds and felt like I was visiting a relative. If you just need a clean place to crash, go for it. If you are looking for a little luxury, do yourself a favor and look for a Sheraton or other chain hotel where you know what you are getting for your money. I checked out early and really enjoyed the rest of my stay in Oahu.

I read the reviews and they were pretty good and accurate. The room was spacious and I had an ocean view. I did not hear any noise at all from other guest. The bathroom was a nice size. Thoe hotel was right in the middle of everything. We had access to the pink trolley and the bus system. We use the bus to go to Pearl Harbor and Dole Plantation. We use the green trolley for Diamond Head as a tour and transportation. Hawaii is every thing and more and my stay here made my vacation even better. Also, the hotel had great security.

We stayed at Ohana Waikiki Malia for one night prior to moving into a pre-booked condo. Our booking was done directly through the hotel website where we could specify room type and the fact we would have a late arrival (after 11 pm). Everything was confirmed by return email, so we didn't have to call the hotel directly to inform them of the late check-in. We got a refurbished room that was spacious and clean with a small lanai that looked out onto Kuhio. There was a small refrigerator, coffee maker, fixings for tea and coffee and a standard in-room safe. Front desk staff was courteous and friendly and, despite the hour, handled our check-in quickly and efficiently. This is a basic, no frills hotel (not a luxury hotel), but if all you want is a clean, safe, centrally located hotel at a good price, then this is it. All in all a nice hotel in a convenient, central Waikiki area.

Great location: walking distance to the beach and restaurants, bus stop in front of hotel. Large and refurbished rooms with great urban views. Friendly and helpful staff. Overall good value for money.

During my stay my boyfriend and i stayed in the one bedroom suite. I was told these rooms have not been renovated yet, and boy could i tell. We found a used towel in the bathroom that one of the cleaners must of forgot, the tv looked like it was from the 50's and there was about only 5 channels on there. There's not even a pool, there's a couple other ohana hotels that you can walk to and swim in theres, but dont let them fool you the oahna malia has no pool, jacuzzi. The one thing that ticked us off the most was the parking lot. This is the most ridiculous, dumbest parking lot i have ever in my life seen! i was scared to drive up it, and down it. Its steep, and not wide enough to even fit a car, you can see on the walls how many people have banged it. Everytime i had to reverse so i could make the turn. Let alone i had to go up so many levels because there was no parking on the first 3 floors. If you have a middle sized car or a van or truck, FORGET IT! i came so close to banging the wall everytime i went in or out. Another thing that i disliked was the security. During the night time, there would be a security guard having to check our ID's and asking what room were in. I just wanted to go up to my OWN room that i payed for withoug feeling like im being accused of something. Let alone how rude and grouchy the security was.If you are staying here i suggest the standard rooms, we took a look and its very modernized recently renovated and very affordable!

Not a high end hotel, but great staff, very friendly and courteous. Room was nice size especially for Honolulu and everything was very clean. Appears they have recently updated as rooms were modern. Bed was comfy and room was fairly quiet. I prefer to stay at less expensive hotels and spend my money on other things. This is a great hotel for the money, less than $100 for the night. Very centrally located and walking distance to the beach. I'd stay here again.

Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff were great and our room was serviced impeccably everyday. Room size (standard king) was ample. Nice view from our lanais.Able to use the pool at the Ohana Waikiki West (5mins down the road) with pool towels provided.Couldn't fault this place. Would love to stay again!!

I was absolutely overwhelmed by the accommodations we had at the Ohana Waikiki Malia.The personal were wonderful, from the front desk to the maids. If I need a place to stay next time I am in Waikiki I will first see if Ohana has a room.We came into Honolulu and had made a previous arrangement with another hotel in Waikiki. Upon arrival and seeing what we had arranged, we were very disappointed. We walked to the Ohana and they booked us rooms for the rest of our stay.We had everything we could possibly need with the exception of a Microwave. If we would have had access to a Microwave we could have had some light meals at the hotel.The "Pink" trolley was fantastic. We could get wherever we wanted to. Thanks for the wonderful stay!!!

Honestly for the first time my husband and I tried a "cheaper" option to be able to do more. I expected the rooms to be horrible but they were actually perfect for what we needed, a clean and comfortable place to sleep. I wouldn't say that there was anything extraordinary about the hotel itself, but the staff was so helpful and accommodating! I would stay again, affordable and nice.

We decided to stay here as the rooms had all been renovated and the price was really good. The room is very nice. Nice comfy bed, nice furniture and carpet. Looks exactly like what you see on the website. Right on Kuhio so bus across the street, ABC Stores and shopping all around. Freindly staff and really sweet housekeeper...always smiling and welcome you every time she sees you...desk staff all nice and friendly too!!We stayed here nine nights and every one was great. No negative aspects to speak of. Since there is no pool at this Ohana you are able to get towels from front desk and go to either the WEST, EAST or BEACHCOMBER sister hotels and use the facilities they have to offer. I thought this was awesome...lots of different poolside drinks and snacks and people and well it made it more fun to have all these places at your disposal...we recommended this hotel to some friends and they had nothing but positive things to say as well.. We are going back in October and the Malia is probably where we will stay again...great value for a very comfy room and convenient location.

I spent 9 long nights at the Ohana Waikiki Malia hotel from May 25-June 3rd. The people at the front desk were really nice and polite but they don't talk to you unless you talk to them first. In reality, there is nothing happening at this hotel so, if all you want is a place to crash after a long day of tours, shopping and running around, this is the place to go. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Water pressure was also very good if you need a nice warm bath before going to bed after a long day at the beach. However, I didn't like the musky smell in the lobby. Nevertheless, after 3 days at the Malia, I didn't know the difference; perhaps I got use to the stench. The towels, even though were very clean, smelled like cheap detergent. It also took me a while to get rid of the smell and so you need a good lotion after taking a bath. Other than that, there is nothing happening, no great benefits, no perks, no restaurants, no room service, and nothing fancy or expensive. You get what you pay for. I would definitely not go back to this hotel at all because I like to have a great bed, fancy sheets, room service, and my towels have to smell great. It was kind of boring for me because I always like to stay at expensive hotels. Unfortunately, my friend was on a budget and so I had no other choice but to stay at this hotel. As I said, if money is an issue and you don't care about the smell of cheap detergent, then go and stay at the Malia.

I stayed here for a week w/ a friend while on vacation. I have to say that I was really expecting it to be a dump, but was glad to see that our room was pretty nice refurbished. The staff were quite friendly and helpful although they could not recommend a good sushi place w/ in walking distance....hello! Waikiki has some of the best sushi...but ok. They had beach towels available for us everyday, parking is really pricey but that is all of Honolulu and the room was very comfortable but no goose down pillows or covers. The view was of another hotel but location wise, could not have been better. If you don't have a car, allot of the attractions have a free shuttle pick-up a block away at the Radisson; the beach is 2 blocks away and it is a really nice walk w/ shops and various restaurants.Would I stay there again? Probably not as I prefer to stay somewhere like the North Shore and a private vacation home. Being that I live in South Beach, Honolulu & Waikiki Beach were just too commercial w/ a Japanese flair and I prefer more of the local scenes when traveling.

I stayed at this hotel twice last month. First time I stayed there I went by taxi from the Honolulu airport and it cost me 34 dollars. When I checked in they charged me 74 dollars a night. With tax it was 84 dollars. I had to pay a 250 dollars deposit though because I did not want to use my credit card. I stayed there four nights. A very friendly staff. They have plenty of security there. Also you have to swipe your room card for the elevator to run. I was on the 11th floor. Has television, air conditioning, telephone, frige, really soft bed with five pillows. Very quiet rooms. Very clean bathrooms. They provide soap and shampoo. (No microwave oven though) They have s small balcony to step out onto. When you open the glass door to the balcony, the air conditioning turns off. Also never close the balcony glass door when you step out onto the balcony, or you will be locked out! You can see so much of the city of Waikiki, if your high enough up. Only took me 15 minutes to walk to the beach. There are plenty of resturants and fast food joints in walking distant to the hotel. Plenty of ABC stores around. Also has a number of small mall's nearby. The walking distant to the zoo is only about 20 minutes. Your only about two minutes walking distant from the bus stop. There are also lot's of trolly's that you can ride on for a price. Second time I traveled there from the Honolulu airport, after spending a few days on Kauai and then one day on the big island, I got wise, and took a shuttle and it only cost me 7 dollars. I did give the driver a tip of course. This time they only charged me a 50 dollar desposit. I stayed five more nights and then left. I will return to this hotel the next time I return to Waikiki.
Great hotel for the money.

Stayed for 9 days at Ohana Malia. It is located in a very central part of the Waikiki Beach strip which is a really good thing if you would prefer to walk or take a trolley or bus to nearby attractions. Outside on the balcony tends to be a lot of street noise, expected since it's in the middle of a city. We got a room close to the top of the hotel and didn't notice any with the balcony door closed. Hotel staff was friendly, and the rate was also great for airline employees. Would do it again!

My husband and I stayed here for 6 days. This was such a pleasant hotel and the staff was extremely friendly. The rooms were recently refurbished so they were clean, bed was comfortable and we really enjoyed our stay. We will definitely stay here again.

Mother and daughter had another breathtaking vay-k in beautiful Hawaii nei. Ohana Malia was convenient, very clean and comfortable, courteous staff and fit our 'budget' perfectly. We always enjoy our trips to this unbelievably gorgeous island. We enjoy the music, people, culture, scenery, and da food. Fresh beach towels are available at the front desk and are a welcomed extra. Also, appreciated the free in-room safe. We were on 11th floor and the street noise of those that party hardy can wake you in the wee hours; but we've stayed at numerous hotels and the street noise is part of Waikiki because of the partiers, cars, buses, trollies, trucks, etc. While awake, we always had our lanai door open to enjoy the fresh air of the tradewinds. Stores, shops and restaurants are all around - definitely look through the coupon books and brochures for even more 2for1s and discounts on about everything. ALOHA!

Staff very good and friendlyRoom small but very new and niceLanai very small with street view which is noise at night because of echo problem has to shut lanai door and pull curtains at nightI hv stayed on 5th and 14 fl noise same problemEasy and convienent walk to beachHotel is at the best end of the beach areaWe had a 10p flt but hotel kept our bags and gave us a nice rm to shower and change in for free

If we had been staying in a remodeled room the rate would have been a deal. We however, were booked into a room with stained carpet, musty odors and bed spreads that were in style when Elvis last visited the Islands. Our air conditioner didn't work when the ceiling light wasn't turned on at the wall so to sleep we had to unscrew the bulb. In Hawaiian Ohana means family, this hotel is just one more reason Never to do business with family.

Ohana Malia Had a very friendly staff, the rooms were clean. Great location for shopping, a quick walk to beach. Free transportation on the Trolly by just showing your room key. Trolly drops you off right infront od Dukes Statue on Waikiki Beach, Or better it drops you off at Ala Moana Shopping mall..I would stay at Ohana Malia Again.

I stayed here while on the ''business'' of seeing doctors...the staff were great, I completely freaked out about getting through torn up street repairs and detours to be at my appointment on time, and they drew me an idiot-proof map...the room was perfect, pastel colours, lovely decorations, fab cumfy bed and pillows, big flat tv, internet connect in the room; comfortable, clean, same with the bathroom, fridge for my Rx. it was great that IHOP was just off the lobby; good simple healthy food, just what an ailing body needs. I will be back next week and have found my base for doctor visits, which takes the big stress out of the trip! and the garage is right there too, no parking worries, $18 fro 24 hours, come and go as you like. :) I was in a standard room but there are other rooms with complete kitchenettes which I didn't need. I would think it would be a good place for tourists who may want the cooking option. They do not have a pool but you can use their other hotels.

Bottom line – if you are on a budget this hotel should be exactly what you are looking for.I travel for both business and leisure and stay at a VERY broad range of hotels from 5 all the way down to hostel. Personally I love the diversity. MOST of the time when traveling for pleasure I try and cut down on my cost (hotel & car) so I can use my dollar’s for other more ‘interesting’ things. This trip was no different, although it was a VERY special for me and I wanted to try a combo pack - so I booked the Ohana Malia for the first 3 nights and another hotel that is rated much higher on Trip Advisor (Top 5) for the last 3 nights. I do not want to give away what hotel it was because the hotel and especially the staff were phenomenal and the hotel has earned the right to be at the top of the trip advisor list. For me staff plays a minor role in the overall experience of my stay. I GENERALLY have very little interaction with the staff and when reading reviews tend to dismiss remarks both pro and con about hotel staff. If I would have known in advance how nice this hotel was I would have just stayed here the entire trip and never moved hotels to my ‘upgraded room’Things to know:Parking at most all hotels in Wakiki is extra so make sure you factor that in when you are booking your room. This hotel is no different although two blocks away there is free parking on a major road called the Ala Wai. But be careful - on two days of the week there is no parking between certain hours and if you do not read the signs then your car will be towed. You will also have to make the block a few times because parking can be hard to find.There are night clubs near by and depending on what side of the hotel you are on if you have the window open to let in fresh air you will be able to hear people getting there drink on. But most hotels are like this on Wakiki, the weather is amazing so people are out and about enjoying it.
Great service,housekeeping,very secure, and excellent location!

We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights at $79.00 a night. It was superb. Room was clean, modern and spacious. We had a small fridge, which was all we needed, free trolley travel throughout Waikiki, a complimentary beach bag and the loan of beach towels (free). This particular hotel has no pool but guests have access to the pools at any of the other 3 Ohana hotels. We did not use the pools. The service was excellent and breakfast was available for $10 per person extra at the IHOP attached to the hotel. Not liking, the IHOP, we ate at a small cafe across the street. It cost us $10 each. I would highly recommend this hotel.

We enjoyed our stay at the Ohana Waikiki Malia. The room and staff were excellent. We were close to the other Ohana hotels so we went there to swim. The nice surprise was finding out that all local and long distance calls to the U.S. and Canada were FREE. That was very handy when booking tickets and rental cars. The location was nice and convenient. Even though this hotel did not have a pool, it was no big deal to walk to the other hotels. The free use of the 'pink' line shuttle was a nice perk as well.

if you are looking for value, but need those little extras like me, this is a great spot. Great location, just remodeled-looks just like the photo, friendly staff, refrigerator, coffeemaker, iron, lanaii, fresh air, secure and an in room safe. It is not deluxe but the beds are very comfortable and the TV is a new flatscreen. All the bells and whistles (pool is located at another Ohana-but that's kind of fun) for a really good price and clean, too!

After I stayed a few days in Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa I was desperate for a quieter place. I checked the 1-bedroom rooms in Ohana East - which I really liked. But when I (phone) booked them they were not available and the phone lady recommended Ohana Malia.The room was large and good for 4 people. The living room had 2 beds - perfect for us. Furniture looked nice, room was clean. We were on the 9th floor and it was reasonable quiet. Finally we got some good sleep after the noisy Aqua Hotel.A few more points:Location: Right next to the DFS shoppers place. 5 Minutes to the Waikiki beach.Lobby: A bit dark, nothing fancy there.Staff: Friendly and helpful.Food: Our room had no breakfast and i am not sure the hotel even has a breakfast place. Right next door is the 'Ihop' Restaurant, which is a bit smelly and has mediocre food. At least it's cheap. I went for breakfast a few blocks down to the 'Saint Germaine' bakery which had fresh baguette in the morning. I would probably stay there again.

We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights with a group of high school students attending a robotics competition at the University of Hawaii. We checked into this hotel after a bad experience for one night at another property. The front desk staff was very helpful. It was in a perfect location, walking distance to all attractions. Rooms were well appointed, modern, and recently renovated.I would highly recomend this hotel to all. One drawback is the lack of a pool...However, you can use the pool at any of their sister properties.

I love this hotel. It has been renovated in a way that I like very much...simply and tastefully.The colors and artwork are pleasingly Hawaiian. Roy and Troy at the front desk know what it is to take care of their guests and make you feel good. I like being set back a bit from the water and all the action. Walking is what you do in Waikiki...you are in the heart of it all in two minutes. Grab something from Starbucks and start your day. We rented a car, but you really don't need one, unless you want to drive to the North Shore.

Just got back home from a week's stay at the Ohana Waikiki Malia. The hotel is nice,newly renovated, clean and great location,personally. There is an IHop at the hotel if your into that kind of thing, a McDonalds, Starbucks, L&L BBQ,Int'l Market among other things are within a block. The beach is 3 blocks away walking down Lewers St. Short walking distance to the Outrigger Reef for their $ 3.00 Mai Tais....Excellent! ( 12-5 only )Free ride on the Pink Line trolly which you can catch behind the hotel. All the bus stops are on Kuhio which is where the hotel is located. My friend and I actually walked/hiked from the hotel all the way to the top of diamond head and walked back the other way around the crater towards the beach side and ended up on the main street which is Kalakaua Avenue and back to Kuhio Street to the hotel. It was around 7 miles round trip but an easy walk. We did this twice and left at 5:30am and got back to the hotel close to 10. Excellent trail and view in the other side of diamond head towards the light house.Our room was big and clean. Small balcony but can't complain. There was a small opening in the horizon between 2 buildings where you can see the ocean and the sun literally set right in between. Our room number was 1019. Also free wi-fi but in the lobby ony which was fine with me.The things that I didn't like much is the slow elevators. Somehow,they take forever but I guess why rush, your in Hawaii. Also, there is not much channels on the tv but who stays in their room in hawaii on a vacation? The worst thing I can say about this hotel is that it does get loud in there. It seems like the walls are very thin. We can hear all these girls next door laughing,talking. The front door is a little too high off the ground, so you can hear the noise from the hallway. Especially all the drunk party people who are just coming home at 2-4 in the morning. Fortunately for us, we heard if only 3 times out of the week we were there.I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a very reasonable rate with a great location, clean and comfortable room. Also, you can use the pool of their sister hotels like the Ohana East, Ohana West and the Ohana Beachcomber. We went to the latter one. Pretty good size, lots of lounge chairs, right on the main strip with a Jimmy Buffet bar/restaurant on the spot. We had a great time. Can't wait to the next one! Enjoy

OHANA Waikiki Malia is a very good place to stay from any point of view. It is just within a few minutes walk from the Waikiki beach, and there are many shops, cafes and restaurants around. Right next to the hotel there is a bus stop, frequently serviced by a handful of routes that will take you virtually anywhere for just $2.25: to the downtown Honolulu, Pearl Harbor, O'Ahu botanical gardens (I would especially recommend visiting Koko Head garden and Ho'omaluhia botanical garden), Sea Life, Waikiki Aquaruim, Diamond Head crater, Sunny Beach or wherever you wish to go. And yes, you can take bus routes 19 or 20 from and to the airport. 4 day unlimited bus pass is $25 and is available at all the ABC stores.The hotel is very clean and safe (moreover, the rooms have digital safes for your valuables and documents, just to make you 100% sure everything is secure and ease your mind), the staff is helpful and friendly. They offer wired internet access in the rooms — you might think a wireless solution would be better, but their internet is way faster than the wireless I saw in other places. And there will be a patchcord for your convenience if you don't have yours.If you, like me, are worrying about bedbugs and suchlike, which is not unheard of on Hawaii, rest assured: there are none here. I have not seen a single insect of whatever kind during my whole stay at any place in Waikiki Malia. In your room you will find a coffee machine which can brew you 2 or 3 full cups (4 if not filled to the brim) of local Hawaiian coffee (1 filter bag provided daily, so are cups, sugar etc). You will also get a small fridge to store your drinks and snacks if you so desire.Sleeping is Waikiki Malia is a pleasant experience, though I personally had a few days in the beginning of my stay when the winds were very strong in the nightime, so the balcony door gave knocking sounds, being a bit loose in its frame, when a surge of wind came by.
